bug.title: getActions() returns same instance for different Things
bug.body: See https://community.openhab.org/t/openhab2-mqtt2-binding-multiple-brokers/62061 - if `getActions()` is called, it should have a different instance for different Things, which is currently not the case.

bug.title: [MQTT] brokerId must be a configuration parameter of a broker
bug.body: In ESH, EVERY thing/bridge must have at least one configuration parameter. The instance must NOT be determined by the ThingUID. The MQTT Broker type is incorrectly modelled. `AbstractBrokerHandler` does a ``` this.brokerID = thing.getUID().getId(); ``` Instead, this id must be taken from the Thing configuration (and thus must be declared in the config descriptions).

bug.title: Embedded MQTT broker is found multiple times
bug.body: @davidgraeff I would expect only a single entry (the last one). This could probably be avoided if the network discovery were removed (see also https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/6598):

bug.title: MQTT NetworkDiscoveryService spams log and creates an abundance of threads
bug.body: @davidgraeff Just tried the MQTT binding for the first time. First UX: My log is spammed with hundreds of lines like: ``` 14:41:57.570 INFO o.e.s.i.t.m.MqttBrokerConnection[:720] - Starting MQTT broker connection to '192.168.3.225' with clientid testssl and file store 'userdata/mqtt/192.168.3.225' 14:41:57.573 INFO o.e.s.i.t.m.MqttBrokerConnection[:720] - Starting MQTT broker connection to '192.168.3.225' with clientid test and file store 'userdata/mqtt/192.168.3.225' 14:41:57.576 INFO o.e.s.i.t.m.MqttBrokerConnection[:720] - Starting MQTT broker connection to '192.168.3.226' with clientid testssl and file store 'userdata/mqtt/192.168.3.226' 14:41:57.579 INFO o.e.s.i.t.m.MqttBrokerConnection[:720] - Starting MQTT broker connection to '192.168.3.226' with clientid test and file store 'userdata/mqtt/192.168.3.226' 14:41:57.582 INFO o.e.s.i.t.m.MqttBrokerConnection[:720] - Starting MQTT broker connection to '192.168.3.227' with clientid testssl and file store 'userdata/mqtt/192.168.3.227' ``` Could this be done as DEBUG...? Next, it seems that the service does not use a thread pool: ![screenshot 2018-11-29 at 14 52 15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3244965/49226270-6bb74280-f3e6-11e8-95fa-0714d4e4ed1d.png) Could that be changed to be done through a named thread pool (using `ThreadPoolManager`)? And the worst thing: All those threads keep running after a discovery. As a result, after the 3rd network scan (and >4000 live threads), I am getting ``` 15:00:02.407 WARN o.e.s.c.i.c.WrappedScheduledExecutorService[:67] - Scheduled runnable ended with an exception: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: unable to create new native thread at java.lang.Thread.start0(Native Method) at java.lang.Thread.start(Thread.java:714) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.addWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:950) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.ensurePrestart(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1587) at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.reExecutePeriodic(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:350) at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:296) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) ```

bug.title: Adding of Items of groupType 'None' produces 500 response
bug.body: Hi, since I've changed to the unstable repo on Ubunutu (https://dl.bintray.com/openhab/apt-repo2) and updated openHAB I cannot create item groups in PaperUI with base type 'None'. The response from server is 500. **Request:** `PUT /rest/items/test HTTP/1.1` `Host: <openhab-server>` `User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:63.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/63.0` `Accept: application/json, text/plain, */*` `Accept-Language: de,en-US;q=0.7,en;q=0.3` `Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate` `Referer: http://<openhab-server>/paperui/index.html` `Content-Type: application/json;charset=utf-8` `Content-Length: 95` `DNT: 1` ` ` `{"editable":true,"groupNames":[],"type":"Group","metadata":{},"name":"test","groupType":"None"}` **Response** `HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error` `Content-Type: application/json` `Content-Length: 246` `Server: Jetty(9.3.21.v20170918)` ` ` `{"error":{"message":"No item factory could handle type None","http-code":500,"exception":{"class":"java.lang.IllegalStateException","message":"No item factory could handle type None","localized-message":"No item factory could handle type None"}}}` **Version** `# dpkg -l | grep openhab` `ii openhab2 2.4.0~M2-1 all openhab2` This is a duplicate of https://github.com/openhab/openhab-core/issues/438, because it was initially placed in the wrong repo. Adding group items with 'Base Type' (parameter name in PaperUI) 'None' was possible before my last updates. I've added a bunch of them and always defined 'None' for each group. Cheers, svs

bug.title: Paper UI: rule editor, item selection
bug.body: I used: * I used the "SmartHome-Runtime" launch configuration with automation modules added * no things, rules, persistence DSL file * an items DSL file with content ``` Switch in Switch out ``` * I am going to create a new Rule: http://127.0.0.1:8080/paperui/index.html#/rules/new * add trigger: an item receives a command * the item selection looks like: ``` () () ``` The items has no further information assigned, but can't we * show the item name if the label is null * don't add "()" if there is no information to add between the braces After that I changed the items DSL file to that content ``` Switch in "IN" Switch out "OUT" ``` the item selection looks like: ``` IN () OUT () ``` If I select "IN ()" the drop down list dissapears and the field that should contain the selections contains "OUT ()". I am not able to select "IN ()". Why?

bug.title: [mqtt-things] Homie device doesn't update its read-only channel
bug.body: Hi @davidgraeff! Sorry for bothering you again, but I think that I have found a bug in the mqtt-things binding. As you know, I'm using this script to test my "virtual" Homie 3.0 devices: ```python import random import time import paho.mqtt.client as mqtt mqtt_broker_host = "localhost" mqtt_broker_port = 1883 mqtt_client_id = "homie_3.0_temperature_sensor" mqtt_client_keepalive = 60 homie_prefix = "homie" homie_version = "3.0.0" homie_device_id = "homie-3-temperature-sensor" homie_device_name = "Homie 3.0 Temperature sensor" homie_device_ip = "192.168.1.150" homie_device_mac = "DE:AD:BE:EF:FE:ED" homie_device_nodes = ["temperature"] homie_device_state = None def publish_homie_version(client): topic = "{}/{}/{}".format(homie_prefix, homie_device_id, "$homie") client.publish(topic, homie_version, 1, True) def advertize_device(): client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$state", "init", 1, True) publish_device_info() publish_node_info() client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$state", "ready", 1, True) def publish_device_info(): client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$homie", homie_version, 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$name", homie_device_name, 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$localip", homie_device_ip, 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$mac", homie_device_mac, 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$fw/name", "sensor-firmware", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$fw/version", "1.0.0", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$nodes", "temperature", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$implementation", "homie-python", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$stats/interval", "60", 1, True) def publish_node_info(): client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/$name", "Indoor temperature", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/$type", "Temperature", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/$properties", "temperature", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature", 23, 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature/$name", "Indoor temperature", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature/$settable", "false", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature/$unit", "ºC", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature/$datatype", "float", 1, True) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature/$format", "-20:120", 1, True) def on_connect(client, userdata, flags, rc): print("Connected with result code {}".format(rc)) advertize_device() def on_message(client, userdata, msg): print("{} -> {}".format(msg.topic, msg.payload)) def loop(): last_temperature_time = 0 while True: if (time.time() - last_temperature_time) > 5: temperature_value = random.uniform(20,25) print("Sending tempertaure value: {0:.2f}ºC".format(temperature_value)) client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature", "{0:.2f}".format(temperature_value), 1, True) last_temperature_time = time.time() time.sleep(1) client = mqtt.Client(mqtt_client_id) client.on_connect = on_connect client.on_message = on_message client.will_set("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$state", "lost", 1, True) client.connect(mqtt_broker_host, mqtt_broker_port, mqtt_client_keepalive) client.loop_start() try: loop() except KeyboardInterrupt: print("Stopping client") client.publish("homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/$state", "disconnected", 1, True) client.disconnect() client.loop_stop() ``` The device is discovery perfectly and the thing is imported flawlessly, with its "Indoor temperature" channel. The problem is that, although the script is configured to send a new temperature value each 5 seconds (a random value between 20 and 25), the item is never updated and I can see the following message in the karaf console: ``` 13:48:38.718 [WARN ] [ng.mqtt.generic.internal.ChannelState] - Received MQTT data on homie/homie-3-temperature-sensor/temperature/temperature. This channel is read only! ``` If the Homie property is read-only (not settable), the binding should not subscribe to the "/set" topic, but in this case the binding is blocking the "common" state topic. Are you aware of this problem? Otherwise, I haven't encountered any problem, awesome work! Best regards and keep up with the good job, Aitor

bug.title: Paper UI: Configuration => Bindings is no more displaying the supported things
bug.body: I just moved to OH snapshot 1389 and I discovered that in Paper UI, when clicking on a binding, it only displayed a description and the author. Until recently, I think we got the list of supported things.

bug.title: [Automation] ItemStateChangeTrigger misfires
bug.body: I rely on nested groups with functions for much of my automation, and had essentially changed all my triggers over to GenericEventTriggers due to this issue, but I was wanting to use some item state change events. I've been chasing my tail on this for months, but I think I've gotten close to finding the cause. With this item/group structure, the ItemStateChangeTrigger will fire 3 times when the item state changes... once for the item and once for each group. ItemStateUpdateTrigger does not have this issue. The group function seems to be related to the issue, and this is the simplest way I've found to reproduce the problem. I'm still looking into this, but thought I'd post it in case this is a known issue, or if one of the devs can spot something quicker than I can (very likely). https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/master/bundles/automation/org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.module.core/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/automation/module/core/handler/ItemStateTriggerHandler.java ``` Group:Switch:OR(ON,OFF) gTest_Parent "Test Parent Group [%s]" <none> (gTest) Group:Switch:OR(ON,OFF) gChild_1 "Test Child Group 1 [%s]" <none> (gTest_Parent) Switch Test_Switch_1 "Test Switch 1 [%s]" <switch> (gChild_1,gTest_Parent) ``` ``` 'use strict'; var log= Java.type("org.slf4j.LoggerFactory").getLogger("org.eclipse.smarthome.model.script.Rules"); scriptExtension.importPreset("RuleSupport"); scriptExtension.importPreset("RuleSimple"); var testRule1 = new SimpleRule() { execute: function( module, input) { log.debug("JSR223: JS: Test Rule 1: [" + input['event'].itemName + "]: [" + input['event'].itemState + "]"); } }; testRule1.setTriggers([ TriggerBuilder.create() .withId("TestTrigger1") .withTypeUID("core.ItemStateChangeTrigger") .withConfiguration( new Configuration({ "itemName": "Test_Switch_1" })).build() ]); automationManager.addRule(testRule1); ``` **Log result:** ``` 2018-10-05 06:45:46.755 [DEBUG] [org.eclipse.smarthome.model.script.Rules] - JSR223: JS: Test Rule 1: [Test_Switch_1]: [OFF] 2018-10-05 06:45:46.760 [DEBUG] [org.eclipse.smarthome.model.script.Rules] - JSR223: JS: Test Rule 1: [gChild_1]: [OFF] 2018-10-05 06:45:46.780 [DEBUG] [org.eclipse.smarthome.model.script.Rules] - bug.title: [HomeMatic / Paper UI] Thing status is not correctly updated in Paper UI
bug.body: This problem does not happen for every status change but I could see and reproduce it very often. I tested it with the HomeMatic Bridge thing. I have discovered the problem the first time when I added a new Bridge thing. I could see on the Karaf console that the state switched from INITIALIZING to ONLINE but the thing status was not automatically updated in Paper UI. I had to refresh the page with F5. I was able to reproduce the problem by simply restarting the CCU. In the screenshot you can see that the status changed to OFFLINE but the badge in Paper UI shows ONLINE: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/616792/46467831-10464b00-c7cf-11e8-9680-db69da9fcb6e.png) Test environment: - openHAB 2.4 M4 on Windows 10 and Ubuntu 18.04 (same behavior on both systems), Java 1.8 - Chrome 69 on Windows - My "CCU" is a Raspberry running Raspberrymatic 3.37.8.20180929

bug.title: Bose Soundtouch: Not able to update notification through PaperUI
bug.body: Hi, for my Bose Soundtouch speaker, I can see the notification channel in the PaperUI Control panel, but I am not able to set a value, even though I should be able to send a URL to the speaker: ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3878009/46371438-a6bc2480-c688-11e8-88d9-33a76ccf8132.png) Shouldn't I be able to set a string value? The channel is not marked as readonly in the channels.xml. Any idea what could be wrong?

bug.title: Brightness issue in Hue binding (and others)
bug.body: Some users reported an issue when changing the brightness via the `color` channel for Hue bulbs of thing type `210`. It automatically switched to a value of `100` even if a lower percentage was sent (e.g. `sendCommand(“0,60,62”)`). See https://community.openhab.org/t/solved-brightness-issue-philips-hue/52075/ for more information. My first guess was a connection to PR #5946. After some further testing I found a problem with the forward and reverse transformation from HSB to XY and back - which seem not to result in the origin values. I wrote a small unit test: ```java @Test public void testHSBtoXYequalsXYtoHSB() { HSBType hsb = new HSBType("0,60,62"); PercentType[] xy = hsb.toXY(); assertEquals(new PercentType("50.27254"), xy[0]); assertEquals(new PercentType("32.956394"), xy[1]); assertEquals(hsb, HSBType.fromXY(xy[0].floatValue() / 100.0f, xy[1].floatValue() / 100.0f)); } ``` And it failed: ```java Failed tests: HSBTypeTest.testHSBtoXYequalsXYtoHSB:136 expected:<0,60,62> but was:<0,60,100> ``` As I am not an expert in color space conversions any kind of help is appreciated.

bug.title: PaperUI: Context "thing" with limitToOptions=true does not work
bug.body: If a ConfigDescription has a parameter that has the `context` "thing", PaperUI renders a nice drop down of all available things. However it should be possible to offer options and limit the list of things to these given options. At the moment, PaperUI simply ignores the given options and the `limitToOptions=true` setting and lists all available things.

bug.title: GroupFunction name EQUAL or EQUALITY?
bug.body: Found this in my log: ``` 12:46:50.961 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ItemStateChangedEvent] - Sun_Elevation changed from 32.911390868338536 to 32.82965662193761 12:46:51.096 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ItemStateChangedEvent] - Moon_Azimuth changed from 54.55240850571265 to 54.80388014618922 12:46:51.099 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ItemStateChangedEvent] - Moon_Elevation changed from -36.231753744300484 to -36.1101579166758 12:46:52.752 [ERROR] [re.internal.items.GroupFunctionHelper] - Unknown group function 'EQUALITY'. Using Equality instead. 12:46:54.390 [ERROR] [re.internal.items.GroupFunctionHelper] - Unknown group function 'EQUALITY'. Using Equality instead. 12:46:56.025 [ERROR] [re.internal.items.GroupFunctionHelper] - Unknown group function 'EQUALITY'. Using Equality instead. ``` Unfortunately, there is no stacktrace provided, so I cannot see where this might come from. In `GroupFunctionHelper` I can see that only the name `EQUAL` is expected there, while [our documentation](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/master/docs/documentation/concepts/items.md#derive-group-state-from-member-items) talks about `EQUALITY`. Something does not seem to be consistent here...

bug.title: An error occurred while calling method 'EventSubscriber.receive()'
bug.body: OH snapshot 1361 (same on 1360 too) ESH 0.10.0.201809111909 When the Auto Update option has not been selected for a managed item, the following error will occur when manipulating the item, and any linked channels are not updated. An item can be created without choosing an Auto Update option, and it's a new field, so previously created items would not have it populated either. ``` 2018-09-13 12:48:56.985 [ERROR] [org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.common.AbstractInvocationHandler] - An error occurred while calling method 'EventSubscriber.receive()' on 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.CommunicationManager@ad062db': null java.lang.NullPointerException: null at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.AutoUpdateManager.receiveCommand(AutoUpdateManager.java:141) [114:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.CommunicationManager.receiveCommand(CommunicationManager.java:266) [114:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.CommunicationManager.receive(CommunicationManager.java:145) [114:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.10.0.201809111909] at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor16.invoke(Unknown Source) ~[?:?] at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) ~[?:?] at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) ~[?:?] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.common.AbstractInvocationHandler.invokeDirect(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:153) [108:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.common.Invocation.call(Invocation.java:53) [108:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.10.0.201809111909] at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) [?:?] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149) [?:?] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624) [?:?] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748) [?:?] 2018-09-13 12:48:57.003 [ERROR] [org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.events.EventHandler] - Dispatching/filtering event for subscriber 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.events.EventSubscriber' failed: null java.lang.NullPointerException: null at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.AutoUpdateManager.receiveCommand(AutoUpdateManager.java:141) [114:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.CommunicationManager.receiveCommand(CommunicationManager.java:266) [114:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.CommunicationManager.receive(CommunicationManager.java:145) [114:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.10.0.201809111909] at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor16.invoke(Unknown Source) ~[?:?] at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) ~[?:?] at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) ~[?:?] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.common.AbstractInvocationHandler.invokeDirect(AbstractInvocationHandler.java:153) [108:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.common.Invocation.call(Invocation.java:53) [108:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.10.0.201809111909] at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) [?:?] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149) [?:?] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624) [?:?] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748) [?:?] ``` More discussion here... https://community.openhab.org/t/new-zwave-device-fails-attempts-to-fix-leads-to-all-new-thing-names-breaking-item-links-and-rules/51326/25?u=5iver Possibly related to this issue, items were very laggy after an OH restart, and then all became unresponsive. After about 15 minutes, everything came back and responded as normal. Another user reported the same in the forum thread linked above.

bug.title: Exception during AutomaticInboxProcessor component activation
bug.body: This is from my logs: ``` 13:26:18.233 [ERROR] [rg.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery] - [org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor(222)] The activate method has thrown an exception java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.DiscoveryResultImpl cannot be cast to org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.DiscoveryResult at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:174) [?:?] at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListSpliterator.forEachRemaining(ArrayList.java:1374) [?:?] at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481) [?:?] at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471) [?:?] at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708) [?:?] at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.evaluate(AbstractPipeline.java:234) [?:?] at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline.collect(ReferencePipeline.java:499) [?:?] at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.PersistentInbox.getAll(PersistentInbox.java:295) [90:org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor.autoApproveInboxEntries(AutomaticInboxProcessor.java:230) [90:org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery:0.10.0.201809111909] at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor.activate(AutomaticInboxProcessor.java:249) [90:org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery:0.10.0.201809111909] ``` Looks like some lifecycle issue as this happened during bundle updates.

bug.title: Paper UI: select a location in the map
bug.body: In Paper UI, it would be cool for a location setting to be able to select the location from the map rather than having the map only to display the position entered as a lat/lon. Would it be possible ?

bug.title: Paper UI: config parameter of type integer with options not working as expected
bug.body:
The Z-Wave binding is defining such configuration parameters: ```

Overview

0 = Disable

1 min - 1439 min = Auto report periodically

]]> 0 false ``` When opening the configuration page in Paper UI, I can enter 60 as value for this parameter. But then when I click on the save button, I can see in Firefox that the REST API is called with 0 for this parameter config_6_2. So my entered value is ignored by Paper UI. Maybe it is relative to a combination of options, limitToOptions property and min/max definition ?

bug.title: Item with unit can be changed only once in PaperUI
bug.body: I have an item in PaperUI connected with a channel of type `Number:Temperature` (with unit in Celsius). I can edit the item from PaperUI > Control and change the number (temperature), but once I click the check mark to confirm the change and the item is changed (which is reflected in the binding logs), then the item cannot be changed anymore: the UI does not allow me to change the value. Only by refreshing the page in the browser (F5) I can then change the value again. See a small video of the current wrong behavior below: ![numberitem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12682715/44287205-4013b080-a26c-11e8-8a88-75a44fdfdfad.gif) (shown in the video: after the first change the item cannot be changed anymore until page refresh). Tested with Chrome v68 and Firefox. No error is reported on the Chrome developer console. The problem is present in both openHAB 2.3 and 2.4. The item is attached to the the following channel: ``` <channel-type id="setpointTemperature"> <item-type>Number:Temperature</item-type> <label>Setpoint Temperature</label> <description>The setpoint temperature</description> <category>Temperature</category> <tags> <tag>TargetTemperature</tag> </tags> <state pattern="%.1f %unit%" step="0.5" /> </channel-type> ```

bug.title: Circular reference: MDNSClient/NetworkAddressService

bug.title: Nightly Builds fail due to systemwide channeltype tests
bug.body: This tests only works randomly, because the installed test bundle does not provide any german translation for the battery channel... https://ci.eclipse.org/smarthome/job/SmartHomeDistribution-Nightly/2883 ``` Error Message expected:<Niedriger Batteriestatus> but was:<null> Stacktrace java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<Niedriger Batteriestatus> but was:<null> at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88) at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:834) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:144) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.xml.test.SystemWideChannelTypesTest.systemChannelsShouldTranslateProperly(SystemWideChannelTypesTest.java:202) ``` These 2 other tests use the `ChannelTypeRegistry` which relies on the `ChannelTypeProvider`s. If the `DefaultSystemChannelTypeProvider` has not been registered, it returns empty collections for the channels. https://ci.eclipse.org/smarthome/job/SmartHomeDistribution-Nightly/2878 ``` Error Message expected:<23> but was:<0> Stacktrace java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<23> but was:<0> at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88) at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:834) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:645) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:631) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.SystemWideChannelTypesTest.systemChannelTypesShouldBeAvailable(SystemWideChannelTypesTest.java:79) ``` https://ci.eclipse.org/smarthome/job/SmartHomeDistribution-Nightly/2880 ``` Error Message expected:<23> but was:<0> Stacktrace java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<23> but was:<0> at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88) at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:834) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:645) at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:631) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.SystemWideChannelTypesTest.systemChannelTypesShouldBeTranslatedProperly(SystemWideChannelTypesTest.java:109) ``` Testing the `DefaultSystemChannelTypeProvider` directly obviously makes more sense.

bug.title: NPE in PersistentInbox
bug.body: We encountered a Nullpointer-Exception in `PersistentInbox` which prevents `org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor` component activation as it is thrown in a method called by the activate method. [SCR] Exception while activating instance org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor@fc49e9 of component org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor [...] Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException -- at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.PersistentInbox.stream(PersistentInbox.java:303) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.PersistentInbox.getAll(PersistentInbox.java:297) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor.autoApproveInboxEntries(AutomaticInboxProcessor.java:230) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.AutomaticInboxProcessor.activate(AutomaticInboxProcessor.java:249) ... 63 more

bug.title: MQTT broker ignores secure settings
bug.body: While https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/d28ea636733021512b9fff608432ac48f1f65570/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.mqtt/ESH-INF/thing/thing-types.xml#L26-L36 defines a `secure` config parameter, the handler ignores it when creating a connection https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/d28ea636733021512b9fff608432ac48f1f65570/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.mqtt/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/binding/mqtt/handler/BrokerHandler.java#L180 Also, the corresponding type in https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/d28ea636733021512b9fff608432ac48f1f65570/bundles/io/org.eclipse.smarthome.io.transport.mqtt/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/io/transport/mqtt/MqttBrokerConnectionConfig.java#L29 does not match the thing type definition. @davidgraeff could you please have a look?

bug.title: Rule deserialization is brоken
bug.body: When I import a rule the `defaultValue` for config description parameters is missing. The reason is that gson is watching the name of the field which is `default` in the `.json` definition but it is `defaultValue` in `ConfigDescriptionParameterDTO`. In this way we have a broken `RuleDTO` object before the mapping from `RuleDTO` to `Rule`

bug.title: The "silent" tag migration is conceptually broken
bug.body: The `ItemRegistryImpl` does a somewhat "silent" migration of tags from items where they were previously persisted into the metadata storage. However, this is conceptually flawed, as the tags remain persisted together with the item (as they were before #5431), i.e. if tags then are modified (especially removed) in the metadata, they will re-appear again after a restart. The following test-case illustrates this behavior: ```java @Test public void testReloadWithFormerlyPersistedTags() { prepareMetadata(ITEM_NAME, "foo"); prepareItem(ITEM_NAME, "bar"); // fake an item with previously persisted tag Object persistedObject = volatileStorageService.getStorage(Item.class.getName()).get(ITEM_NAME); ((PersistedItem) persistedObject).tags = Collections.singleton("bar"); itemRegistry.removeTag(ITEM_NAME, "bar"); assertEquals(1, itemRegistry.get(ITEM_NAME).getTags().size()); // simulate a "reboot" by unregistering & re-registering the volatile storage service unregisterService(StorageService.class.getName()); waitForAssert(() -> assertNull(itemRegistry.get(ITEM_NAME))); registerService(volatileStorageService, StorageService.class.getName()); waitForAssert(() -> assertNotNull(itemRegistry.get(ITEM_NAME))); Item item = itemRegistry.get(ITEM_NAME); assertEquals(1, item.getTags().size()); // <--- THIS IS WERE IT FAILS assertEquals("foo", item.getTags().iterator().next()); } ```

bug.title: Race condition between ManagedMetadataProvider and ItemRegistryImpl wrt tags
bug.body: It looks like there is a possible race condition between the `ManagedMetadataProvider` providing its content to the `MetadataRegistry` (including tags) and the `ItemRegistryImpl` doing the migration of tags which were previously persisted in the database: ``` 2018-07-06T15:11:47.132+0200 147 DEBUG [symbolicName=****, className=****] - Initializing new custom db with alias org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.Metadata 2018-07-06T15:11:47.247+0200 147 DEBUG [symbolicName=****, className=****] - Initializing new custom db with alias org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.Item 2018-07-06T15:11:47.963+0200 135 WARNING [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.core, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - Could not add element: Cannot add element, because an element with same UID (_tags:hz_1) already exists. java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot add element, because an element with same UID (_tags:hz_1) already exists. at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractManagedProvider.add(AbstractManagedProvider.java:56) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry.add(AbstractRegistry.java:222) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.items.ItemRegistryImpl.writeTags(ItemRegistryImpl.java:465) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.items.ItemRegistryImpl.addTags(ItemRegistryImpl.java:488) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.items.ItemRegistryImpl.onAddElement(ItemRegistryImpl.java:298) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.items.ItemRegistryImpl.onAddElement(ItemRegistryImpl.java:1) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry.addProvider(AbstractRegistry.java:305) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.items.ItemRegistryImpl.addProvider(ItemRegistryImpl.java:562) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry$ProviderTracker.addingService(AbstractRegistry.java:114) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry$ProviderTracker.addingService(AbstractRegistry.java:1) **** [several more of the warnings above] 2018-07-06T15:11:49.346+0200 135 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.core, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - Provider 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.ManagedItemProvider' has been added. 2018-07-06T15:11:49.464+0200 135 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.core, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - Provider 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.internal.items.ManagedMetadataProviderImpl' has been added. ```

bug.title: ScriptExtensionManager.get("voice") return NULL instead of VoiceManagerImpl
bug.body: Hi Folks, I currently develop some libraries to write ESH and OpenHAB automation rules in groovy. In this process, I noticed an bug in the [ScriptExtensionWrapper](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/4204ce06bb28c28e5f711e720f87ef83beff2e27/bundles/automation/org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.module.script/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/automation/module/script/internal/ScriptExtensionManagerWrapper.java) class. According to the getTypes() method, the following objects should be loadable via the ScriptExtensionManagerWrapper.get() method: - voice - audio - DOWN - CLOSED - FileUtils - StringType - DECREASE - rules - OFF - StopMoveType - StringUtils - INCREASE - OpenClosedType - things - UP - URLEncoder - HSBType - events - ON - itemRegistry - STOP - ir - UpDownType - PercentType - FilenameUtils - OPEN - DateTimeType - Command - OnOffType - MOVE - State - DecimalType - PointType - IncreaseDecreaseType - File - items - Condition - TriggerType - Action - ActionType - Configuration - ActionHandlerFactory - ruleRegistry - SimpleActionHandler - automationManager - SimpleRule - ModuleType - Trigger - SimpleConditionHandler - ConditionHandlerFactory - Visibility - Rule - ConfigDescriptionParameter - SimpleTriggerHandler - TriggerHandlerFactory However, when I try to load the first two objects (voice or audio), NULL get returned instead the VoiceManagerImpl or AudioManagerImpl Class. For all other objects, the correct instance is given back. I am using openHAB 2.4.0 Build 1305. Cheers, Philipp

bug.title: [test failures] ItemRegistryOSGiTest.testItemAddedEvent test sometimes fails
bug.body: We sometimes observe the ItemRegistryOSGiTest.testItemAddedEvent test inside org.eclipse.smarthome.core.test to fail with the following assertion: ``` Results : 16:39:52 16:39:52 Failed tests: 16:39:52 ItemRegistryOSGiTest.testItemAddedEvent:283->JavaTest.waitForAssert:69->JavaTest.waitForAssert:116->JavaTest.waitForAssert:154->lambda$2:283 16:39:52 eventSubscriber.receive( 16:39:52 isA(org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.events.ItemAddedEvent) 16:39:52 ); 16:39:52 Wanted 1 time: 16:39:52 -> at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.ItemRegistryOSGiTest.lambda$2(ItemRegistryOSGiTest.java:283) 16:39:52 But was 5 times. Undesired invocation: 16:39:52 -> at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor46.invoke(Unknown Source) ``` One possibility for this happening might be that depending on the order of the test executions, there sometimes are tests executed beforehand which also add an item and don't clean up these events properly.

bug.title: Tags missing on new Item in 'updated' event on ItemRegistryChangeListener
bug.body: When receiving an update event in an ItemRegistryChangeListener, the tags seem to be missing from the second parameter, the new version of the item. I'm testing with the APT package, 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT, build #1302 on Ubuntu. The issue exists for a while now, first reported by a user of an add-on I wrote, here: https://community.openhab.org/t/imperihome-binding-2-0. You'll find an add-on to show the issue using logging here: https://github.com/pdegeus/openhab2-addons/tree/master/addons/io/org.openhab.io.tagtest I'm sorry not to provide a unit test or similar. I'm using .items files. Item example: `Number FanMode "Ventilatie" ["iss:room:Attic", "iss:type:DevMultiSwitch", "iss:mapping:0=0, 1=I, 2=II, 3=III"] ` Logging on a 'touch' of the items file: ``` 2018-06-25 22:15:17.298 [INFO ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Refreshing model 'attic.items' 2018-06-25 22:15:17.306 [INFO ] [.openhab.io.tagtest.internal.TagTest] - Item updated: 'FanMode', old tags: [iss:room:Attic, iss:type:DevMultiSwitch, iss:mapping:0=0, 1=I, 2=II, 3=III], new tags: [] ``` May be related to #5670, #5654, #5649

bug.title: UoM: 'toUnit' is not a member of 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.types.QuantityType'
bug.body: In a rule under OH 2.3.0, I receive this log error: ``` 'toUnit' is not a member of 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.types.QuantityType' ``` in reaction to the expression `MyItemName.state.toUnit('mph')` for a `Number:Speed` item. Also, an attempt to `import tec.uom.se.AbstractUnit` at the top of the rule does not result in resolving `AbstractUnit` when the rule tries to use the `parse` static method. @kaikreuzer: > I have seen the same error and wondered why it happened. We might need some implicit imports in Xbase for it - @watou I would say that this is worth a separate issue (as I consider it a bug). See https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/5243#issuecomment-397846492 Example rule that produces the log message: ``` import java.net.URLEncoder import java.text.SimpleDateFormat import java.util.Date import java.util.Map import java.util.TimeZone import tec.uom.se.AbstractUnit /* Uploads weather station data using this format: http://wiki.wunderground.com/index.php/PWS_-_Upload_Protocol */ rule PWS when Item DavisVantageVueWindDirectionAverage received update then val sdf = new SimpleDateFormat('yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss') sdf.setTimeZone(TimeZone.getTimeZone('UTC')) val Map<String, Object> params = newLinkedHashMap( 'action' -> 'updateraw', 'ID' -> 'XXXX', 'PASSWORD' -> 'xxxx', 'dateutc' -> sdf.format(new Date()), 'winddir' -> DavisVantageVueWindDirection.state, 'windspeedmph' -> DavisVantageVueWindSpeed.state.toUnit('mph'), 'windgustmph' -> DavisVantageVueWindSpeedMaximum.state.toUnit('mph'), 'windgustdir' -> DavisVantageVueWindDirectionAverage.state, 'windspdmph_avg2m' -> DavisVantageVueWindSpeedAverage.state.toUnit('mph'), 'winddir_avg2m' -> DavisVantageVueWindDirectionAverage.state, 'humidity' -> DavisVantageVueHumidity.state, 'tempf' -> DavisVantageVueOutdoorTemperature.state.toUnit('°F'), 'rainin' -> DavisVantageVueRainCurrentHour.state.toUnit('in'), 'baromin' -> MeteoStickPressure.state.toUnit('inHg'), 'softwaretype' -> 'openHAB 2.3') var url = 'https://weatherstation.wunderground.com/weatherstation/updateweatherstation.php?' var first = true for (key : params.keySet()) { if (!first) { url += '&' } url += key + '=' + URLEncoder::encode(params.get(key).toString, 'UTF-8') first = false } logDebug('PWS', 'url is {}', url) sendHttpGetRequest(url) end ```

Cause D:\OpenHABRoot\OpenHAB2\userdata\jsondb\amazonechocontrol:account:account1.json (Die Syntax für den Dateinamen, Verzeichnisnamen oder die Datenträgerbezeichnung ist falsch). 07:18:50.458 [ERROR] [ome.storage.json.internal.JsonStorage] - Error writing JsonDB to D:\OpenHABRoot\OpenHAB2\userdata\jsondb\backup\1528175930458–amazonechocontrol:account:account1.json. Cause D:\OpenHABRoot\OpenHAB2\userdata\jsondb\backup\1528175930458–amazonechocontrol:account:account1.json (Die Syntax für den Dateinamen, Verzeichnisnamen oder die Datenträgerbezeichnung ist falsch). ```

bug.title: Group function not properly working for groups with dimensions
bug.body: When using groups with dimensions the group function computes an UNDEF result when creating a group containing other groups. This does work properly for groups without dimensions. I've tested this with openHAB 2.4.0-SNAPSHOT and it is reproducible with these files (I've added a .txt extension to be able to upload them): * [test.items](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/files/2065962/test.items.txt) * [test.sitemap](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/files/2065966/test.sitemap.txt) * [test.rules](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/files/2065964/test.rules.txt) These are the items with dimensions from test.items: ```php Group:Number:Power:SUM D_SUM "Groups Sum [%d W]" <poweroutlet_us> Group:Number:Power:SUM D_G1_SUM "Group 1 Sum [%d W]" <water> (D_SUM) Group:Number:Power:SUM D_G2_SUM "Group 2 Sum [%d W]" <oil> (D_SUM) Number:Power D_G1_I1 "Group 1 Item 1 [%d W]" <water> (D_G1_SUM) Number:Power D_G1_I2 "Group 1 Item 2 [%d W]" <water> (D_G1_SUM) Number:Power D_G2_I1 "Group 2 Item 1 [%d W]" <oil> (D_G2_SUM) Number:Power D_G2_I2 "Group 2 Item 2 [%d W]" <oil> (D_G2_SUM) ``` As you can see in this screenshot the D_SUM item is not computed: ![test](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12213581/40886870-d338ee9c-673f-11e8-94f3-e3a9b1a23d45.png) The D_SUM item remains undefined, see also this logging: ``` 14:51:43.120 [INFO ] [del.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Loading model 'test.items' 14:51:43.916 [INFO ] [del.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Loading model 'test.rules' 14:51:43.964 [INFO ] [rthome.model.lsp.internal.ModelServer] - Started Language Server Protocol (LSP) service on port 5007 14:51:44.043 [INFO ] [del.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - N_G2_I1 changed from NULL to 3 14:51:50.355 [INFO ] [home.event.GroupItemStateChangedEvent] - N_G2_SUM changed from NULL to 3 through N_G2_I1 14:51:50.356 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ItemStateChangedEvent] - bug.title: [Paper UI] Not possible to reorder rule actions
bug.body: In the past it was possible to drag&drop the action cards in the rule designer in order to change their order - this does not seem to work anymore.

bug.title: [Paper UI] Not possible to link a number-with-dimension channel to a "plain" number item
bug.body: When trying to link a "Number:Temperature" channel to an item in the Paper UI, no pure "Number" items are shown in the selection list, although those are valid targets for such channels.

bug.title: [Paper UI] TypeError: Cannot read property 'metadata' of undefined
bug.body: I got a JS error after I tried to edit the metadata of this new item in the Configuration -> Item section. ![bildschirmfoto vom 2018-05-25 20-45-33](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5131747/40561370-39966366-605d-11e8-83e5-4d14588f3bc0.png) ![bildschirmfoto vom 2018-05-25 20-45-38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5131747/40561350-2517617e-605d-11e8-953c-5e83ded8f201.png)

bug.title: Metadata Information No Longer Available via REST API
bug.body: I just updated to the latest openHAB 2.3.0-SNAPSHOT Build #﻿1288 and I am no longer able to get metadata information through the REST API. It looks like that this might be related to #5576. **Item** ``` Switch TestSwitch "Test Switch" ["foobar"] {foo="bar" [baz=42]} ``` **Result** ``` curl -s -X GET --header "Accept: application/json" http://localhost:8080/rest/items/TestSwitch?metadata=foo | jq { "link": "http://localhost:8080/rest/items/TestSwitch", "state": "NULL", "editable": false, "type": "Switch", "name": "TestSwitch", "label": "Test Switch", "tags": [ "foobar" ], "groupNames": [] } ```

bug.title: [Tradfri] MemoryLeak on connection resume
bug.body: Whenever the Tradfri binding re-establishes a broken connection to the gateway, it leaks quite some memory to the heap. This is particularly painful when using an unstable link (e.g. via power-line communication). The fact that each instance of the `InMemoryConnectionStore` puts a towel onto 500000 seats (~2MB) by default adds a very painful trait to this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2592443/40488351-e0d20894-5f66-11e8-91d0-8c98faad06d6.png) In this case, ~200 MB were aggregated over the time of only 3 days. On a first quick glance it looks like the `CoapObserveRelation`s keep themselves entertained by re-trying to connect all the time and thereby re-scheduling themselves. They need to be cancelled explicitly. Not sure yet if there is anything else left to cleanup, especially the restart of the `DTLSConnection` might be dodgy too...

bug.title: Unit support broke lambdas in Rules/Scripts
bug.body: As mentioned [here](https://community.openhab.org/t/openhab-2-3-release-candidate-available/45318/29, closures don't work properly anymore. The reason is that the terminal rule which was introduced in #4818 had precedence over any other rule and thereby accidentally also "grabbed" the closures. The `XClosure` also uses the same square-bracket syntax but not on terminal level. Having looked into this, I don't see a way of fixing it unambiguously. The decision to use square brackets also in the context of quantities simply does not work.

bug.title: [Paper UI] ngRepeat:dupes errors in browser console when loading Control page
bug.body: ngRepeat:dupes errors are logged in the browser console when the Paper UI Control page (http://localhost:8080/paperui/index.html#/control) is loaded: ![control](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12213581/40423846-0d797c52-5e94-11e8-914b-6eb340bece94.png) See also this [console.log](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/files/2030953/console.log). So far it seems the Control page is still fully functional. I'm using openHAB 2.3.0.RC1 with Chrome 65.0.3325.181 on Ubuntu 16.04.4 (amd64).

bug.title: [Paper UI] Bridge selection is hidden, if no bridge instance exists
bug.body: When manually creating a Thing that requires a Bridge, the Bridge selection field is missing, if no Bridge instance exists so far: If there is a Bridge, the selection is shown: I would expect that the Paper UI clearly shows that this Thing requires a Bridge. If none exists, it would be nice if it could directly offer to re-direct to the creation of the Bridge first or to at least clearly communicate that this is required.

bug.title: Basic UI: visibility defined in sitemap partly not working
bug.body: Platform information: Hardware: RPi 3 B+ OS: raspbian stretch openHAB version: openHAB 2.3.0 (Build #1272) oracle java 1.8.0_65 In BasicUI the sitemap property visibility partly not working, but the classic UI works well with the same sitemap and item definitions. in example: **item definition** `Switch KZ1Hide "more" <returnpipe>` `Switch hue_1 "hue 1" {channel="hue:0200:1:1:color" }` **sitemap definition** `Frame {` ` Slider item=Licht_KZ` `Switch item=hue_1` ` Slider item=hue_1_Dimmer visibility=[hue_1==ON]` ` Colorpicker item=hue_1_Color visibility=[hue_1==ON]` ` }` `Frame {` `Switch item=KZ1Hide` `Text label=" " icon="none" visibility=[KZ1Hide==ON]` `Setpoint item=TempControl_KZ1_soll label="Solltemperatur [%.1f °C]" visibility=[KZ1Hide==ON] minValue=18 maxValue=25 step=0.5` `Switch item=TempControl_KZ1_ label="heat control" mappings=[100="Auto",101="ON",102="OFF",103="-2°"] visibility=[KZ1Hide==ON]` `}` In the first Frame with item hue_1 the slider and colorpicker are visible then hue_1 is ON. But it takes same seconds in BasicUI. (in Classic UI - immediately ) In the second frame with switch item KZ1Hide the following text, setpoint and switch items are only visible then browser tab manuell refreshed. Hint: The switch (KZ1Hide) state will show immediatly in Basic UI then changed from another Device.

bug.title: Setpoint state contains whole label
bug.body: When using a setpoint with a label formatter the state of the setpoint seems to contain the whole formatter. ``` Number TestSetpoint_1 Number TestSetpoint_2 ``` ``` Frame { Setpoint item=TestSetpoint_1 label="[%d]" minValue=1 maxValue=12 step=1 Setpoint item=TestSetpoint_2 label="[%d s]" minValue=1 maxValue=12 step=1 } ``` ``` rule "Rollershutter" when Item TestSetpoint_1 changed or Item TestSetpoint_2 changed then logInfo("TestSetpoint", triggeringItem.toString ) end ``` logg ``` [INFO ] [.smarthome.model.script.TestSetpoint] - TestSetpoint_1 (Type=NumberItem, State=6, Label=null, Category=null) [ome.event.ItemCommandEvent] - Item 'TestSetpoint_2' received command 4 s [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - TestSetpoint_2 changed from 3 s to 4 s [INFO ] [.smarthome.model.script.TestSetpoint] - TestSetpoint_2 (Type=NumberItem, State=4 s, Label=null, Category=null) ``` so the setpoint is not usable in rules as it does not only contain the number but the whole formatter as state.

bug.title: Bridge Thing offline, but child things stay online
bug.body: In my openhab binding (pentair), I have a serial bridge with several child things. If there is a setup error for the bridge, I set the status of the bridge to offline (updateStatus(ThingStatus.OFFLINE, ThingStatusDetail.CONFIGURATION_ERROR, msg)). This is reflected correctly in the paperUI. However, all the child things still go ONLINE. I had thought the framework took care of not allow child things to go online if their corresponding bridge is OFFLINE. Can someone confirm or do I need to manually manage this part of the lifecycle in the binding? Thanks, Jeff

bug.title: XPATH in label, when xml contains namespace
bug.body: The XPATH transformation in a label seems to make some problems, when the xml contains a namespace which has to be resolved. ``` String http_Info_1 "Info [%s]" {http="<[http://campulverde.info/liveStreams.xml:60000:XPATH(/*[name()='liveStreams']/*[name()='stream']/*[name()='label'])]"} String http_Info_2 "Info [XPATH(/*[name()='liveStreams']/*[name()='stream']/*[name()='label']):%s]" {http="<[http://campulverde.info/liveStreams.xml:60000:REGEX((.*))]"} ``` The first one is working, the second one does not, probably as the XPATH contains `[ ]`.

bug.title: [test failures] MQTT: BrokerHandlerTest fails randomly
bug.body: The `BrokerHandlerTest#handlerInit` test case fails randomly. This may be due to timing issues.

bug.title: Sitemap updates the wrong widgets after reordering
bug.body: Let's assume we have a sitemap like this: ```xtend sitemap test label="Test Sitemap" { Frame label="Test Items" { Text item=testNumber Text item=testDimmer } } ``` It's going to look like this in Basic UI: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2592443/39534945-00250fec-4e33-11e8-8622-adb1cd3f3af6.png) Now I have a rule that increments the testNumber item's state on a regular basis. When I now change the order of the two widgets in the sitemap file like this: ```xtend sitemap test label="Test Sitemap" { Frame label="Test Items" { Text item=testDimmer Text item=testNumber } } ``` then the Basic UI refreshes automatically and correctly looks like this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2592443/39535106-5fff5b3e-4e33-11e8-914f-2ca106433536.png) However, as soon as the numberItem state changes for the next time, it is going to look like this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2592443/39535153-7f644f5c-4e33-11e8-81d6-36b87fe95990.png) As you can see, the wrong widget gets updated. After a quick analysis it looks like the `PageChangeListener` keeps operating with a stale collection of widgets and therefore calculates the widgetIDs wrong. This in fact is a regression introduced by #3846. I will push a fix which partially reverts #3846 in a few moments.

bug.title: [astro] Time drift on positional job
bug.body: The sun elevation is supposed to be calculated at a regular frequency (default is every 300s). However, due to the use of `scheduleWithFixedDelay` for the positional job, which schedules the job starting from the termination of the previous job to the commencement of the next job, there is a small time drift introduced. This time drift can be anywhere from a few milliseconds to 35-40 milliseconds per execution, depending on the CPU speed. Example of drift: ``` 2018-04-30 17:36:52.955 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 262.15 to 263.18 2018-04-30 17:41:53.000 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 263.18 to 264.20 2018-04-30 17:46:53.042 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 264.20 to 265.21 2018-04-30 17:51:53.060 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 265.21 to 266.22 2018-04-30 17:56:53.093 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 266.22 to 267.21 2018-04-30 18:01:53.090 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 267.21 to 268.21 2018-04-30 18:06:53.113 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 268.21 to 269.19 2018-04-30 18:11:53.211 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 269.19 to 270.18 2018-04-30 18:16:53.241 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 270.18 to 271.15 2018-04-30 18:21:53.338 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 271.15 to 272.13 2018-04-30 18:26:53.378 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 272.13 to 273.10 2018-04-30 18:31:53.422 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 273.10 to 274.06 2018-04-30 18:36:53.458 [vent.ItemStateChangedEvent] - SunAzimuth changed from 274.06 to 275.03 ``` This drift could be eliminated (or greatly reduced) by the use of `scheduleAtFixedRate` instead of `scheduleWithFixedDelay`. The guidelines indicate `scheduleWithFixedDelay` is preferred. However, as the astro binding performs accurate calculations, it can be argued that the frequency with which those calculations are performed also should be accurate. Therefore a deviation from the guidelines is warranted. Reference this forum discussion [here](https://community.openhab.org/t/astro-binding-event-drift/44328)

bug.title: Metadata with key already exists from provider GenericMetadataProvider Error
bug.body: While testing the newly added metadata infrastructure (#4390) in openHAB 2.3.0-SNAPSHOT Build #﻿1263, there seems to be a bug with refreshing/deleting metadata on already configured item. Each time I tried to update the metadata, it is failing with the below error and if I delete it, I can still see it present on that item when querying though the rest api. The only way to flush that information is to remove and re-add the item with the proper metadata. **Error** `[WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - Metadata with key 'foo:TestSwitch' already exists from provider GenericMetadataProvider! Failed to add a second with the same UID from provider GenericMetadataProvider! ` **Items Config** `Switch TestSwitch "Test Switch" {foo="bar" [baz=42]}`

bug.title: Paper UI: allow de-selection of dimension on items
bug.body: As seen in #5445 its not possible to de-select the dimension property on an item in Paper UI.

bug.title: SmartHomeUnits static import leaks dependent class methods/fields
bug.body: When importing SmartHomeUnits statically some methods and/or fields of the base Class `tec.uom.se.AbstractSystemOfUnits` leak into the calling class. The `tec.uom` dependency is not allowed for bindings/other bundles then smarthome core.

bug.title: Bridge nested syntax does not support different thingHandlerFactory for thing
bug.body: This issue is a follow up from #5301 and refers to a somewhat experimental technology at the moment. Given are two bundles that share the same binding id. Reasons for this are described in #5301 A prototype for this is the [blukii support](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/tree/master/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.bluetooth.blukii) or the modbus based [sunspec support](https://github.com/mrbig/openhab2-addons/tree/3216-binding-sunspec-modbus/addons/binding/org.openhab.binding.modbus.sunspec) The issue arises when the bridge and the connected thing are from different bundles, and the nested syntax is used: ``` Bridge modbus:tcp:se4000 [ ... ] { inverter-single-phase myinverter [ ... ] } ``` Currently these items are silently ignored, because the GenericThingProvider checks the proposed thing with the bridge's ThingHandlerFactory only. [See here](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/5528ad5e460e2d8b6412bc34610530c0f2f06a28/bundles/model/org.eclipse.smarthome.model.thing/src/org/eclipse/smarthome/model/thing/internal/GenericThingProvider.xtend#L232) I propose, that we should rescan every thingHandlerFactory each time the code is recursing into nested bridges/things. To avoid incorrect connection between different bindings may the binding id could been checked and if they don't match then ignore the thingHandlerFactory. Note: a workaround for this is to ignore the nested syntax in such cases and use flat list with references, so the above could be rewritten as: ``` Bridge modbus:tcp:se4000 [ ... ] Thing modbus:inverter-single-phase:se4000:myinverter (modbus:tcp:se4000) [...] ```

bug.title: [BasicUI] UI does not respond to events
bug.body: Installed Version: openhab2=2.3.0~20180331153334-1 Working on debian for armhf and zulu8 embedded. Cleared website caches. Loading sitemap in Firefox or Chrome (latest stable versions) results in not responding UI. The UI loads, but no element can be clicked, nor can the sitemap be navigated. Chrome Dev Tools console shows Firefox shows: Installed 2.3.0~20180325175928-1, cleared caches, still the same behaviour.

bug.title: BaseBridgeHandler.childHandlerInitialized will not be called if the bridge will be configured at runtime
bug.body: **Steps to reproduce:** Create a bridge device in PaperUI Create a child device in PaperUI, but do not select the bridge Open the child device configuration again and select now the bridge **Expected result:** The function childHandlerInitialized of the bridge will be called after the initialize function of child was called **Current result:** Only the initialize function of the child thing will be called.

bug.title: Statechangelistener prevents GroupItem to be disposed
bug.body: When a GroupItem registers a StateChangeListener in form of another GroupItem, the deletion of the latter won't remove the StateChangeListener, because the toElement method in ManagedItemProvider creates a new instance of the GroupItem to perform the tidy up task on. Later the removeStateChangeListener of the newly created GroupItem will be called, but this will fail since there are none. The Java GarbageCollector will remove the GroupItem from the ItemRegistryImpl but stops at the old GroupItem, since it's still referenced from the GroupItem which holds the reference on it's listeners. When creating a new GroupItem with the same uid the GroupItem won't add the new GroupItem as a listener, since the overriden equals method of a GenericItem will state them the same, because the comparison isn't done by object id. Thus the listener of the old GroupItem will be used and the new GroupItem won't get updates. If questions arise i'll be happy to provide additional informations. Greetings, maw

bug.title: NPE in NetUtil in case an interface doesn't have a broadcast address
bug.body: I just rain into this: ``` 12:53:54.759 DEBUG o.e.s.i.r.JSONResponse$ExceptionMapper[:203] - exception during REST Handling java.lang.NullPointerException: null at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.net.NetUtil.getAllBroadcastAddresses(NetUtil.java:189) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.internal.net.NetworkConfigOptionProvider.getParameterOptions(NetworkConfigOptionProvider.java:54) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.ConfigOptionProvider.getParameterOptions(ConfigOptionProvider.java:51) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.ConfigDescriptionRegistry.fillFromProviders(ConfigDescriptionRegistry.java:293) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.ConfigDescriptionRegistry.getConfigOptions(ConfigDescriptionRegistry.java:262) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.ConfigDescriptionRegistry.getConfigDescription(ConfigDescriptionRegistry.java:189) at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.core.internal.config.ConfigDescriptionResource.getByURI(ConfigDescriptionResource.java:90) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) ``` Apparently due to some VPN configuration settings there is an interface without a broadcast address: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2592443/36898006-3ea5d3b8-1e19-11e8-9117-7c6f5632364e.png)

bug.title: Thing configuration descriptions not working
bug.body: ZWave configuration descriptions are no longer working - configuration from the internal ConfigProvider is ok, but configuration from the XML files is not provided. It seems that the conversion in the ThingConfigDescriptionProvider is not making the conversion from thing to thing-type. Maybe it is related to https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/5021 as it's about the right timeframe for this having been introduced and it looks like the original provider was changed at this point to a new Alias interface (@sjka). From my quick look at this, it seems that the thing config provider is no longer being called (and possibly isn't registered from what I can see in the IDE). Also see this [forum post](https://community.openhab.org/t/zwave-habmin-association-and-configuration/40094).

bug.title: No events received from ESH
bug.body: We are currently experiencing problems with receiving all kinds of events from ESH. It looks like for certain times we do not receive any events at all from ESH. If this happens, only events from ESH are affected, while at the same time we still receive events when the OSGI EventAdmin is used directly (we have some custom events in our own bundles, where the EventAdmin is used directly). We have seen the issues from last December (#4591 and other issues referenced there) and think this could be related, but we do not see any log messages about the EventAdmin blacklisting certain services here. So we cannot say if there is a connection, but it seems likely. We first observed this behaviour with the 0.9.0 release version.

bug.title: Leak (or excessive memory usage) in SitemapResource
bug.body: (This is a continuation of the discussion on this OpenHab issue: https://community.openhab.org/t/sitemap-causing-oom/38936/10) **Summary**: It looks like there's no restriction on how many objects [SitemapResource::eventOutputs](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/dcef6131b70c231a604b4beec5dc9e1769fbb88f/bundles/io/org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/io/rest/sitemap/internal/SitemapResource.java#L130) can contain and this can easily lead to an OOM. **Details**: If I keep OpenHab2's BasicUI open in my browser for a long period of time (e.g. overnight) this will likely lead to an OOM crash, I've investigated a bit on this and the heap dump I got seem to point to [SitemapResource::eventOutputs](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/dcef6131b70c231a604b4beec5dc9e1769fbb88f/bundles/io/org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/io/rest/sitemap/internal/SitemapResource.java#L130). Here's some information from the heap dump analysis: Problem Suspect (as provided by Memory Analyzer): > One instance of "org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.SitemapResource" loaded by "org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap" occupies 893,758,768 (89.71%) bytes. The memory is accumulated in one instance of "org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.SitemapResource" loaded by "org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap". And here's the "Path to GC root" for this SitemapResource object: ``` Class Name | Shallow Heap | Retained Heap --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.SitemapResource @ 0xc45e1a88 | 48 | 893,758,768 '- m_implementationObject org.apache.felix.scr.impl.manager.ComponentContextImpl @ 0xc45e18a0 | 56 | 720 '- m_componentContext org.apache.felix.scr.impl.manager.SingleComponentManager @ 0xc45e0680 | 104 | 1,816 |- service org.eclipse.osgi.internal.serviceregistry.ServiceRegistrationImpl @ 0xc45e16d0 | 64 | 408 | '- [232] java.lang.Object[567] @ 0xc5fa49e8 | 2,288 | 2,288 | '- elementData java.util.ArrayList @ 0xc48317c0 | 24 | 2,312 | '- allPublishedServices org.eclipse.osgi.internal.serviceregistry.ServiceRegistry @ 0xc482d9b8 | 48 | 107,192 | |- serviceRegistry org.eclipse.osgi.internal.framework.EquinoxContainer @ 0xc43feec8 | 72 | 4,544 | | |- container org.eclipse.osgi.internal.url.URLStreamHandlerFactoryImpl @ 0xc44ced18 | 40 | 200 | | | '- factory class java.net.URL @ 0xc4306878 System Class | 32 | 864 | | |- equinoxContainer org.eclipse.osgi.internal.framework.EquinoxBundle$SystemBundle @ 0xc464bd88| 40 | 80 | | |- container org.eclipse.osgi.internal.url.ContentHandlerFactoryImpl @ 0xc48329c8 | 40 | 128 | | |- container org.eclipse.osgi.internal.framework.BundleContextImpl @ 0xc4ca9718 | 40 | 424 | | |- threadFactory java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor @ 0xc464bcf8 | 80 | 528 | | |- equinoxContainer org.eclipse.osgi.internal.framework.EquinoxBundle @ 0xc4796458 | 32 | 48 | | |- equinoxContainer org.eclipse.osgi.internal.framework.EquinoxBundle @ 0xc47eef80 | 32 | 48 | | |- container org.eclipse.osgi.internal.framework.BundleContextImpl @ 0xc4f919d8 | 40 | 904 | | |- container org.eclipse.osgi.internal.loader.BundleLoader @ 0xd6457650 | 72 | 1,040 | | '- Total: 9 entries | | | |- registry org.eclipse.osgi.internal.serviceregistry.ServiceRegistrationImpl @ 0xc4cb3480 | 64 | 360 | |- registry org.eclipse.osgi.internal.serviceregistry.ServiceRegistrationImpl @ 0xc94d6988 | 64 | 376 | '- Total: 3 entries | | |- value java.util.HashMap$Node @ 0xc5c61730 | 32 | 56 '- Total: 2 entries | | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ``` I think that the root cause of my problem has nothing to do with the SitemapResource , there shouldn't be so many event sent to it in the first place and I'll investigate on this separately, but it'd be nice if there was a way to make sure that this class can't cause this excessive memory usage. Thanks! Please let me know if there's anything I can share here to make it easier to debug this issue. I've tried looking at it but it's beyond my Java skills :)

bug.title: Visual studio code does not detect duplicate item names
bug.body: It looks like visual studio code does not check duplicate item names. Visual studio code: ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33092270/35326322-9f797518-00f6-11e8-9881-8527db62c392.png) Eclipse SmartHome Designer ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33092270/35326340-a9262160-00f6-11e8-9225-1828efc9ea66.png) I've verified, that language server (LSP) is running and working

bug.title: Things remaining in INITIALIZING state at startup
bug.body: With the last ESH/OH build (snapshot 1186), we have the comeback of things not initializing correctly at startup. Most of bridge things (hue, netatmo, ...) remains in a INITIALIZING state. I have nothing special logged. The problem is at each startup. The problem was introduced after the snapshot 1140.

bug.title: [Paper UI] Inbox does not update entries upon "updated" event
bug.body: When an inbox entry is updated there is no notification. This leads to the inbox display in UIs being wrong until the UI is refreshed. DiscoveryListener should have an updated method to alert the UI that things have changed. Alternatively, the added method could be called again (maybe) since the method called is always ```thingDiscovered``` in the discovery service.

bug.title: Configuration normalisation not performed on channel configuration
bug.body: When saving channel configuration, normalisation is not performed on the channel configuration. Additionally, it looks like the defaults may not be of the correct type - defaults are specified as a ```String``` (ie in ConfigDescriptionParameterBuilder) and should be normalised before being passed to the binding. For example, the following -: ``` options = new ArrayList<ParameterOption>(); options.add(new ParameterOption("65535", "Use On/Off transition time")); parameters.add(ConfigDescriptionParameterBuilder.create(CONFIG_ONTRANSITIONTIME, Type.INTEGER) .withLabel("On Transition Time") .withDescription("Time in 10ms intervals to transition from OFF to ON").withDefault("65535") .withMinimum(new BigDecimal(0)).withMaximum(new BigDecimal(60000)).withOptions(options) .withLimitToOptions(false).build()); ``` will provide a String when the configuration is read from the channel.

bug.title: [Tradfri] Trådfri incorrectly reports old firmware on startup
bug.body: #### Symptom: The binding reports firmware incorrect on startup of openhab. ``` 2018-01-12 11:05:43.095 [WARN ] [radfri.handler.TradfriGatewayHandler] - Gateway with old firmware - please consider upgrading to the latest version. ``` #### Reproduce: Watch the `/var/log/openhab/openhab.log` while starting the system. #### Expected outcome: As my Ikea phone app reports up updated on all devices including the gateway (currently: 1.2.42) I don't expect this warn log. #### System: Openhab 2.2 running on an Pine64 device. [Related forum thread](https://community.openhab.org/t/tradfri-wrong-upgrade-message/36316)

bug.title: [LSP] Many test failures from invalid URIs
bug.body: 20 tests fail due to invalid URIs in org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.test. Like this one: ```` Tests run: 24, Failures: 0, Errors: 20, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 0.136 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.internal.MappingUriExtensionsTest testGuessClientPath[0](org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.internal.MappingUriExtensionsTest) Time elapsed: 0.008 sec testToPath_emfURI[0](org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.internal.MappingUriExtensionsTest) Time elapsed: 0.006 sec <<< ERROR! java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in authority at index 7: file://C:\Users\me\AppData\Local\Temp\junit7939295565267433128\conf at java.net.URI$Parser.fail(URI.java:2848) at java.net.URI$Parser.parseAuthority(URI.java:3186) at java.net.URI$Parser.parseHierarchical(URI.java:3097) at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3053) at java.net.URI.<init>(URI.java:588) at java.net.URI.create(URI.java:850) at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.internal.MappingUriExtensions.toURI(MappingUriExtensions.java:170) at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.internal.MappingUriExtensions.map(MappingUriExtensions.java:160) at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.internal.MappingUriExtensions.toUri(MappingUriExtensions.java:93) at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.lsp.internal.MappingUriExtensionsTest.testToPath_emfURI(MappingUriExtensionsTest.java:122) ````

bug.title: NTP binding: not at time
bug.body: I just discovered that my RPI is not at time at all but 11 minutes before the correct time. The NTP binding is providing the server time as displayed in Basic UI. Isn't it the role of the NTP binding to keep my server at time ?

bug.title: NPE while determining the correct profile for a channel
bug.body: The latest ESH stable broke the openHAB build as some tests now fail with NPEs like: ``` java.lang.NullPointerException: null at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.DefaultSystemChannelTypeProvider.getChannelType(DefaultSystemChannelTypeProvider.java:202) at bug.title: [Astro] Only one autodiscovered astro item could be added
bug.body: Build is 1119, "Item Linking" is "Simple Mode", PaperUI. When adding one autodiscovered astro item (eg. Local Sun) both items (Sun and Moon) disappear in Inbox, and only "Local Sun" is added to Control. A new Inbox Scan doesn't find the remaining item. Only manual adding is possible. A few builds early both items where added to Control when adding one item. And a few builds before that the selected item was added to control and the other remains in inbox and can then be added..

bug.title: Configuration Parser do not support multiple values
bug.body: There is no support for multiple values in Automation ConfigurationSerializer and ConfigurationDeserializer

bug.title: ProfileCallbackImpl may contain reference to an old Thing
bug.body: While debugging https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/issues/2854 I've encountered references to Things not properly being updated in the ProfileCallbackImpl. As you can read in the referenced issue, the initialization of the HarmonyHubHandler can take more than 5 seconds. The warnings ofcourse does not cause any issues. What does seem to be an issue is that during initialization of the handler a new Thing is created and the handler of the old Thing is set to `null` in the ThingManager at [line 453](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/92b4f7d1dcd262dfe9c33ca458853140cdd145af/bundles/core/org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/core/thing/internal/ThingManager.java#L453 ): public void thingUpdated(final Thing thing, ThingTrackerEvent thingTrackerEvent) { ... if (oldThing != thing && oldThing != null) { oldThing.setHandler(null); } ... } Apparently `CommunicationManager.getProfile(..)` does not update the oldThing in the ProfileCallBackImpl to the newThing. So when a command is sent to the channel a ProfileCallBackImpl is retreived containing the oldThing with a null handler. I.e. resulting in the logging: > 23:06:30.764 WARN o.e.s.c.t.i.p.ProfileCallbackImpl[:122] - Cannot delegate update 'PowerOff' for item 'harmonyhub_hub_Test_currentActivity' to handler for channel 'harmonyhub:hub:Test:currentActivity', because no handler is assigned. Maybe the binding is not installed or not propertly initialized. A temporary working solution for me is to comment parts of the code in CommunicationManager.getProfile(..) so it always creates a new (working) profile: private Profile getProfile(ItemChannelLink link, Item item, Thing thing) { synchronized (profiles) { // Profile profile = profiles.get(link.getUID()); // if (profile != null) { // return profile; // } ProfileTypeUID profileTypeUID = determineProfileTypeUID(link, item, thing); if (profileTypeUID != null) { Profile profile = getProfileFromFactories(profileTypeUID, link, createCallback(link)); if (profile != null) { profiles.put(link.getUID(), profile); return profile; } } return new NoOpProfile(); } }

bug.title: Auto-ignored entries are shown as discovery result
bug.body: When starting a manual discovery, I get a list of discovered things in the Paper UI. This list also includes all results that are marked as "ignored" by the Inbox' auto-ignore feature - it seems that the according event is not considered. After reloading the inbox page, the ignored entries are correctly hidden. What is also a bit weird is that we get an updated event before the added event: ``` 2017-11-22 22:55:07.692 [DEBUG] [.c.d.i.AutomaticInboxProcessor:91 ] - Auto-ignoring the inbox entry for the representation value 49.71,8.43,0 2017-11-22 22:55:07.694 [INFO ] [rthome.event.InboxUpdatedEvent:47 ] - Discovery Result with UID 'astro:sun:local' has been updated. 2017-11-22 22:55:18.268 [INFO ] [marthome.event.InboxAddedEvent:47 ] - Discovery Result with UID 'astro:sun:local' has been added. ```

Failed to add a second with the same UID! 2017-11-15 17:11:29.787 [WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.StringItem with key'WeatherInformation_Current_WeatherIconURL' already exists! Failed to add a second with the same UID! 2017-11-15 17:11:29.790 [WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.NumberItem with key'RainFallMm7' already exists! Failed to add a second with the same UID! 2017-11-15 17:11:29.793 [WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.StringItem with key'WeatherInformation_ForecastDay3_WeatherIconURL' already exists! Failed to add a second with the same UID! 2017-11-15 17:11:29.796 [WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.NumberItem with key'Humidity' already exists! Failed to add a second with the same UID! 2017-11-15 17:11:29.798 [WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.SwitchItem with key'Licht_Zijterras' already exists! Failed to add a second with the same UID! 2017-11-15 17:11:29.801 [WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.DimmerItem with key'Licht_Eetkamer' already exists! Failed to add a second with the same UID! 2017-11-15 17:11:29.805 [WARN ] [ore.common.registry.AbstractRegistry] - org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.DateTimeItem with key'Sunrise_Time' already exists! Failed to add a second with the same UID! ``` The items affected differ. Some startups don't have issues at all. Other people have the same problem, see discussion in community [https://community.openhab.org/t/item-issues-after-upgrade-to-snapshot-2-2-1004/32927/23](url).

bug.title: [Sonos] UPnP action invocation results in an empty result, which sets the Thing to OFFLINE
bug.body: UPnP is broken ! The following line is failing (returning an empty result): https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/fee1c67521d3d2b84bdf8ec82552a50bfad6faf5/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.sonos/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/binding/sonos/internal/handler/ZonePlayerHandler.java#L837 The result with the Sonos binding is that the thing is set to OFFLINE. I have 2 Sonos and strangely it happens only for one of my 2 Sonos. It looks like a critical bug in the new library version we are relying on (jUPnP). I switch back to snapshot 1065 immediately. @kaikreuzer : I think you should announce in the forum to absolutely avoid the snapshot 1078 for all users using UPnP, until a fix is found.

bug.title: Item group assignment does not take effect without service restart
bug.body: System: openhab stable from PPA on Ubuntu server 16.04 LTS I noticed that when I change the group assignment of an item in the .items-file, the change does not take effect without a service restart. openhab.log indicates that the file change was detected and the model was updated. Other item changes do take effect without service restart.
