bug.title: ConfigDispatcher: Config file processing order-dependent if exclusivePIDs are used
bug.body: ### Context The `org.eclipse.smarthome.config.dispatch.internal.ConfigDispatcher` processes configuration files in the `processConfigFile` method. How a config file is processed depends on whether it has a so-called _exclusive PID_ or not: A config file has an exclusive PID if its first line starts with a PID marker _pid:_ followed by a PID. ### The Issue Consider the following two config files: a.cfg: ``` pid:some_pid A=some value ``` b.cfg: ``` some_pid:B=some other value ``` Then the processing of these two files in the ConfigDispatcher depends on the order in which the two files are processed: * If `a.cfg` is processed first, then the resulting configuration contains both properties `A` and `B` for PID `some_pid`. * If `b.cfg` is processed first, then the resulting configuration only contains property `A` for PID `some_pid`. Frankly, I do not know which result is the correct one, but I think that it is not correct that it depends on the order in which the files are processed. One result of this 'order dependency' is that the test `ConfigDispatcherOSGiTest#theSameLocalAndGlobalPIDsInDifferentFilesAreConsideredOnePID` sometimes fails on my machine (it uses two config files with the same structure as in the example above) - depending on the order in which the two config files used by this test are processed (the config files are processed sorted by lastModified date, which is the same on my machine for both used config files). ### Expected behavior? As stated above, I do not know what the expected behavior is. However, from looking at the code of the method `ConfigDispatcher#processConfigFile` I see that there is some logic that tries to skip config properties for a PID if this PID is used as exclusive PID in another config file. Currently, this logic works only if the file with the exclusive PID is processed last. So I guess that the expected behavior could be that config properties for a PID are ignored if there is another config file which has this PID as exclusive PID. However, from looking at the unit test referenced above, skipping properties in files without exclusive PID is not expected. But of course this unit test might simply be buggy... To conclude: Does anyone here know what is the intended behaviour here regarding parsing of config files with and without exclusive PIDs?

bug.title: [PaperUI] UndefType.NULL is shown as -NaN
bug.body: On a NumberItem I have the value of UndefType.NULL. In PaperUI Control it is shown as "-NaN", which may be misleading. I would suggest to print something like "UNDEFINED" instead.

bug.title: [ASTRO] distance channels badly formatted
bug.body: Currently distance channels are formatted %d, I think it should be %.1f : 2017-10-10 14:17:40.120 [WARN ] [ui.internal.items.ItemUIRegistryImpl] - Exception while formatting value '367600.56' of item astro_moon_local_distance_kilometer with format '%d km': java.util.IllegalFormatConversionException: d != java.math.BigDecimal

bug.title: JSONPATH returning NULL on item not found can lead to problems with openhab REST API
bug.body: NOTE: Reported here as per request of @kaikreuzer in https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/issues/2767 System: Ubuntu server 16.04 LTS on Xeon 1240L V3. Openhab stable from ppa I recently included Sonoff B1 lightbulbs with Tasmota fw in my system. Here is an example item config: ``` Switch B1_1_Sw "B1-1-Switch" (gALL, gLIGHTS) { mqtt="<[broker:b1-1/stat/RESULT:state:JSONPATH($.POWER)], >[broker:b1-1/cmnd/POWER:command:*:${command}]" } Number B1_1_Dim "B1-1-Dimmer" { mqtt="<[broker:b1-1/stat/RESULT:state:JSONPATH($.Dimmer)], >[broker:b1-1/cmnd/Dimmer:command:*:default]" } Number B1_1_CT "B1-1-ColorTemp" { mqtt="<[broker:b1-1/stat/RESULT:state:JSONPATH($.CT)], >[broker:b1-1/cmnd/CT:command:*:default], >[broker:b1-1/cmnd/CT:command:*: ]" } String B1_1_Col "B1-1-Color" { mqtt="<[broker:b1-1/stat/RESULT:state:JSONPATH($.Color)], >[broker:b1-1/cmnd/Color:command:*:default]" } ``` The B1 with tasmota software answers to all commands with > stat/RESULT {“POWER”:“ON”, “Dimmer”:100, “Color”:“FFFFFFFFFF”} (of course with appropriate values). It also answers with this to the cmnd/CT command which sets the color temperature. If you want the color temperature in a reply, you have to send an empty cmnd/CT and you will get something like this. > stat/RESULT {“CT”:500} Now, JSONPATH returns NULL if it can’t find the path item you are asking for, and as both the standard as well as the CT reply use the RESULT path, there’s always something going to be NULL. If you send a regular command, CT will be NULL and if you ask for CT, POWER, Dimmer and Color will be NULL. That lead to this messages in the log: > 2017-10-03 20:12:50.277 [WARN ] [b.core.events.EventPublisherDelegate] - given new state is NULL, couldn’t post update for 'B1_1_CT’ > 2017-10-03 20:12:50.282 [WARN ] [b.core.events.EventPublisherDelegate] - given new state is NULL, couldn’t post update for 'B1_1_CT’ > 2017-10-03 20:12:50.325 [WARN ] [b.core.events.EventPublisherDelegate] - given new state is NULL, couldn’t post update for 'B1_1_Sw’ > 2017-10-03 20:12:50.325 [WARN ] [b.core.events.EventPublisherDelegate] - given new state is NULL, couldn’t post update for ‘B1_1_Dim’ And after a short while the openhab REST API would reply to an items request with a 500 java.lang.NullPointerException. See also https://community.openhab.org/t/connection-lost/34744/15

bug.title: Paper UI: new discovered things should be displayed as ignored when they are auto ignored
bug.body: When you ask for new discovery things for example for Sonos, new things are displayed at screen as "not ignored" while they are in fact ignored due to the automatic ignore mechanism (existing thing with the same representation property). If you reload the inbox by clicking on the menu item "Inbox" then they are ignored as expected.

bug.title: Several REST resources broken
bug.body: #4225 missed to adapt all `<implementation...` tags, therefore DS doesn't find the classes, amongst these are: * DiscoveryResource * BindingResource * ChannelTypeResource * ExtensionResource * ItemResource While fixing them, we might as well port them to annotations.

bug.title: NetUtil invalid address
bug.body: I configured the primary network address in PaperUI, selecting an address from the dropdown list. When starting openHAB I get an 'Invalid address' warning, although the address is correct, as can be seen a few lines lower in the logfile. This is happening for me with openHAB build #1037. ``` 2017-09-15 10:18:42.718 [WARN ] [g.eclipse.smarthome.core.net.NetUtil] - Invalid address '192.168.0.10/24', will use first interface instead. 2017-09-15 10:18:42.722 [WARN ] [g.eclipse.smarthome.core.net.NetUtil] - Found multiple local interfaces - ignoring 192.168.7.1 2017-09-15 10:18:42.725 [WARN ] [g.eclipse.smarthome.core.net.NetUtil] - Found multiple local interfaces - ignoring 192.168.0.10 2017-09-15 10:18:42.728 [INFO ] [.dashboard.internal.DashboardService] - Started dashboard at http://169.254.89.45:8080 2017-09-15 10:18:42.732 [WARN ] [g.eclipse.smarthome.core.net.NetUtil] - Invalid address '192.168.0.10/24', will use first interface instead. 2017-09-15 10:18:42.735 [WARN ] [g.eclipse.smarthome.core.net.NetUtil] - Found multiple local interfaces - ignoring 192.168.7.1 2017-09-15 10:18:42.737 [WARN ] [g.eclipse.smarthome.core.net.NetUtil] - Found multiple local interfaces - ignoring 192.168.0.10 ```

bug.title: [Rest] DELETE /rest/things/*/channels/*/link
bug.body: As reported in https://github.com/openhab/openhab-core/issues/209 the rest api offers an endpoint `DELETE /rest/things/*/channels/*/link` which does not really function also it seems to be duplicate compared to `DELETE /rest/links/*/*` and the implementations differ. Maybe they (there is also an add endpoint) should be removed otherwise there some issues which I quickly spotted: * Wrong annotation for itemName, that is why it's not shown in Swagger, also its not validated in anyway before passing it to the internal method, so I see no way it could properly report if the link is not found or something * Missing else if the link does not exist, so you would at least have some feedback, imho that could/should also be a 404 * The implementation does not match the one in https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/master/bundles/io/org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.core/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/io/rest/core/link/ItemChannelLinkResource.java#L101 but accepts the same parameters, can / should they share some code, should they contain the same code or as suggested should this one be removed? Regards

bug.title: PaperUI: Bindings loads Extensions
bug.body: If you don't use an extension service but open the "Configuration, Bindings" category in the PaperUI (http://sb-jowe.local:8080/paperui/index.html#/configuration/bindings) it complains about a non available service using a notification: ERROR 503 - Service not available The service that is not available is the extension one. I don't think we need to warn every time the rules category is opened that the extension service is not available but accept the missing service silently. This is similar to https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/3591 which has been fixed by https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/3627

bug.title: Inbox auto ignored results are never removed
bug.body: When adding e.g. a hue bridge manually, its result is automatically set to IGNORED in the inbox as expected. When removing the bridge, the IGNORED entry in the inbox must be automatically deleted so a new discovery can find it again. It turns out, that this is not happening most of the time. The reason is, that we do not have such a thing as a Pre-Delete-Hook, where we could easily check and remove possible ignored entries.Listening to ThingStatusChangedEvents as currently implemented does not help, because a REMOVED event indicates that a thing is already removed and REMOVING is not always fired and sometimes directly followed by a REMOVED. In most cases we are accessing the ThingRegistry too late to get informations about the thing being removed (it just returns null).

bug.title: Astro binding : Peculiarities of the Sun phase channel
bug.body: I am using the Astro binding in my openHAB system, using the Sun / Phase channel as a way to check the "state of daylight" in my rules. While testing this I was looking at the log files for a "full cycle" (i.e. a 24 hour period) and I noticed a couple of strange things. Here is a snip of my log file: 2017-08-14 03:55:00.003 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from UNDEF to NAUTIC_DAWN 2017-08-14 05:02:00.003 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from NAUTIC_DAWN to CIVIL_DAWN 2017-08-14 05:50:00.004 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from CIVIL_DAWN to SUN_RISE 2017-08-14 05:54:00.002 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from SUN_RISE to DAYLIGHT 2017-08-14 13:34:00.002 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from DAYLIGHT to NOON 2017-08-14 21:14:00.003 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from NOON to SUN_SET 2017-08-14 21:18:00.003 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from SUN_SET to CIVIL_DUSK 2017-08-14 22:06:00.007 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from CIVIL_DUSK to NAUTIC_DUSK 2017-08-14 23:13:00.003 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from NAUTIC_DUSK to ASTRO_DUSK 2017-08-15 00:00:00.023 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - AstroSunHome_sPhase_Name changed from ASTRO_DUSK to UNDEF The first thing I notice is that apparently the Sun / Phase channel will never report NIGHT as a state (contrary to what the documentation states) but instead goes back to UNDEF. The next thing is that the Sun / Phase channel can report a stated called NOON (and this is as stated in the documentation). As can been seen in the log this is reported as the phase from 13:34 until SUN_SET. As far as I know, however, NOON is a specific point in time (12:00 / midday) and not a period of time, thus (IMO) NOON should not really be reported on the Sun / Phase channel.

bug.title: Weather Underground Binding gets stuck in Initializing state if location parameter is wrong
bug.body: If the location parameter contains a space between latitude and longitude the thing never comes online and is stuck in initializing state. I will provide a PR for it.

bug.title: PaperUI: integer config parameter allow decimal input
bug.body: PaperUI allows decimal input for configuration parameters typed as `integer`. The decimal value is also saved and retrieved again. This should be limited to integer values.

bug.title: Extensions are lacking XML files in OSGI-INF
bug.body: With the change from handwritten XML DS to DS annotations, we switched to felix-scr plugin to generated the XMLs on the fly during the build. Unfortunately, the current build misses generating them for our extensions, it only does it for core bundles. See https://github.com/openhab/openhab-distro/issues/518

bug.title: Image Link: Authentication not working anymore in 1009/Karaf 4.1.2
bug.body: Hi Not sure if this is related to snapshot build 1009 or with new Karaf Upgrade 4.1.2 But Sitemap-Images with authentication do not work anymore: Image icon="camera" url="http://**user:password**@192.168.1.52/axis-cgi/jpg/image.cgi?camera=1&resolution=1280x720&compression=25" refresh=10000 In Webbrowers I get this dialog and in HabDroid there is no picture: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20517474/29249601-38b1b3e8-8033-11e7-837e-6c57c94480cb.png) This was not the case in snapshot 1008 Thanks Michael

bug.title: Paper UI: problem when scrolling in the control page
bug.body: On an Android tablet using Paper UI (in Chrome) and the Control page, as soon as I scroll with my finger, Paper UI is automatically switching to the next tab (location), even if I scroll only in the middle of a page. On a PC using the mouse to scroll, this problem does not exist. It makes the control page unusable on a tablet or phone.

bug.title: PaperUI - DecimalType default value of thing parameter is parsed to Int
bug.body: I have following code describing a thing parameter: ``` <parameter name="targetResolution" type="decimal" required="true"> <label>Resolution of the read Value</label> <description> Resolution of the value. Raw value will be multiplied with this. </description> <default>0.01</default> </parameter> ``` If I try to add such thing in the UI the default value set is `0`. Integer values are shown correctly. The backend handles the default value as String `"0.01"` and the API hands over the value `0.01`. I assume there is something going wrong in the javascript.

bug.title: org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.CronExpression error in dayOfWeek
bug.body: With the current implementation, the expression: `* * * ? * SAT,SUN *` does not match July 30 2017 which is wrong. (isSatisfiedBy returns false) I think the error is at: https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/master/bundles/core/org.eclipse.smarthome.core/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/core/scheduler/CronExpression.java#L1097. It should rather read: for (int i = 1; i <= 6; i++) {

bug.title: [astro] Event order wrong when using ealiest/latest
bug.body: In case the earliest/latest limits enforce events to be triggered at the same point in time, the order is not guaranteed. See https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/3728#issuecomment-317259064

bug.title: [Tradfri] Binding bug
bug.body: **Expected Behavior** I expect the switch item to always reflect the status of the light. **Current Behavior** A while after configuring the binding and linking the dimmer item with the bulb the status of the light is no longer reflected. The light can be controlled through the dimmer item but its status is no longer update if the light is switched on/off or the brightness changes using the Tradfri Android app or the physical remote/dimmer. **Possible Solution** **Steps to Reproduce (for Bugs)** Configure binding Assign dimmer item to "tradfri channel" Use as normal. Check using the physical remote and app and the status updates correctly on OpenHAB. A while later.... Binding works to control the light but is no longer receiving status update. Context I cannot get the status of the light as it stops changing to reflect the actual status if turned on using the IKEA Tradfri remote. The IKEA Tradfri app updates immediately as soon as I turn the light on/off from within OpenHAB so I know the gateway is working fine. **Your Environment** Using OpenHAB 2.1 from the official repo on a Raspberry Pi 2 **Environment name and version (e.g. Chrome 39, node.js 5.4, Java 8, ...):** Using Google Chrome, Firefox and Opera **Operating System and version (desktop or mobile, Windows 10, Raspbian Jessie, ...):** Raspbian lite (latest release as of 19/07/2017

bug.title: RULES: Error aborting execution rule with return
bug.body: Hi @all, referencing to this discussion here: [https://community.openhab.org/t/exit-rule-with-return-false/26913/6](https://community.openhab.org/t/exit-rule-with-return-false/26913/6) I put this case to the issues. Maybe not a big deal. Main problem is, to be able to break a rule execution. This works with `if (something) return false` but it causes an error in the designer and during loading the rule file. If you use instead this one: `if (something) return` then, there is no error in the designer and no error during loading the file, but the execution of the rule is not longer possible. Thx for solving.

bug.title: NullPointerException when updating contents of sitemap
bug.body: I see this NPE when I edit the contents of my sitemap file. ``` 2017-07-09 08:35:52.874 [ERROR] [.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver] - Error handling update of file '/opt/openhab2/conf/sitemaps/1410r.sitemap': null. java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.PageChangeListener.getAllItems(PageChangeListener.java:125)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.PageChangeListener.updateItemsAndWidgets(PageChangeListener.java:75)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.PageChangeListener.sitemapContentChanged(PageChangeListener.java:217)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.SitemapSubscriptionService.modelChanged(SitemapSubscriptionService.java:277)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl.notifyListeners(ModelRepositoryImpl.java:286)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl.addOrRefreshModel(ModelRepositoryImpl.java:136)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver.checkFile(FolderObserver.java:234)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver.processWatchEvent(FolderObserver.java:297)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.service.WatchQueueReader.run(WatchQueueReader.java:206)[102:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)[:1.8.0_131] ``` Here's what I've been able to determine so far: - If I edit the sitemap file (using vi) when ssh'ed into my openhab box, the exception DOES NOT occur. In the log I see this: ``` 2017-07-09 08:49:04.147 [INFO ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Loading model '1410r.sitemap' 2017-07-09 08:49:04.207 [INFO ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Refreshing model '1410r.sitemap' 2017-07-09 08:49:04.265 [INFO ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Refreshing model '1410r.sitemap' ``` - If I edit the sitemap file (using notepad++ and VS Code) from another box where the file is exposed through a Samba share, the exception DOES occur. In the log I see this: ``` 2017-07-09 08:50:23.768 [INFO ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Refreshing model '1410r.sitemap' 2017-07-09 08:50:23.769 [WARN ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Configuration model '1410r.sitemap' is either empty or cannot be parsed correctly! 2017-07-09 08:50:23.770 [ERROR] [.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver] - Error handling update of file '/opt/openhab2/conf/sitemaps/1410r.sitemap': null. java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.PageChangeListener.getAllItems(PageChangeListener.java:125)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.PageChangeListener.updateItemsAndWidgets(PageChangeListener.java:75)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.internal.PageChangeListener.sitemapContentChanged(PageChangeListener.java:217)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap.SitemapSubscriptionService.modelChanged(SitemapSubscriptionService.java:277)[121:org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.sitemap:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl.notifyListeners(ModelRepositoryImpl.java:286)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl.addOrRefreshModel(ModelRepositoryImpl.java:136)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver.checkFile(FolderObserver.java:234)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver.processWatchEvent(FolderObserver.java:297)[126:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.service.WatchQueueReader.run(WatchQueueReader.java:206)[102:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.9.0.201706270841] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)[:1.8.0_131] 2017-07-09 08:50:23.909 [WARN ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Configuration model '1410r.sitemap' has errors, therefore ignoring it: [627,134]: mismatched input '<EOF>' expecting '}' 2017-07-09 08:50:23.931 [WARN ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Configuration model '1410r.sitemap' has errors, therefore ignoring it: [627,134]: mismatched input '<EOF>' expecting '}' 2017-07-09 08:50:23.971 [INFO ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Loading model '1410r.sitemap' 2017-07-09 08:50:24.112 [INFO ] [el.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl] - Refreshing model '1410r.sitemap' ``` Using inotifywait on the conf/sitemaps directory, I can see that the file is updated differently depending on whether it's edited locally versus through samba. I suppose this difference is what's causing the issue.

bug.title: Hue binding: bad item type for channel type "switch"
bug.body: https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/master/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue/ESH-INF/thing/channels.xml#L35 The value for tag "item-type" is incorrectly set to `SwitchItem `rather than `Switch`.

bug.title: JSR223: Script names not scoped by subdirectory for script loading at system start.
bug.body: Although the JSR223 scripting code loads files from subdirectories of `automation/jsr223`, it does not scope the file names by directory when loading scripts. For example if there is a file called 'script1.py' in two subdirectories, only one will be loaded at start time. If the scripts are added or modified after openHAB starts, then both will be loaded. @smerschjohann

bug.title: powerOnBrightness is ignored when "empty" in the things file
bug.body: I really want to keep all my config for things together (in the .things file rather than the PaperUI option) but adding a Lifx light I want the powerOnBrightness to be the previous power off value and setting it to empty in the PaperUI things config works fine when you add it (as a thing) using PaperUI BUT if you want to add it in the .things file then following the demo.things file [here](http://docs.openhab.org/addons/bindings/lifx/readme.html#demothings) causes the default value of '100' to be used... e.g. Thing lifx:colorlight:living [ deviceId="D073D5A1A1A1" ] { Channels: Type color : color [ powerOnBrightness= ] } IF however you use a value between 0-100 it DOES use that. e.g. Thing lifx:colorlight:living [ deviceId="D073D5A1A1A1" ] { Channels: Type color : color [ powerOnBrightness=75 ] }

bug.title: astro binding missing events
bug.body: I am using the following openhab2 SNAPSHOT: ``` Package: openhab2 Versions: 2.1.0~20170623003852-1 (/var/lib/apt/lists/openhab.jfrog.io_openhab_openhab-linuxpkg_dists_unstable_main_binary-armhf_Packages) Description Language: File: /var/lib/apt/lists/openhab.jfrog.io_openhab_openhab-linuxpkg_dists_unstable_main_binary-armhf_Packages MD5: 326ece3868ef747762229ee66dc0da02 openhab> bundle:list | grep -i astro 177 | Active | 80 | 0.9.0.201706211517 | Astro Binding openhab> feature:list | grep -i astro openhab-binding-astro1 | 1.10.0.SNAPSHOT | | Uninstalled | openhab-addons-legacy-2.1.0-SNAPSHOT | Astro Binding (1.x) esh-binding-astro | 0.9.0.SNAPSHOT | | Started | addons-2.1.0-SNAPSHOT | openhab-binding-astro | 2.1.0.SNAPSHOT | x | Started | addons-2.1.0-SNAPSHOT | Astro Binding ``` Sometimes my rules, based on astro events, are not fired. As I look into my events.log I am missing some events of the astro binding. Examples (These are ALL events of my astro:sun:rolladen Thing in the events log in that time: ``` 2017-06-21 22:21:00.036 [ChannelTriggeredEvent ] - astro:sun:rolladen:set#event triggered START 2017-06-21 22:25:00.023 [ChannelTriggeredEvent ] - astro:sun:rolladen:set#event triggered END 2017-06-21 22:44:00.042 [ChannelTriggeredEvent ] - astro:sun:rolladen:civilDusk#event triggered END 2017-06-22 08:00:00.047 [ChannelTriggeredEvent ] - astro:sun:rolladen:rise#event triggered END 2017-06-22 22:26:00.044 [ChannelTriggeredEvent ] - astro:sun:rolladen:set#event triggered END 2017-06-22 22:44:00.054 [ChannelTriggeredEvent ] - astro:sun:rolladen:civilDusk#event triggered END 2017-06-23 08:00:00.037 [ChannelTriggeredEvent ] - astro:sun:rolladen:rise#event triggered START ``` As you can see, sometimes the START events are missing, sometimes the END events are missing. What could be causing this? Thanks and greets

bug.title: CME in AbstractExpression of Scheduler
bug.body: Just found this in my log: ``` Exception in thread "ESH-astro-Monitor-1" java.util.ConcurrentModificationException at java.util.ArrayList.sort(ArrayList.java:1456) at java.util.Collections.sort(Collections.java:141) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.AbstractExpression.applyExpressionParts(AbstractExpression.java:195) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.AbstractExpression.parseExpression(AbstractExpression.java:173) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.AbstractExpression.parseExpression(AbstractExpression.java:141) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.AbstractExpression.setStartDate(AbstractExpression.java:96) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.CronExpression.setStartDate(CronExpression.java:188) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.AbstractExpression.getTimeAfter(AbstractExpression.java:265) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.scheduler.ExpressionThreadPoolManager$ExpressionThreadPoolExecutor$1.run(ExpressionThreadPoolManager.java:166) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) ``` At a first glance, I have no idea how we can run in concurrent modifications here, but there must be some situations that need to be considered.

bug.title: Remove separate altitude parameter from Astro binding
bug.body: When approving my auto-discovered Sun thing, I got this in my log: ``` 15:52:30.491 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ThingAddedEvent ] - Thing 'astro:sun:local' has been added. 15:52:30.493 [INFO ] [me.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent] - 'astro:sun:local' changed from UNINITIALIZED to INITIALIZING 15:52:30.500 [ERROR] [ding.astro.handler.AstroThingHandler] - Astro parameters geolocation could not be split into latitude and longitude, disabling thing 'astro:sun:local' 15:52:30.501 [INFO ] [me.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent] - 'astro:sun:local' changed from INITIALIZING to OFFLINE ``` The issue is that the discovery now adds "<lat>,<long>,<alt>" in the geoLocation config parameter of the Thing, while it expects the altitude to be filled into the dedicated "altitude" parameter instead. As we will soon have a [location context](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/3709), which also includes altitude information, I think it would make most sense to remove the "altitude" parameter of Astro things and rather mark the geoLocation parameter to be of context "location", which implicitly can hold an optional altitude value.

bug.title: [Paper UI] On/Off toggle not in sync with slider
bug.body: When looking at a dimmer item, a slider and a toggle is rendered. When the slider is moved to 0 %, the toggle should go OFF, but it doesn't. If the toggle is OFF and the slider is moved to any value > 0%, it should go ON, but it doesn't.

bug.title: ISE: No active update transaction

mode) binding = knx1,mqtt1,zwave,weather1,samsungtv,astro,ntp,wol1 In my openhab.log, I have the following type of entries (one for every channel of every thing that I have configured in my system): bug.title: [Tradfri] Handler takes more than 5000ms
bug.body: From my log: ``` 21:36:15.095 [INFO ] [me.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent] - 'tradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' changed from UNINITIALIZED (HANDLER_CONFIGURATION_PENDING) to INITIALIZING 21:36:20.095 [WARN ] [ome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager] - Initializing handler for thing 'tradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' takes more than 5000ms. 21:36:20.097 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ThingUpdatedEvent ] - Thing 'tradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' has been updated. 21:36:20.101 [INFO ] [me.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent] - 'tradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' changed from INITIALIZING to UNKNOWN ``` Note that my gateway was in a weird state - it never responded and I had to reboot it. Nonetheless, we should make sure that the handler initialization does not block in such a case.

bug.title: [Paper UI] Labels for group functions are incorrect
bug.body: The Paper UI uses incorrect descriptions for boolean group functions. Just two examples: AND(OFF,ON) shows ``` One OFF → OFF else ON ``` while it should be ``` All OFF → OFF else ON ``` and OR(OFF,ON) shows ``` All OFF → OFF else ON ``` while it should be ``` One OFF → OFF else ON ``` I didn't check the others - if we are lucky, these are the only ones that got mixed up.

bug.title: io.rest uses gson 2.5.0, although we so far only support gson 2.3.1
bug.body: I found this in my logs: ``` Exception in thread "Thread-65" java.lang.IllegalAccessError: tried to access method com.google.gson.Gson.newJsonWriter(Ljava/io/Writer;)Lcom/google/gson/stream/JsonWriter; from class org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.JSONResponse at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.JSONResponse.lambda$0(JSONResponse.java:162) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) ``` A closer analysis shows that this method is only publicly available in gson 2.5, while my setup only has gson 2.3.1 available. Interestingly, our smarthome.target resolves 2.2.4 AND 2.5.0, so the IDE picks up 2.5.0 and compiles against it. As far as I remember, we wanted to be compatible with gson 2.3.1, but it all seems to be a bit messed up right now...

bug.title: PaperUI: creating a Group with Base type Contact gives wrong functions dropdown dialog
bug.body: Trying to create a new group in PaperUI with Base type Contact does not give the correct functions dialog dropdown, instead of "OPEN/CLOSED" functions it shows available functions for Base type Switch "ON/OFF": ![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10405486/27075218-c9973192-5029-11e7-924e-c486bc41f068.JPG) Related community thread: https://community.openhab.org/t/group-settings-for-contact-group-with-paper-ui/29829 openHAB 2.1.0 Build 945

bug.title: NPE in GenericThingHandler
bug.body: ``` 2017-06-11 16:53:42.430 [ERROR] [.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver] - Error handling update of file '/openhab/conf/things/sjka.things': null. java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.thing.internal.GenericThingProvider.getAllThingUIDs(GenericThingProvider.java:870)[134:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.thing:0.9.0.201706091022] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.thing.internal.GenericThingProvider.modelChanged(GenericThingProvider.java:834)[134:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.thing:0.9.0.201706091022] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl.notifyListeners(ModelRepositoryImpl.java:286)[123:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706091022] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.ModelRepositoryImpl.addOrRefreshModel(ModelRepositoryImpl.java:136)[123:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706091022] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver.checkFile(FolderObserver.java:234)[123:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706091022] at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core.internal.folder.FolderObserver.processWatchEvent(FolderObserver.java:297)[123:org.eclipse.smarthome.model.core:0.9.0.201706091022] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.service.WatchQueueReader.run(WatchQueueReader.java:206)[99:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.9.0.201706091022] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.8.0_112] ``` What I did: * Updated a binding which now requires different configuration parameters (with my old config it failed with NPEs, just in case it matters) * I corrected them (i.e. added the missing config) * I renamed by things within the bridge (as with the new config I am allowed to freely chose their names) * Ended up with old AND new things, all with "UNKNOWN" status ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2592443/27011943-14f442ce-4ec7-11e7-9053-5dedf9633317.png) Reboot helped.

bug.title: PaperUI advanced configuration group
bug.body: This may or may not be a bug - seems to work differently then channel advanced settings. For a transport that I've been working on - I have a configuration descriptor (below). When you go to Configuration->Services->Press the Configure button on my transport - I expected the advanced group to be hidden behind a 'Advanced' or 'Show More' type of button - but it was simply displayed as is (see the screen shot below). Here is my config: ` <parameter-group name="advancedSettings"> <label>Advanced Settings</label> <description>Advanced Settings</description> <context>String</context> <advanced>true</advanced> </parameter-group> <parameter name="ipAddresses" type="text" required="true"> <label>HostNames/IP Addresses</label> <description>"Auto" to auto-detect or a comma delimited list of Hostnames and/or IP Addresses</description> <default>Auto</default> </parameter> <parameter name="exposeAll" type="boolean" required="true"> <label>Expose All</label> <description>Expose all things</description> <default>false</default> </parameter> <parameter name="localIpAddress" type="text" required="false" groupName="advancedSettings"> <label>Local IP Address</label> <description>Local IP Address (leave blank to auto discover)</description> <default></default> </parameter> ` I expected PaperUI to provide an "Show More" type of button similar to advanced channels in the thing configuration - but it simply displayed the 'advanced' group in the configuration dialog. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20641634/26949088-a02de3e4-4c66-11e7-83b9-8f01bdea02c1.png)

Ignoring 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.NumberItem'. 2017-06-07 20:11:34.663 [WARN ] [.rule.jvmmodel.RulesJvmModelInferrer] - Duplicate field: 'Coolcam_Plug_Energy_V'. Ignoring 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.NumberItem'. 2017-06-07 20:11:34.663 [WARN ] [.rule.jvmmodel.RulesJvmModelInferrer] - Duplicate field: 'Coolcam_Plug_Energy_A'. Ignoring 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.NumberItem'. 2017-06-07 20:11:34.663 [WARN ] [.rule.jvmmodel.RulesJvmModelInferrer] - Duplicate field: 'Coolcam_Plug_Total_Energy'. Ignoring 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.NumberItem'. 2017-06-07 20:11:34.663 [WARN ] [.rule.jvmmodel.RulesJvmModelInferrer] - Duplicate field: 'Coolcam_Plug'. Ignoring 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.SwitchItem'. ``` It seems I'm not the first and only one, see also https://community.openhab.org/t/oh2b5-duplicate-field-item-name/19480 https://community.openhab.org/t/why-do-i-get-warn-duplicate-field-sonosplay-save/12108 https://community.openhab.org/t/astro-binding-duplicates/12384 And they all end in the closed issue https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/1574 I think that one should be either reopened or we should continue in this issue. And of course I grepped whether I defined it double but I'm quite strict on defining all my items through files and only things through the paperUI. When grep-ing I get some hits in the json-db but I did not put them there...

bug.title: PaperUI: Rules loads Extensions
bug.body: If you don't use an extension service but open the rule category in the PaperUI (http://127.0.0.1:8080/paperui/index.html#/rules) it complains about a non available service using a notification: ERROR 503 - Service not available The service that is not available is the extension one. I don't think we need to warn every time the rules category is opened that the extension service is not available but accept the missing service silently.

bug.title: [BasicUI] Image not resized properly
bug.body: Image displayed in the Basic UI (by adding an Image element in the Sitemap) are not resized properly). In my setup I'm trying to display a screenshot from a security camera that has a 1920*1080 resolution, and the image is always bigger than its container. Adding this to the page's css (via the Chrome dev console) fix the issue: img { max-width: 100%; max-height: 100%; } I don't have much experience in Web development, so it might not be the right fix :). This is working fine in the Classic UI

bug.title: initialize() is called even though not all required config params are set
bug.body: I came across this bug while testing the Tradfri binding: Its bridge defines an host and a token as required configuration parameters. The discovery naturally only fills the host, but leaves the token null. Nonetheless, the ThingManager calls `initialize()` on the bridge handler. Here's the log: ``` 2017-05-26 23:21:21.618 [INFO ] [marthome.event.ThingAddedEvent:43 ] - Thing 'ikeatradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' has been added. 2017-05-26 23:21:21.618 [DEBUG] [.c.thing.internal.ThingManager:461 ] - Thing 'ikeatradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' is tracked by ThingManager. 2017-05-26 23:21:21.619 [DEBUG] [.c.thing.internal.ThingManager:603 ] - Calling 'IkeaTradfriHandlerFactory.registerHandler()' for thing 'ikeatradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d'. 2017-05-26 23:21:21.655 [DEBUG] [.core.common.ThreadPoolManager:115 ] - Created scheduled thread pool 'thingHandler' of size 3 2017-05-26 23:21:21.666 [INFO ] [ome.event.ThingStatusInfoEvent:43 ] - 'ikeatradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' updated: INITIALIZING 2017-05-26 23:21:21.666 [DEBUG] [.c.thing.internal.ThingManager:728 ] - Calling initialize handler for thing 'ikeatradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' at 'org.openhab.binding.ikeatradfri.handler.IkeaTradfriGatewayHandler@131a549d'. 2017-05-26 23:21:21.667 [INFO ] [nt.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent:43 ] - 'ikeatradfri:gateway:gwb072bf27b71d' changed from UNINITIALIZED to INITIALIZING ```

bug.title: [BasicUI] Icons & font MaterialIcons-Regular are missing
bug.body: In BasicUI some of the icons do not show up, i.e. the group navigation (arrow left/right) or the color picker items. In addition the requested font MaterialIcons-Regular is not available from the web/fonts folder. I wonder why this ever worked because the files for this font never were part of the repository according to git history. ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1729268/26488119/75ff7cea-4202-11e7-835b-b98f0c479302.png) I can see that @resetnow did changes to material-icons.css which indicate that this should have been working some day with 072e76c7be6efadd93821fba17b82516b3265c83 what am I missing here? When I revert 072e76c7be6efadd93821fba17b82516b3265c83 and put current version of MaterialIcons-Regular.woff2 in the web/fonts folder everything works well. Tested in Chrome/Safari/Firefox on macOS.

bug.title: [Paper UI] Brightness slider must not send HSB commands
bug.body: Using the brightness slider (the middle one) for color channels in the Paper UI results in HSB commands being sent. Instead, it should send PercentTypes only, because otherwise it is not possible to adjust the brightness if the hue&saturations settings might not be correct in the UI (e.g. because the color has been adjusted using a color temperature control). As far as I remember, this used to be the case in the past. Has anything changed here?

bug.title: [Paper UI] Sliders for Dimmer items have lost % sign
bug.body: So far, the Paper UI showed the textual percent value for sliders. This does not seem to be the case anymore: @aounhaider1 & @htreu Any idea what might have caused this change?

bug.title: PaperUI has empty Control page
bug.body: The Control page is completely empty if I have Things in Uninitialized state. The Things are Uninitialized because the binding for those Things is uninstalled. If I delete those Things, the Control page is populated again. Here's an image showing the empty Control page, along with the network trace showing all the Things being received by PaperUI.

bug.title: FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest fails
bug.body: Build of latest commit 5bf48f2df79dc5d5e9a9a9f65278f494d3b0884c fails in test case FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest : (but problem was already observed in builds of previous commits) ``` Results : Failed tests: FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest.assert that update firmware handles general handler error:831->assertFailedFirmwareUpdate:1021->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:-1->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:191->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:220 Expected: is "An unexpected error occurred during firmware update." but: was "Es ist ein unerwarteter Fehler wõhrend des Firmware-Updates aufgetreten." FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest.assert that handler can set error message for failed firmware update:854->assertFailedFirmwareUpdate:1021->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:-1->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:191->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:220 Expected: is "Error" but: was "Fehler" FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest.assert that cancelFirmwareUpdate sets internalFailed on ProgressCallback if the operation took to long:527->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:-1->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:191->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:220 Expected: is "A timeout occurred during canceling of firmware update." but: was "Das Abbrechen des Firmware-Updates ist aufgrund einer Zeit³berschreitung fehlgeschlagen." FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest.assert that cancelFirmwareUpdate sets internalFailed on ProgressCallback if an exception occur:457->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:-1->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:191->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:220 Expected: is "An unexpected error occurred during canceling of firmware update." but: was "Es ist ein unerwarteter Fehler wõhrend des Abbruchs eines Firmware-Updates aufgetreten." FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest.assert that update firmware handles time out:808->assertFailedFirmwareUpdate:1021->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:-1->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:191->OSGiTest.waitForAssert:220 Expected: is "A timeout occurred during firmware update." but: was "Das Firmware-Update ist aufgrund einer Zeit³berschreitung fehlgeschlagen." Tests run: 184, Failures: 5, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0 ``` Build-Environment: ``` mvn -v Apache Maven 3.5.0 (ff8f5e7444045639af65f6095c62210b5713f426; 2017-04-03T21:39:06+02:00) Maven home: C:\Tools\apache-maven-3.5.0\bin\.. Java version: 1.8.0_131, vendor: Oracle Corporation Java home: C:\Programme\Java\jdk1.8.0_131\jre Default locale: de_DE, platform encoding: Cp1252 OS name: "windows 10", version: "10.0", arch: "amd64", family: "windows" JAVA_HOME="C:\Programme\Java\jdk1.8.0_131" mvn clean install ``` It seems that in my environment the german locale provider is used in class FirmwareUpdateService which lets the assertion in the test fail, because an english translation is expected. Test cases e.g. FirmwareRegistryOSGiTest which use a similar localization mechanism do not fail. Please find the test log here: [org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.firmware.FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest.txt](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/files/1005365/org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.firmware.FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest.txt)

bug.title: Race condition in BundleProcessorVetoManager
bug.body: With very unfortunate timing it is possible that the BundleProcessorVetoManager vetoes a bundle without actually processing the queued action as seen in this log: ``` 2017-05-15T14:53:40.629+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/ColorTemperatureLight.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.665+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Create an empty XmlDocumentProvider for the module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'. 2017-05-15T14:53:40.666+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/DimmableLight.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.677+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/bridge.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.698+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/channels.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.736+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/DimmablePlug.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.749+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/OnOffLight.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.767+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/ColorLight.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.777+0200 145 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager] - Thing 'hue:bridge:001788141f1a' is tracked by ThingManager. 2017-05-15T14:53:40.790+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/ExtendedColorLight.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.817+0200 148 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/OnOffPlug.xml' in module 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'... 2017-05-15T14:53:40.849+0200 143 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.BundleProcessorVetoManager] - Finished loading meta-data of bundle 'org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue'. 2017-05-15T14:53:40.855+0200 143 DEBUG [symbolicName=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core, className=org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.BundleProcessorVetoManager] - bug.title: [Test failures] FSInternetRadioHandlerOSGiTest failing
bug.body: Just recently the following FSInternetRadioTest started failing pretty persistently on Travis: ``` verify the HTTP status is handled correctly when it is not OK_200(org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.fsinternetradio.test.FSInternetRadioHandlerOSGiTest) Time elapsed: 1.13 sec <<< FAILURE! java.lang.AssertionError: Something went wrong with the removal of the registered Items Expected: is <true> but: was <false> at org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat(MatcherAssert.java:20) at org.junit.Assert.assertThat(Assert.java:865) at org.junit.Assert$assertThat$0.callStatic(Unknown Source) at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.CallSiteArray.defaultCallStatic(CallSiteArray.java:53) at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.callStatic(AbstractCallSite.java:157) at org.codehaus.groovy.runtime.callsite.AbstractCallSite.callStatic(AbstractCallSite.java:173) at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.fsinternetradio.test.FSInternetRadioHandlerOSGiTest.clearTheItemRegistry(FSInternetRadioHandlerOSGiTest.groovy:741) at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.fsinternetradio.test.FSInternetRadioHandlerOSGiTest.tearDown(FSInternetRadioHandlerOSGiTest.groovy:127) ``` Hudson is still happy, so we still have nightly builds. It mainly hits the PR builds on Travis.

bug.title: Paper UI does not store Things' Location in Build #914
bug.body: If you edit the location from within HABmin changes are applied successfully, changes from Paper UI are discarded.

bug.title: Noisy logging of JsonStorage on a fresh installation
bug.body: A fresh installation welcomes the user with this logging: ``` 15:12:10.463 [INFO ] [e.smarthome.storage.json.JsonStorage] - Json storage file at '/Users/kai/Downloads/oh/userdata/jsondb/org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.Item.json' was not read. 15:12:10.600 [INFO ] [e.smarthome.storage.json.JsonStorage] - Json storage file at '/Users/kai/Downloads/oh/userdata/jsondb/org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.link.ItemChannelLink.json' was not read. 15:12:10.604 [INFO ] [e.smarthome.storage.json.JsonStorage] - Json storage file at '/Users/kai/Downloads/oh/userdata/jsondb/org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.link.ItemThingLink.json' was not read. 15:12:10.606 [INFO ] [e.smarthome.storage.json.JsonStorage] - Json storage file at '/Users/kai/Downloads/oh/userdata/jsondb/org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.Thing.json' was not read. 15:12:11.081 [INFO ] [e.smarthome.storage.json.JsonStorage] - Json storage file at '/Users/kai/Downloads/oh/userdata/jsondb/org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.DiscoveryResult.json' was not read. ``` It is perfectly valid that there aren't yet any database files, so I consider this a bug.

bug.title: PaperUI 2.1.0 Snapshot 0.9.0.201705081500 is blank
bug.body: After upgrade of the openHAB2 snapshot installation from 910 to 911, PaperUI comes up with only {{title}} > {{subtitle}} info ![paperui_error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25465966/25817634/9b80b9dc-3430-11e7-8b89-3f919f8130de.jpg) OH Community Thread: https://community.openhab.org/t/paperui-empty-after-upgrade-to-snapshot-911/28051

bug.title: Paper UI: Text entry field jumps from left to right and back
bug.body: Tested with openHAB build 909 on Windows 10 with Chrome 58 (Edge shows the same behavior) This is the initial view of the configuration page for the Homematic bridge configuration: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/25783695/452c7b90-3361-11e7-8a86-8ce9a6cbd7fb.png) The text entry field "Callback Network Address" is located in the right column. I think there is a bug in layout because the "Callback Network Address" should be located in the left column. Now I set the focus to field "Gateway type" (either by clicking into the field or by using the Tab key) and "Callback Network Address" jumps to the left column: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/25783747/accabc30-3361-11e7-8542-c52fee11e7f8.png) If I then click into the edit field "Callback Network Address" or if the browser window loses the focus the field automatically jumps to the right column again.

bug.title: Paper UI needs a manual refresh to show bridge on Configuration / Things
bug.body: Tested with a fresh installation of openHAB Build 909 on Windows 10 with Chrome 58. I performed the following steps: - Page "Inbox": "Search for things" - Selected "Homematic Binding" - Selected "Add manually" and again "Homematic Binding" - Configured Homematic Bridge and saved the configuration - Browser automatically opens page "Configuation > Things", which is empty: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/25783667/a66bbd9a-3360-11e7-8a39-6a3aa7421b77.png) After a manual browser refresh the bridge is shown: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/25783670/b9d0649e-3360-11e7-955a-8cffa540476f.png)

bug.title: LIFX Infrared channel not working as expected
bug.body: I just tried a LIFX+ bulb with IR support. From the app, it seems that the IR light can only be switched on and off, but it isn't able to dim it. The LIFX binding offers IR as a dimmer, though. I tried that and checked the light intensity with an IP cam, but it seems that it indeed does not dim - I see some changed in intensity when using the slider, but this is not continuous and also not significant. So I assume that we probably should change it to a switch channel. @wborn wdyt?

bug.title: LIFX color temperature channel not working as expected
bug.body: When using the color temperature channel of LIFX bulbs, it slightly changes the tone, but it does not switch to "white mode". Instead, I expect it to always switch to a white tone (cold to warm), but not keep hue/saturation in place from before (same as in the LIFX app when switching from "color" to "white tone" color wheel). This is afaik a regression - I remember that we discussed that in the past already and it had been fixed. @wborn Could you please have a look?

bug.title: LIFX binding causes endless loop when network disappears
bug.body: Regularly when doing demos, leaving the runtime active, but shutting down the network (or switching the Wifi), ESH hangs in an endless loop in the LIFX binding, causing 100% CPU load: ``` 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' 21:41:43.523 [ERROR] [ternal.LifxLightCommunicationHandler] - An exception occurred while writing data : 'Can't assign requested address' ``` @wborn is there an easy way to fix this?

bug.title: Rule is not executed when no event name is passed
bug.body: Environment / device: openHAB 2.0 Build #905 / RaspberryPI 3B with openHABian Steps to reproduce: 1. Create a new rule responding to the event channel, e.g. ``` rule "Tide Dash button pressed" when Channel "amazondashbutton:dashbutton:Tide:press" triggered then sendNotification("some@email.com", "Amazon button pressed!") sendCommand(Vacuum_Dock, ON) end ``` or ``` rule "Xiaomi Switch" when Channel "mihome:sensor_switch:<ID>:button" triggered then var actionName = receivedEvent.getEvent() switch(actionName) { case "CLICK": { <ACTION> } case "DOUBLE_CLICK": { <ACTION> } case "LONG_CLICK_PRESS": { <ACTION> } case "LONG_CLICK_RELEASE": { <ACTION> } } end ``` 2. Try to trigger the events and see the results Expected result: The rule is triggered and performed actions should be logged in the console. Actual result: The rule doesn't trigger, nothing is being logged. Note that both rules worked for me before I updated the distro to the latest one. When I pass event name to the `when` section, e.g. ``` Channel "mihome:sensor_switch:<ID>:button" triggered CLICK ``` everything works properly as expected.

bug.title: thingUpdated() gets called during initialize()
bug.body: As observed in https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/pull/2019#issuecomment-298440882 and https://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php/t/1085852/ it seems that `ThingHandler.thingUpdated()` gets called while the handler is still in `ThingHandler.initialize()`. This puts the unnecessary burden of handling synchronization on bindings and is not intended.

bug.title: BasicUI: Images and Charts not updating according to Configuration
bug.body: There's been a discussion in the community about images and charts not updating as expected: https://community.openhab.org/t/basic-ui-image-refresh-rate-in-seconds-instead-miliseconds/27152 Some tests suggest that the refresh parameter is interpreted differently: * ClassicUI: milli sec * BasicUI: sec **Fix**: Use same time base for all UIs Also, in my own setup the update works only on images not on charts. The chart initially loads in BasicUI but then instead of updating it shows a broken image symbol.

bug.title: PaperUI does not respect limitToOptions=false
bug.body: The configuration parameter dropdown is rendered as a list only and it's not possible to enter values other than those in the list.

bug.title: [REST/Persistence] API request for persistence items returns empty list
bug.body: I installed two persistence extensions: rrd4j and InfluxDB. A GET request to "/rest/persistence" returns the following result: `[ { "id": "rrd4j", "label": "rrd4j", "type": "Queryable" }, { "id": "influxdb", "label": "influxdb", "type": "Queryable" } ]` A GET request to "/rest/persistence/items?serviceId=rrd4j" and "/rest/persistence/items?serviceId=influxdb" returns an empty list with status code 200: `[]` Expected result: A list of all available items as defined in the *.rules file. The data for a specific item is available at "/rest/persistence/items/{ITEMID}?serviceId=influxdb". The behaviour can be reproduced with a clean install of openHAB 2.0.0.

bug.title: Change to DayLigth saving Time causes stop in timerelated persistence strategies
bug.body: As reported in the OH community ( [Link](https://community.openhab.org/t/openhab-not-saving-mesaurements-after-daylight-saving-time-change/25647)) the change to DayLigth Saving Time caused persistence schedules that are only using a time based strategy (everyMinute etc.) to stop at the time-switch. Checks done on my side: Actual values continued to be displayed. The check of the database (rrd4j with a "everyMinute" strategy) showed the last value to be stored at the time-switch. Several users confirmed that after restart of the OH-instance the time-scheduled persistence was working again. There is also an report on a cron based rule that stopped working, can't say if it is really related to the above.

bug.title: JSON Field Type Mismatch in `/rules` Endpoint.
bug.body: Hi, It seems like there might be a JSON field type mismatch when hitting the `/rules` endpoint. When fetching the rules from `GET /rules`, sometimes the JSON response for a rule contains the field `"required": "false"` which I believe is meant to actually be a `boolean` (inside `Rule->Actions->Inputs`). Steps: - I created a new rule (containing just one trigger) with `POST /rules`. - Next, I updated that rule so that it would have a second trigger by calling the `PUT /rules/{ruleUID}` endpoint. - After refreshing the list of rules by calling `GET /rules`, the newly updated rule JSON now contains the field `"required": "false"`. That field wasn't there prior to adding a second trigger. Here's what the final JSON response looked like (scrapping out all of the unnecessary stuff). ` { ... "actions": [{ "inputs": { "required": "false" }, "id": "2", "configuration": {}, "type": "script.ScriptAction" }], ... } ` Is this intended, or a bug? The `/module-types` endpoint also uses the `Inputs` JSON schema, but that one actually sets the `"required"` field to a `boolean` instead of a `String`.

bug.title: NPE in Configuration.toString()
bug.body: In the ThingHandlerFactory of my binding I log a Thing's configuration when I process a Thing in createHandler(). The thing types are initialized with static XMLs, and I have several configuration properties which do not have a default value. The current Configuration.toString() method fails with a NPE, since it attempts to read the class of a property's value, and such value is not set.

bug.title: Group Item Does Not Have Valid Defaults For Group:Dimmer and Group:Switch
bug.body: The Item syntax in `Items.xtext` clearly indicates that the `ModelGroupFunction` is optional, even if the `ModelItemType` is specified. However, at least with `Group:Dimmer` and `Group:Switch` (without a `ModelGroupFunction`), declarations like ``` Group:Dimmer bedroom_dimmers Group:Switch bedroom_switches ``` result in an error ``` [ERROR] [arthome.core.items.dto.ItemDTOMapper] - Group function 'AND' requires two arguments. Using Equality instead. ``` This is in conflict with the openHAB documentation at http://docs.openhab.org/configuration/items.html#groups > By default, if no function is provided to the group, the Group uses OR. Pretty clearly, that's wrong, between the error message, and it not working. Expected Behavior: An appropriate default would be implemented for the impacted `ModelItemTypes` --- The reason to support a group qualified by `ModelItemType` is at least three-fold: * Clarify what can and what shouldn't be added to the group * Provide at least Designer, if not run-time protection of adding the "wrong" kind of items to the group * Narrow choices within Designer's pickers I'm not terribly concerned as to _what_ the default is. I can always specify it if I'm using the group for more than just collecting it's elements for ease of management or for iterating over them. See further https://community.openhab.org/t/items-bug-group-function-and-requires-two-arguments-using-equality-instead/25268

bug.title: itemAdded called multiple times on RegistryChangeListener at boot
bug.body: Hi there, I'm maintaining the ImperiHome IO add-on for openHAB and have an issue getting the item event listener stable when loaded at boot time of openHAB. Consider the following code: public class TestAddon { private final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(TestAddon.class); private ItemRegistry itemRegistry; private ItemProcessor itemProcessor; protected void activate() { logger.info("TEST - Addon activated"); itemProcessor = new ItemProcessor(itemRegistry); } protected void deactivate() { itemProcessor.destroy(); itemProcessor = null; logger.info("TEST - Addon deactivated"); } protected void setItemRegistry(ItemRegistry itemRegistry) { this.itemRegistry = itemRegistry; } protected void unsetItemRegistry(ItemRegistry itemRegistry) { this.itemRegistry = null; } } public class ItemProcessor implements ItemRegistryChangeListener { private final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(ItemProcessor.class); private final ItemRegistry itemRegistry; public ItemProcessor(ItemRegistry itemRegistry) { this.itemRegistry = itemRegistry; itemRegistry.addRegistryChangeListener(this); allItemsChanged(null); } public void destroy() { itemRegistry.removeRegistryChangeListener(this); } @Override public void added(Item item) { logger.info("TEST -- Item added: {}", logString(item)); } @Override public void removed(Item item) { logger.info("TEST -- Item removed: {}", logString(item)); } @Override public void updated(Item oldItem, Item newItem) { logger.info("TEST -- Item updated, old={} new={}", logString(oldItem), logString(newItem)); } @Override public void allItemsChanged(Collection<String> oldItems) { logger.info("TEST -- allItemsChanged"); for (Item item : itemRegistry.getItems()) { logger.info("TEST -- allItemsChanged item: {}", logString(item)); } } private String logString(Item item) { return item.getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(System.identityHashCode(item)); } } When dropped into the 'addons' directory, this gives me the following log when freshly starting openHAB: 2017-03-10 21:03:19.818 [INFO ] [org.openhab.io.test.ItemProcessor ] - TEST -- allItemsChanged 2017-03-10 21:03:27.174 [INFO ] [org.openhab.io.test.ItemProcessor ] - TEST -- Item added: M_ENT_Temperature@3ac4d37c 2017-03-10 21:03:27.388 [INFO ] [org.openhab.io.test.ItemProcessor ] - TEST -- Item added: M_ENT_Temperature@328f69c5 2017-03-10 21:03:27.659 [INFO ] [org.openhab.io.test.ItemProcessor ] - TEST -- Item added: M_ENT_Temperature@10aacbc9 2017-03-10 21:03:27.882 [INFO ] [org.openhab.io.test.ItemProcessor ] - TEST -- Item added: M_ENT_Temperature@12f9dd16 2017-03-10 21:03:28.148 [INFO ] [org.openhab.io.test.ItemProcessor ] - TEST -- Item added: M_ENT_Temperature@61bd4d5 The 'added' method of the ItemProcessor is called 5 times for the same item, but with a different org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.Item instance. There are no calls to 'removed' or 'updated' (as expected). The log is filtered for one particular item; the same happens for all items in my system. My real add-on is adding a StateChangeListener to each item it's interested in. However, only the first Item instance provided to 'added' is really working and delivering state updates. This doesn't seem very stable or desirable. How should my add-on deal with this? Should I ignore repeated 'added' calls for the same item name? Is this a bug? I'm using the current snapshot of openHAB 2. My items are in .items files, so not added with Paper UI.

bug.title: Installing Rules Engine Crashes Event Source
bug.body: It seems that when I install the Rules engine (either through PaperUI or by hitting the endpoint `http://{ip_addr}/rest/extensions/misc-ruleengine/install`) the event stream crashes, hence why the loading spinner never completes in PaperUI. Steps to reproduce: - `curl http://{ip_addr}/rest/events` to listen to the event stream. - Install the rules engine in PaperUI > Add-ons > Misc > Install Rules Engine (Experimental) - *curl process gets terminated and loading spinner never completes* Our app depends on the Rules engine, so it needs to be able to listen for the install completed event. I've tried installing other extensions and I can see them being logged when they're installed/uninstalled. This seems to only happen when installing the Rules engine.

bug.title: Scheduler not working reliable for Cron Expressions
bug.body: Rules using a Cron trigger does not work as expected. There are messages from the `ExpressionThreadPoolManager` (I assume for every rule one message): ``` 2017-03-08 07:15:00,423 | Expression '0 15 07 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 07:15:00,474 | Expression '0 15 07 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 07:15:00,835 | Expression '0 15 07 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 07:15:00,849 | Expression '0 15 07 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 08:00:00,615 | Expression '0 00 08 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 19:15:00,372 | Expression '0 15 19 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 19:45:00,450 | Expression '0 45 19 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 20:00:00,166 | Expression '0 00 20 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore 2017-03-08 21:00:00,157 | Expression '0 00 21 ? * MON,TUE,WED,THU,FRI,SAT,SUN' has no future executions anymore ``` I assume it is a bug that there are no future executors for that expression. @kgoderis Could you have a look at. Is it similar to #2105 or #2746?

bug.title: Paper UI: show more / show less button no more available for things with channel groups
bug.body: For thing types using channel groups, the button "show more" / "show less" is no more available in Paper UI.

bug.title: PaperUI, Rules: Rule from catalog
bug.body: Using the current PaperUI on a setup with enabled Rule / Automation support, it shows the "Rule from catalog" option if you want to create a new rule. This results in "ERROR: 503 - Service Unavailable". I assume this option should only be visible if the service is available.

bug.title: PaperUI | DecimalType is parsed to Integer
bug.body: I noticed that the Paper UI no longer displays decimals places. This bug was introduced in #2628: The PR added the handling of the `statechanged` event, but it ignores the fact, that the `statechanged`event is not unique to the Rollershutter type and therefore parsing all DecimalType and PercentType using `parseInt`. Please correct me if i am wrong, but I do not see a real use case for the `statechanged` event and therefore would simply delete the event listener, thus preventing it from overwriting the state properly handled by the `state` event.

bug.title: Control UI does not show Image items when being opened
bug.body: When an Image item has a state, the Paper UI does not correctly render it when opening the Control tab: Once an update is received through SSE, it is displayed correctly.

bug.title: Test failure(s): Wemo tests
bug.body: After switching to Java 8 and also updating the Tycho plugin etc. it seems that the Wemo tests failed on Hudson. It seems that the `Failed` is first caused by `org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo.handler.test.WemoHandlerOSGiTest.assert that thing handles OnOff command correctly` ```text Error Message Expected: is <0> but: was <2> ``` ```text Stacktrace java.lang.AssertionError: Expected: is <0> but: was <2> at org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat(MatcherAssert.java:20) at
