Perhaps this will give us more insights.

bug.title: Switch Groups changing to UNDEF
bug.body: With OH2 GA (might also occur with other versions) I do face an issue with Group:Switch:OR going to "UNDEF" instead of ON or OFF. I do own some motion sensors (Homematic HM-Sen-MDIR-O-2) and "itemized" them as follows: ``` Group:Switch:OR(ON,OFF) gMotion "Motion detected" Switch M1 "Motion Sensor #1" <motion> (gMotion) { channel="homematic:..." } Switch M2 "Motion Sensor #2 " <motion> (gMotion) { channel="homematic:..." } ``` However, the group's state only is ON or OFF if both sensors have the same state. If their state's differ, the group reports itself as UNDEF. On motion, the event.log prints ``` [GroupItemStateChangedEvent] - gMotion changed from OFF to UNDEF through M1 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - M1 changed from OFF to ON ``` later: ``` [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - M1 changed from ON to OFF [GroupItemStateChangedEvent] - gMotion changed from UNDEF to OFF through M1 Source of Issue (issue reported by m0wlheldChristoph Dahlen): https://community.openhab.org/t/issue-with-group-switch-or-going-to-undef/21403 ``` My findings: If all switches are OFF, the group is OFF If only one or several are ON, then the group is UNDEF If all are ON, the group is ON ################### I checked another group of 30 switches. All have changed from NULL to OFF after starting OH. The group then switches from NULL to OFF too, when the last item of the group switches to OFF. `gStickyUnreach changed from NULL to OFF through Win_Kind1_StickyUnreach` So far so good. But when I change one switch to ON, the group goes UNDEF for some reason. ``` 2017-02-18 11:34:46.020 [ItemStateChangedEvent ] - Heiz_WohnZ_StickyUnreach changed from OFF to ON 2017-02-18 11:34:46.023 [GroupItemStateChangedEvent] - gStickyUnreach changed from OFF to UNDEF through Heiz_WohnZ_StickyUnreach ```

bug.title: Cannot create rule based on template
bug.body:
I have this template defined: ```json [ { "uid":"demo:energymeter", "label":"Energy Meter", "description":"Visualizes the current energy consumption.", "configDescriptions":[ { "name":"consumption", "type":"TEXT", "context":"item", "label":"Consumption Item", "description":"Data source for current consumption", "required":true }, { "name":"light", "type":"TEXT", "context":"item", "label":"Color Item", "description":"Color light to use for visualisation", "required":true }, { "name":"max", "type":"INTEGER", "label":"Max. consumption", "description":"Maximum value (in W) for red light", "required":true, "defaultValue":1500 } ], "triggers": [ { "id": "trigger", "label": "Current consumption changes", "description": "Triggers whenever the current consumption changes its value", "configuration": { "itemName": "${consumption}" }, "type": "core.ItemStateChangeTrigger" } ], "conditions": [], "actions": [ { "inputs": {}, "id": "setcolor", "label": "Change the light color", "description": "Sets the color to a value in the range from green (low consumption) to red (high consumption)", "configuration": { "type": "application/javascript", "script": "var power = trigger.event.getItemState().toString()
var percent = power / (${max} / 100) 
if(percent < 0) percent = 0
var hue = 120 - percent
events.sendCommand('${light}', hue +',100,100')" }, "type": "script.ScriptAction" } ] } ] ``` When creating a rule through the REST API (using the Paper UI), this is what ends up in the rule registry: ```json [ { "enabled": false, "status": { "status": "DISABLED", "statusDetail": "NONE" }, "triggers": [ { "id": "trigger", "configuration": { "itemName": "${consumption}" }, "type": "core.ItemStateChangeTrigger" } ], "conditions": [], "actions": [ { "inputs": {}, "id": "setcolor", "label": "Change the light color", "description": "Sets the color to a value in the range from green (low consumption) to red (high consumption)", "configuration": { "type": "application/javascript", "script": "var power = trigger.event.getItemState().toString()
var percent = power / (${max} / 100) 
if(percent < 0) percent = 0
var hue = 120 - percent
events.sendCommand('${light}', hue +',100,100')" }, "type": "script.ScriptAction" } ], "configuration": { "consumption": "Window_FF_Office_Door", "light": "Window_FF_Office_Door", "max": 1500 }, "configDescriptions": [ { "name": "consumption", "type": "TEXT", "required": true, "readOnly": false, "multiple": false, "context": "item", "label": "Consumption Item", "description": "Data source for current consumption", "options": [], "filterCriteria": [], "limitToOptions": false, "advanced": false }, { "name": "light", "type": "TEXT", "required": true, "readOnly": false, "multiple": false, "context": "item", "label": "Color Item", "description": "Color light to use for visualisation", "options": [], "filterCriteria": [], "limitToOptions": false, "advanced": false }, { "name": "max", "type": "INTEGER", "required": true, "readOnly": false, "multiple": false, "defaultValue": "1500", "label": "Max. consumption", "description": "Maximum value (in W) for red light", "options": [], "filterCriteria": [], "limitToOptions": false, "advanced": false } ], "uid": "rule_1", "name": "Energy Meter", "tags": [], "visibility": "VISIBLE", "description": "Visualizes the current energy consumption." } ] ``` Note that - the placeholders are not replaced with the config values (or is this already a new feature?) - the rule contains the config params and config descriptions - the trigger is missing label and description

bug.title: Basic UI: Colorpicker ON/OFF problem
bug.body: Hi, there is an issue with the colorpicker in the BasicUI. The colorpicker is working perfectly but not the two buttons next to it (left and right to turn on and off). The problem is discussed here: https://community.openhab.org/t/openhab2-problem-with-colorpicker-in-basic-ui/19421 Does anyone know a solution? Thanks!

bug.title: Paper UI not showing updated thing settings without a browser cache refresh
bug.body: Using Paper UI, I update a thing configuration and validate. My thing is updated (dispose and then initialize). Then if I reopen my thing configuration in Paper UI, I see the previous settings. Using Ctrl+F5 in Firefox then show me the current and correct settings.

bug.title: Handlers taking more than 5000ms to run
bug.body: There are a growing number of problems showing up on the OH2 forum about handlers taking more than 5000ms - see -: https://community.openhab.org/t/handler-takes-more-than-5000ms-for-processing-event/22158/15 This seems to affect a wide range of bindings so I would guess it could be framework related.

bug.title: [Paper UI] Multiple inbox entries shown for the same discovery result
bug.body: There are situations, where the Paper UI inbox does not correctly update itself and rather adds already known results another time. This is what I saw after leaving the inbox page open for a while: See also https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/issues/1667.

bug.title: Advanced dynamically added channels are not hidden in Paper UI
bug.body: For #2663 I am dynamically adding advanced channels (`colorzone`, `temperaturezone`) to `colormzlight` Things. That works well, however Paper UI does not hide these `advanced` channels when configuring or controlling a Thing. I did some research and to me it seems Paper UI uses the response from the `thing-types` REST service to determine if channels should be hidden. However the dynamic channel types (`colorzone`, `temperaturezone`) are missing from the response of http://localhost:8080/rest/thing-types/lifx:colormzlight : ```json { "channels": [{ "description": "Selects the color of the light", "id": "color", "label": "Color", "tags": ["Lighting"], "properties": {}, "category": "ColorLight", "advanced": false, "typeUID": "lifx:color" }, { "description": "Sets the temperature of the light", "id": "temperature", "label": "Temperature", "tags": [], "properties": {}, "category": "Temperature", "advanced": false, "typeUID": "lifx:temperature" }], "channelGroups": [], "configParameters": [{ "label": "LIFX device ID", "name": "deviceId", "required": true, "type": "TEXT", "readOnly": false, "multiple": false, "advanced": false, "limitToOptions": true, "options": [], "filterCriteria": [] }, { "defaultValue": "300", "description": "The time to fade to the new color value (in ms).", "label": "Fade time", "name": "fadetime", "required": false, "type": "INTEGER", "readOnly": false, "multiple": false, "advanced": false, "limitToOptions": true, "options": [], "filterCriteria": [] }], "parameterGroups": [], "properties": {}, "UID": "lifx:colormzlight", "label": "LIFX Color MultiZone Light", "listed": true, "supportedBridgeTypeUIDs": [], "bridge": false } ``` The channel type definitions used can be found in this [channel.xml](https://github.com/wborn/smarthome/blob/2663-lifx-multizone-support/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx/ESH-INF/thing/channel.xml) The channels are then dynamically created in this [LifxLightHandler.java]( https://github.com/wborn/smarthome/blob/2663-lifx-multizone-support/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/binding/lifx/handler/LifxLightHandler.java#L299).

bug.title: [Paper UI] "Reload" button at the top right of the Control UI is broken
bug.body: Clicking the "reload" button on the top right of the Control header makes the content disappear, but not refresh - happens on both Safari+Chrome: ![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 16 45 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/22210814/56a1e8a6-e18b-11e6-904b-1e777b57e636.png) @aounhaider1 Could you please check?

bug.title: [Paper UI] Widgets on Control UI change position on every browser reload
bug.body: On every browser reload (F5), the widgets are at a different position (using Safari), which is pretty annoying: ![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 16 40 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/22210643/cffe5f28-e18a-11e6-9fb7-fb936ff25e32.png) ![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 16 40 35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/22210644/d00495fa-e18a-11e6-8d03-99cf73506926.png) ![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 16 40 41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/22210646/d004f342-e18a-11e6-9127-5f47a7aeb647.png) ![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 16 40 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/22210645/d004ad88-e18a-11e6-84c8-b87148d1d72f.png) In any case (also on other browsers), I do not really like the layout algorithm - it often leaves pretty big gaps and it all rather looks shuffled around instead of being nicely stacked. @aounhaider1 Are there any possibilities to improve this?

bug.title: [Paper UI] DateTime formatting broken on Safari
bug.body: This picture says it all: ![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 16 35 59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/22210432/19548270-e18a-11e6-8c46-c129dbc95404.png) @aounhaider1 Can you fix this?

bug.title: [BasicUI] Slider knob not showing in BasicUI on Microsoft Edge
bug.body: Hi everybody, I know this isn't a major issue, but I noticed that the slider knob is missing when using the BasicUI in Microsoft Edge. This makes adjusting the slider a bit tricky. **Edge:** ![snip_slider](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25036470/22208950/09581e36-e185-11e6-9086-532c825785bc.png) **IE:** ![snip_slider12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25036470/22209454/d047fe98-e186-11e6-9b47-054dac78873d.png) Using the F12 DOM Explorer and comparing the CSS styling between Edge and Internet Explorer, I discovered that the height of `.mdl-slider.is-upgraded `is set to 2px in Edge and due to an override from `_:-ms-input-placeholder, :root .mdl-slider.mdl-slider.is-upgraded` it is set to 32px in IE. As this override doesn't happen in Edge, the height stays at 2px and the knob isn't showing. **Edge:** ![snip_slider2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25036470/22208958/130dc250-e185-11e6-8898-0420ef0b0612.png) **IE:** ![snip_slider23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25036470/22208962/1692ab84-e185-11e6-85df-6a4c2830b981.png) ![snip_slider4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25036470/22208975/1f652c14-e185-11e6-87b8-46db9a4f2b58.png) Setting the height to 32px in Edge fixes the problem. I don't know if this is an issue inherent to Google Material Design or if there is a simple fix. But it would be nice to see the slider working in Edge to, as I use it as my primary browser on all my devices. Thanks!

bug.title: Hidden files cause log exceptions in automation file provider
bug.body: Just came across this in my log: ``` 2017-01-18 12:24:17.362 [DEBUG] [.f.TemplateFileProviderWatcher:248 ] - Parser DS_Store not availablejava.lang.Exception: null at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.internal.provider.file.AbstractFileProvider.importFile(AbstractFileProvider.java:248) at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.internal.provider.file.AbstractFileProvider.importResources(AbstractFileProvider.java:144) at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.internal.provider.file.AbstractFileProvider.importResources(AbstractFileProvider.java:138) at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.internal.provider.file.WatchServiceUtil.initializeWatchService(WatchServiceUtil.java:40) at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.internal.provider.file.TemplateFileProviderWatcher.initializeWatchService(TemplateFileProviderWatcher.java:22) at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.internal.provider.file.AbstractFileProvider.modified(AbstractFileProvider.java:110) at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.internal.provider.file.AbstractFileProvider.activate(AbstractFileProvider.java:86) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498) ``` I would suggest that hidden files (i.e. files starting with a ".") are always ignored.

bug.title: Module outputs are not available in scripts
bug.body: The values of outputs of other modules are made available to script, which is also directly supported by the rule editor: ![screen shot 2017-01-18 at 10 15 23](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/22057952/507b7474-dd67-11e6-88b9-7b4b69045d65.png) When trying to access those outputs, an exception is thrown. The problem is that in the rule context, they are made available as e.g. "1.newState", which is provided as a map 1->newState in within the rule execution context. It is probably rather a bad idea to define "1" as a variable name...

bug.title: Paper UI: wrong label for Image items in Control frame
bug.body: In Paper UI control frame, Image items are all labelled "Camera image" rather than the label defined in the items file.

bug.title: Paper UI Leaves empty categories in database resulting in no icons in UI's
bug.body: Entering a category and then removing it results in a empty category field in the db. That in turn leads to no icons in Classic and Basic UI's Item sHallVitrin below lacks icon in UI's . Removing the category line from the json files makes the icon appear in UI's. Icons should show up in the UI's. ``` "sLivingRoomSideboardLamp": { "class": "org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.ManagedItemProvider$PersistedItem", "value": { "groupNames": [ "AllLamps" ], "itemType": "Switch", "tags": [], "label": "lblsLivingRoomSideboardLamp" } }, "sHallVitrin": { "class": "org.eclipse.smarthome.core.items.ManagedItemProvider$PersistedItem", "value": { "groupNames": [ "WindowLamps" ], "itemType": "Switch", "tags": [], "label": "VitrinSkap", "category": "" } }, ```

bug.title: Fix events and event order fired by the automation module
bug.body: When a rule is added the first NOT_INITIALIZED event is redundant. For example: osgi> 14:28:16.652 INFO s.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent[:43] - rule_3 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED 14:28:16.657 INFO s.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent[:43] - rule_3 updated: IDLE 14:28:16.658 DEBUG o.e.s.c.c.r.AbstractManagedProvider[:62] - Added new element rule_3 to ManagedRuleProvider. 14:28:16.658 INFO smarthome.event.RuleAddedEvent[:43] - Rule 'rule_3' has been added. or when the rule can't be resolved, the following events are fired: osgi> 14:28:16.652 INFO s.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent[:43] - rule_3 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED 14:28:16.657 INFO s.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent[:43] - rule_3 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED 14:28:16.658 DEBUG o.e.s.c.c.r.AbstractManagedProvider[:62] - Added new element rule_3 to ManagedRuleProvider. 14:28:16.658 INFO smarthome.event.RuleAddedEvent[:43] - Rule 'rule_3' has been added. 1) The first one NOT_INITIALIZED must be skiped 2) Order of events should be: - Rule 'rule_3' has been added. - rule_3 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED - rule_3 updated: IDLE

bug.title: limitToOptions is ignored by Paper UI
bug.body: I have a config parameter defined with provided options and limitToOptions=false: ``` { "name":"command", "type":"TEXT", "label":"Command", "description":"the command to be sent", "required":true, "limitToOptions":false, "options":[ { "label": "ON", "value": "ON" }, { "label": "OFF", "value": "OFF" }, { "label": "OPEN", "value": "OPEN" }, { "label": "CLOSED", "value": "CLOSED" }, { "label": "UP", "value": "UP" }, { "label": "DOWN", "value": "DOWN" } ] } ``` Nonetheless, I cannot enter any arbitrary value - I can only choose one of the given options:

bug.title: Default value ignored by Paper UI
bug.body: I have a config parameter defined as: ``` { "name":"operator", "type":"TEXT", "label":"Operator", "description":"the compare operator (one of =,<,>,!=)", "required":false, "options":[ { "label": "=", "value": "=" }, { "label": "!=", "value": "!=" }, { "label": ">", "value": ">" }, { "label": "<", "value": "<" } ], "default":"=" } ``` I would expect the Paper UI to show "=" as a selection, but the field is left empty:

bug.title: [Hue Binding/Extended Color Light]: Brightness control changes color of light
bug.body: For the Osram Lightify Flex you can not change the brightness of the color temperature. As workaround, I added the brightness channel to the ExtendedColorLight.xml. `<channels> <channel id="color" typeId="color" /> <channel id="color_temperature" typeId="color_temperature" /> <channel id="brightness" typeId="brightness" /> <channel id="alert" typeId="alert" /> <channel id="effect" typeId="effect" /> </channels>`

bug.title: SmartHome Designer fails to start
bug.body: running Java 8 v111, and eclipse smarthome v8 or v9 unzipped in the applications folder. I see the splash screen and then an error is thrown. The log says this: ``` !SESSION 2017-01-12 21:40:22.670 ----------------------------------------------- eclipse.buildId=unknown java.version=1.8.0_111 java.vendor=Oracle Corporation BootLoader constants: OS=macosx, ARCH=x86_64, WS=cocoa, NL=en_US Command-line arguments: -os macosx -ws cocoa -arch x86_64 !ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 0 2017-01-12 21:40:23.533 !MESSAGE FrameworkEvent ERROR !STACK 0 org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Could not resolve module: org.eclipse.core.runtime [2] Unresolved requirement: Require-Bundle: javax.annotation; bundle-version="1.1.0"; visibility:="reexport"; resolution:="optional" Unresolved requirement: Require-Bundle: javax.inject; bundle-version="1.0.0"; visibility:="reexport"; resolution:="optional" Unresolved requirement: Require-Bundle: org.eclipse.equinox.common; bundle-version="[3.6.100,4.0.0)"; visibility:="reexport" ``` Anybody ran into this too and solved it? BR

bug.title: Wrong annotation in RuleResource
bug.body: Wrong annotation is used for RuleResource class in Automation REST API in org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.rest: @GET @Path("/{ruleUID}/config") @Consumes(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON) should be @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)

bug.title: InvocationTargetExceptions and NPEs are thrown while deinstall Automation bundle
bug.body: InvocationTargetExceptions and NPEs are thrown while deinstall Automation Bundle Resource Provider.

bug.title: Explicit import of joda DateTime required
bug.body: Some date manipulations need explicit import of org.joda.time.DateTime. Expected behaviour is that this is not required. ``` /* test.rules */ import org.joda.time.DateTime rule "TestNow" when Time cron "*/10 * * * * ?" then var DateTime dt1 = now var DateTime dt2 = now.withTimeAtStartOfDay logInfo("TestNow", "Now: " + dt1) // raises error without import if (dt1 == dt2) { // raises error without import logInfo("TestNow", "EQ") } else { logInfo(TestNow", "DIFF") } end ``` Please see this forum thread: https://community.openhab.org/t/timer-and-date-calculations-in-rules-need-help/19843/12?u=rtvb

bug.title: [REST Api] Inconsistent response of REST-Api for items with mapped values
bug.body: I'm currently using openHAB 2 build #692 with the following items / map Definition (as also described here: [https://community.openhab.org/t/mapping-of-item-values-not-correctly-shown-in-habpanel/19518](url)) ``` Contact Wohnzimmer_Fenster1_OpenClosed "Wohnzimmerfenster 1 [MAP(de.map):%s]" (Wohnzimmer, Wohnung_Fenster) { channel="max:shuttercontact:NEQ0897054:LEQ0791036:contact_state" } Contact Wohnzimmer_Fenster2_OpenClosed "Wohnzimmerfenster 2 [MAP(de.map):%s]" (Wohnzimmer, Wohnung_Fenster) { channel="max:shuttercontact:NEQ0897054:LEQ0790888:contact_state" } ``` de.map: ``` CLOSED=zu OPEN=offen ``` When I make a REST-Api call `http://homenuc:8080/rest/items/Wohnzimmer_Fenster1_OpenClosed/state` it returns **always** CLOSED respectively OPEN When you call the item with `http://homenuc:8080/rest/items/Wohnzimmer_Fenster1_OpenClosed` returns the mapped value "zu" and "offen" beside the key "state": ``` { "link": "http://homenuc:8080/rest/items/Wohnzimmer_Fenster1_OpenClosed", "state": "zu", "stateDescription": { "pattern": "", "readOnly": false, "options": [] }, "type": "Contact", "name": "Wohnzimmer_Fenster1_OpenClosed", "label": "Wohnzimmerfenster 1", "tags": [], "groupNames": [ "Wohnzimmer", "Wohnung_Fenster" ] } ``` The same also when calling it via a "sitemaps" call like: `http://homenuc:8080/rest/sitemaps/zuHause?jsoncallback=callback` ``` "widgets": [ { "widgetId": "Wohnzimmer_0", "type": "Text", "label": "Wohnzimmerfenster 1 [zu]", "icon": "contact", "mappings": [], "item": { "link": "http://homenuc:8080/rest/items/Wohnzimmer_Fenster1_OpenClosed", "state": "zu", "stateDescription": { "pattern": "", "readOnly": false, "options": [] }, "type": "Contact", "name": "Wohnzimmer_Fenster1_OpenClosed", "label": "Wohnzimmerfenster 1", "tags": [], "groupNames": [ "Wohnzimmer", "Wohnung_Fenster" ] }, "widgets": [] ``` On the "Event channel" it is also always "unmapped". This leads for example in HABpanel to the problem that the values are "jumping" between their mapped and unmapped representation dependent of the way the last call was made. I would have had expected, that the values are always send in der mapped representations via the REST Api. Kind regards, André

bug.title: Hue Binding: No status update for things with Id 0000/0010
bug.body: Have an issue here when items are being switched on/off via external app or switch (eg. Hue App): - items with thing Id 210 are being updated in openhab - items with thing Id 0000 or 0010 (Switches) are not being updated in openhab (no log entries) There is no log entry either for items where status is not being updated. With my configuration I can control all items via openhab2. When controlled with openhab2, status changes accordingly. Issue is effective with external controls only. My system is OH2b5 Online version.

bug.title: PaperUI, text entry and annoying shifting
bug.body: In the PaperUI->Control - if you have a channel that is a simple string and start typing letters, eventually you'll enter the 8th character and the whole field shifts down a line. The problem with the shift down is that the field loses focus. Especially annoying is if you click it again and backspace once (so we have 7 characters) - it shifts back up and loses focus again. This behavior makes it very difficult to enter something in. I'd rather it either get's focus (and the carot position is after the last character) or the field simply scrolls

bug.title: OH2 error when reloading things file
bug.body: Running latest snapshot on RPi, with apt-get install On startup of service, things file loads perfectly. When I edit the file and save it, I get an error (see below) demo.things ``` Bridge rfxcom:bridge:1 [ serialPort="/dev/ttyUSB1" ] { Thing lighting2 remote1_1 [deviceId="12260194.1", subType="AC"] bug.title: Config parameters normalisation not working for thing parameters
bug.body: I'm seeing some parameters being stored in the jsondb as a STRING when they are defined as INTEGER. My guess is that this is happening in the normalisation code. The parameters in question are in the thing config descriptions - not the thing-type. This is more obvious when using HABmin since HABmin only sends updates to parameters that have changed - if I don't change these parameters, then nothing is sent in the REST interface, but these parameters are being changed to STRING. PaperUI is sending the parameter as a number, and it's getting stored as 12.0 in json which is still wrong, but it does at least work in this instance. I assume that whatever code does the normalisation is using the config descriptor for the thing-type, and not the thing itself. Possibly [here](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/48e405fb3f1e60b56333e26bd42021bd5cfc1bc8/bundles/io/org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.core/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/io/rest/core/thing/ThingResource.java#L671). Having updated the zwave binding to allow [textual thing definitions](https://github.com/openhab/org.openhab.binding.zwave/issues/153), the binding no longer functions if parameters are updated with the UI.

bug.title: Multiple time cron expressions in rule not working
bug.body: As requested ( https://github.com/openhab/openhab-distro/issues/355 ) I'm opening a new issue. Works (fires every five seconds): ``` rule "cron test" when // Time cron "0 0 0 * * ?" or Time cron "0/5 * * * * ?" then logInfo("cron", "test") end ``` Doesn't work as expected (second cron doesn't fire): ``` rule "cron test" when Time cron "0 0 0 * * ?" or Time cron "0/5 * * * * ?" then logInfo("cron", "test") end ``` I'm using the current apt version of openhab: ``` openhab2-offline/testing,now 2.0.0~b4 all [installiert] openHAB Offline Distribution ```

bug.title: Adding an Item in PaperUI fails with no error if Name field contains a space.
bug.body: To Reproduce: Under Configuration->Items click (+) to add an item. Fill in all required fields, but in the "Name" field supply a name containing a space, such as "Office Lights" Click (+) to add the item. Results: You are returned to the Items list without an error and without the item being added. Expected results: If spaces are not allowed in item names, a message to that effect should be given, and/or the user not allowed to continue.

bug.title: [bug] PaperUI: Can't link items with parenthesis
bug.body: In openHAB 2.0 build 636 I've observed that I can no longer link items with Thing's Channels, if given Channel has parenthesis in the name. Steps to reproduce: 1. Find a Thing with Channel containing parenthesis (for me it was GreenWave PowerNode 6 from Z-Wave binding) 2. Try to link an Item by clicking on blue circle Expected result: "Link Item" modal window should occur Actual result: There's an error in Chrome console with the following stack trace: ``` angular.min.js:107 TypeError: Cannot read property 'toUpperCase' of undefined at getInCamelCase (controllers.min.js:547) at getItemNameSuggestion (controllers.min.js:539) at r.$scope.linkChannel (controllers.min.js:497) at r.$scope.enableChannel (controllers.min.js:460) at fn (eval at compile (angular.min.js:213), <anonymous>:4:550) at r.$eval (angular.min.js:133) at app.js:1 at r.$eval (angular.min.js:133) at r.$apply (angular.min.js:134) at HTMLButtonElement.<anonymous> (app.js:1) ``` Here's a gif on how to reproduce the bug: ![paperui-bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2270505/21074287/8b02f512-bef5-11e6-8866-6973b4200ee3.gif)

bug.title: automation: bind method not found
bug.body: With a recent build I run into this errors: ```text 2016-12-07 15:06:22,113 | ERROR | pool-8-thread-1 | core | 120 - org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.core - 0.9.0.201612071256 | [org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.ruleregistry(109)] bind method [setTemplateRegistry] not found; Component will fail 2016-12-07 15:06:22,119 | ERROR | pool-8-thread-1 | core | 120 - org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.core - 0.9.0.201612071256 | [org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.ruleregistry(109)] bind method [setTemplateRegistry] not found ``` The class `RuleRegistryImpl` has a `setTemplateRegistry` method using type: `RuleTemplateRegistry` But the component XML is using type: `org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.template.TemplateRegistry` ```text 2016-12-07 15:06:22,757 | ERROR | pool-8-thread-1 | providers | 126 - org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.providers - 0.9.0.201612071256 | [org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.provider.AutomationResourceBundlesTracker(126)] bind method [setProvider] not found; Component will fail 2016-12-07 15:06:22,757 | ERROR | pool-8-thread-1 | providers | 126 - org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.providers - 0.9.0.201612071256 | [org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.provider.AutomationResourceBundlesTracker(126)] bind method [setProvider] not found 2016-12-07 15:06:22,795 | ERROR | pool-8-thread-1 | providers | 126 - org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.providers - 0.9.0.201612071256 | [org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.provider.AutomationResourceBundlesTracker(126)] bind method [setProvider] not found ``` The class `AutomationResourceBundlesTracker` has a `setProvider` method using type: `AbstractResourceBundleProvider` But the component XML is using type: `org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.Provider`

bug.title: PaperUI: translations of "description" is ignored
bug.body: I have set the language and locale to "German" resp. "de_DE". The PaperUi shows the translated names of the things but the "...description" entries in the properties file are ignored. This is an example from the Yahoo Weather binding: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/20861883/7f82ce60-b99b-11e6-98d6-d1da5d67c33f.png)

bug.title: Thing stays in INITIALIZING state if initialize() failed once
bug.body: Scenario: I create a Thing with a wrong configuration that makes the handler's initialize() method throw an exception (in my case an IllegalArgumentException()). It is questionable whether this is allowed for the implementation or not - I would say this should not happen, instead the thing status should be set accordingly. But in any case, this situation (due to a bug) is irrecoverable, because if I now correct the configuration and thus a "Thing update" occurs, the ThingManager logs: ``` 14:34:31.193 [WARN ] [ome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager] - Attempt to initialize a handler twice for thing 'lifx:colorlight:30531ecf' at the same time will be ignored. ``` which means that it will never ever again try to initialize my handler - this looks like a bug to me.

bug.title: CRON rule triggered multiple times if in same file as an invalid/unresolved rule
bug.body: See discussion at https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/2545: There are situations where the same rule is scheduled multiple times. It appears to happen if rule files are refreshed and contain rules that weren't correctly parsed before (due to syntax errors or potentially unresolved item or action names).

bug.title: Hue brightness conversion is not bijective
bug.body: The brightness conversion of a percent value to a hue value and then back to percent should be the same value. E.g. 67% => 170 => 67% Currently the conversion done in LightStateConverter will end in 66% cause the value cast to int instead of being rounded.

bug.title: ThingHandlers stay UNINITIALIZED of registration runs into timeout
bug.body: The method `ThingManager.registerChildHandlers()` has the following code: ``` registerHandler(child); initializeHandler(child); ``` Within `registerHandler` the handler registration is done in a "Safe" call, i.e. it might return after 5 seconds without having successfully registered the handler by that time. As a result, `initializeHandler` will simply do nothing, since it checks whether the handler is correctly registered already. The outcome is that the Thing stays in UNINITIALIZED state indefinitely. [This seems to be like a report](https://community.openhab.org/t/binding-handler-registration-issues/17422) of exactly that situation.

bug.title: LIFX throws NPE
bug.body: Trying to control a LIFX bulb (where the Thing is set to OFFLINE, whyever), I get this exception in the log: ``` 17:11:03.513 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ItemCommandEvent ] - Item 'LIFX' received command 274,100,87 17:11:03.514 [ERROR] [inding.lifx.handler.LifxLightHandler] - Error while updating bulb: null java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.internal.LifxUtils.percentTypeToKelvin(LifxUtils.java:83)[231:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.internal.LifxLightStateChanger.addSetColorRequestToMap(LifxLightStateChanger.java:232)[231:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.internal.LifxLightStateChanger.handleHSBChange(LifxLightStateChanger.java:213)[231:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.internal.LifxLightState.setHSB(LifxLightState.java:57)[231:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.handler.LifxLightHandler.handleHSBCommand(LifxLightHandler.java:328)[231:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.handler.LifxLightHandler.handleCommand(LifxLightHandler.java:273)[231:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$3.call(ThingManager.java:355)[103:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$3.call(ThingManager.java:1)[103:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201611272028] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller$CallableWrapper.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:177)[96:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.9.0.201611272028] at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)[:1.8.0_101] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)[:1.8.0_101] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)[:1.8.0_101] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.8.0_101] ```

bug.title: ClassCastException in HandlerFactories
bug.body: There are reports from a number of bindings about ClassCastExceptions, when trying to instantiate a handler for a bridge - the Thing framework seems to hand in a Thing (and not a Bridge) instance in that case. Before the Thing refactoring, this code was working, so it seems that this must be some bug in the framework, not in the bindings. See a log here: ``` Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingImpl cannot be cast to org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.Bridge at org.openhab.binding.homematic.handler.HomematicThingHandlerFactory.createHandler(HomematicThingHandlerFactory.java:50)[204:org.openhab.binding.homematic:2.0.0.201611212345] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.binding.BaseThingHandlerFactory.registerHandler(BaseThingHandlerFactory.java:98)[104:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201611191809] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$7.call(ThingManager.java:586)[104:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201611191809] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$7.call(ThingManager.java:1)[104:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201611191809] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller$CallableWrapper.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:177)[97:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.9.0.201611191809] ... 4 more ``` More infos also at https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/issues/1462

bug.title: ERROR in log after adding a hue bridge
bug.body: When I approve a newly discovered hue bridge, the light discovery service tries to read the connected lights, but fails, since the bridge has not yet been paired at that moment: ``` 2016-11-22 15:31:15.899 [DEBUG] [b.hue.handler.HueBridgeHandler:358 ] - Failed creating new user on Hue bridge: link button not pressed 2016-11-22 15:31:15.901 [INFO ] [ome.event.ThingStatusInfoEvent:43 ] - 'hue:bridge:001788141b41' updated: OFFLINE (CONFIGURATION_ERROR): Not authenticated - press pairing button on the bridge. 2016-11-22 15:31:15.909 [ERROR] [b.hue.handler.HueBridgeHandler:408 ] - Bridge cannot search for new lights.java.lang.IllegalStateException: linking is required before interacting with the bridge at nl.q42.jue.HueBridge.requireAuthentication(HueBridge.java:783) at nl.q42.jue.HueBridge.getFullConfig(HueBridge.java:771) at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue.handler.HueBridgeHandler.getFullLights(HueBridgeHandler.java:405) at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue.internal.discovery.HueLightDiscoveryService.startScan(HueLightDiscoveryService.java:83) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.AbstractDiscoveryService.startScan(AbstractDiscoveryService.java:199) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.DiscoveryServiceRegistryImpl.startScan(DiscoveryServiceRegistryImpl.java:381) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.DiscoveryServiceRegistryImpl.startScans(DiscoveryServiceRegistryImpl.java:357) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.discovery.internal.DiscoveryServiceRegistryImpl.startScan(DiscoveryServiceRegistryImpl.java:216) at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest.core.discovery.DiscoveryResource.scan(DiscoveryResource.java:81) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) ``` As this is a standard situation, there must not be any error logging.

bug.title: [Paper UI] Astro Control 12 hour format
bug.body: In Paper UI in Control view the Astro binding shows times in 12 hour format without am/pm abbreviation. Can somebody please change it to 24 hour format? It's in org.eclipse.smarthome.ui.paper-0.9.0-SNAPSHOT.jar file controllers.min.js line 2452. Change return $filter('date')(date, "dd.MM.yyyy hh:mm:ss"); To return $filter('date')(date, "dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm:ss"); Capital letter HH is 24 hour format.

bug.title: Yahoo Weather shows wrong air pressure
bug.body: The Yahoo Weather binding shows the wrong air pressure. Currently it shows 33491 hPa which is about 33 times to high. Normal air pressure is around 1013 hPa.

bug.title: BaseThingHandler:channelLinked() called frequently / too much
bug.body: In a simple setup with a single Item -> Channel definition in the DSL, the above method is called three times (for the given channel) at startup of the runtime, twice triggered by ThingManager.added() and once by ItemRegistry.allItemsChanged(). Expected behaviour would be that the method is called once for each time an Item definition is parsed, taking into account the fact that "temporary" items are created. In my use case the channelLinked() triggers a read request on a bus (e.g. KNX), which is not designed to be flooded in this way, especially when reading out the same value multiple times.

bug.title: NPE when starting the ThingManager
bug.body: I just came across this in my log file during startup: ``` Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.isVetoed(ThingManager.java:656) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.doInitializeHandler(ThingManager.java:640) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.initializeHandler(ThingManager.java:631) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.thingAdded(ThingManager.java:440) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingRegistryImpl.notifyTrackerAboutAllThingsAdded(ThingRegistryImpl.java:240) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingRegistryImpl.addThingTracker(ThingRegistryImpl.java:60) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.activate(ThingManager.java:1012) ... 54 more ``` The NPE occurs because the handler is null (which might be due to the fact that I have Things for which no binding bundle is started).

bug.title: Sonos notification sound: not working when line-in is playing
bug.body: Playing with the new TTS feature, I tested the Sonos notification mechanism with a lot of different sources being played and with the queue being filled or not. It is working very well except in one case, when the current source is the line-in. The behavior is even different, depending on whether the queue is empty or not. In one case, the TTS audio is rendered but the line-in is then not restored. In the other case, the TTS audio is just not rendered at all.

bug.title: Classic UI not displaying sitemap mappings correctly
bug.body: I have the following sitemap `sitemap Test label="Test" { Frame label="Indoor Climate Control" { Selection item=HVAC_5_thermostat_mode icon="climate" mappings=[0="Off",1="Heat",2="Cool",3="Auto"] } } The item is from a CT-100 Thermostat. When I make a selection in the classic UI and return to the Frame, the mapping key is displayed and not the mapping text, as shown below This is not the case with the basic UI as shown below I migrated this configuration across from OpenHAB1, which also displayed the mapping text correctly.

bug.title: PaperUI prevents Windows from sleeping.
bug.body: Using Chrome, Windows7 for PaperUI access to a Raspberry Pi build #577 PaperUI opens an audio stream, and my Windows settings allow this to prevent sleeping, which I guess many other people have. Windows shows this: ``` C:\Windows\system32>powercfg -requests DISPLAY: None. SYSTEM: [DRIVER] High Definition Audio Device (HDAUDIO\FUNC_01&VEN_10EC&DEV_0889&SUBSYS_104383C0&REV_1000\4&108e67b5&0&0001) An audio stream is currently in use. AWAYMODE: None. ``` Closing PaperUI causes the [DRIVER] entry to go away, and Windows will subsequently sleep.

bug.title: Basic UI: not updating the value of a group item
bug.body: I have a group item that displays the number of lights ON: ``` Group:Switch:OR(ON, OFF) GEclairage "Eclairage [(%d ON)]" <light> (All) ``` When the frame containing this item is opened and one light is switched ON or OFF, the valie is not updated in Basic UI. Value is correct if I reopen the frame. ``` Switch item=GEclairage mappings=[OFF="Eteindre"] ``` PS: it is OK in Classic UI and HABdroid.

bug.title: BasicUI: Can't scroll through entire Selection list
bug.body: If I define a Selection widget in the sitemap with more options than will fit in the browser window, I'm unable to scroll through the entire list of options. This can be reproduced on multiple platforms and multiple browsers. This is on build 555. Sitemap widget: ``` Text label="Test Selection" { Frame { Selection item=TestItem label="Selection" mappings=[1="Option 1", 2="Option 2", 3="Option 3", 4="Option 4", 5="Option 5", 6="Option 6", 7="Option 7", 8="Option 8", 9="Option 9", 10="Option 10", 11="Option 11", 12="Option 12", 13="Option 13"] } } ``` Scrolling all the way to the bottom of the list works fine. ![screenshot from 2016-11-09 09-16-40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19286354/20141675/6458c0d0-a65f-11e6-943f-7aa066b1d04f.png) But scrolling to the top doesn't go all the way to the top of of the list. ![screenshot from 2016-11-09 09-17-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19286354/20141676/64592d86-a65f-11e6-8546-2639de8f1885.png)

bug.title: Color controls for HSB seem to be independant.
bug.body: It seems that the 3 controls for color in PaperUI are independant controls? If I slide the Sat, then I get a saturation, but H and B are 0. Likewise for others - if I change Hue, then S and B are 0. For example, below I moved the brightness, and I get the following -: ``` 2016-11-01 17:43:43.490 [DEBUG] [.c.thing.internal.ThingManager:458 ] - Delegating update '0,0,29' for item 'zwave_device_15785c713e3_node15_color_color' to handler for channel 'zwave:device:15785c713e3:node15:color_color' ``` The controls look as follows -: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1041475/19900289/e604718e-a05a-11e6-9238-de443c3f646c.png) I would have expected saturation and hue to be values as indicated in the image.

bug.title: NTP Tests bug, when time is changed
bug.body: In the NTP Binding Tests the "Europe/Helsinki" time zone is used. But recently there has been a time change in this time zone and that broke two of the tests: 1) 'if no time zone is set in the configuration, the string channel is updated with the default one' The message is: The string channel was not updated with the right timezone Expected: is "EEST" but: was "EET" Aparently the abbreviation EEST(Eastern European Summer Time) is used only in summer and now that the time is changed the abbreviation, that is returned is EET(Eastern European Time) - https://www.timeanddate.com/time/zones/eest 2) 'if no time zone is set in the configuration, the dateTime channel is updated with the default one' The message is: The dateTime channel was not updated with the right timezone Expected: is "+0300" but: was "+0200" Now that the time is changed, the current offset is +0200, not +0300 I have made a PR with a fix for this: https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/2377

bug.title: i18n: label of channel is not resolved
bug.body: In my binding I have this channel definition: ``` <channels> <channel id="press" typeId="system.trigger"> <label>@text/dashButtonPressChannelLabel</label> <description>@text/dashButtonPressChannelLabel</description> </channel> </channels> ``` On the Paper UI the label is not resolved (_@text/dashButtonPressChannelLabel_ is displayed) although the entry is contained in the i18n properties file.

bug.title: VoiceManager fails to find suitable voice
bug.body: There is some problem with the selection of the right voice to use in VoiceManager. If e.g. MaryTTS is installed, you have: ``` openhab> voice voices marytts:bits1hsmm bits1-hsmm (de) marytts:cmuslthsmm cmu-slt-hsmm (en_US) marytts:bits3hsmm bits3-hsmm (de) ``` Calling ``` openhab> voice say test ``` results in ``` 21:39:47.778 [ERROR] [se.smarthome.core.voice.VoiceManager] - Error saying 'test ': Unable to find a voice for language de ``` When the locale (in Configuration->System) is set to "de" instead of "de_DE", TTS works as expected.

bug.title: Read-only switches show toggle AND state
bug.body: Just came across this channel type, i.e. a normal read-only switch without any state options: ``` <channel-type id="online"> <item-type>Switch</item-type> <label>Online</label> <description>Servers online status.</description> <category>Switch</category> <state readOnly="true"></state> </channel-type> ``` This is what the Paper UI renders: ![bildschirmfoto 2016-10-15 um 23 51 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/19413616/9e8715d0-9332-11e6-8479-e0ab7c78f4fd.png) I assume this is not intentional. There should be either the toggle (and then in a deactivated form) OR the label text. As we do not have any state options in this case, I would personally expect the deactivated toggle here.

bug.title: PaperUI: message "PaperUI works best ..." on latest versions of Chrome, Edge, IE on Windows 10
bug.body: I have installed the latest openHAB Build (#542) on Windows 10. But now Paper UI complains that id works best with modern browsers. This message appears on Chrome 54, Edge 38.14393 and also Internet Explorer 11.321.14393. Firefox 47 is OK. In addtion on Chrome the configuration page for the HomeMatic is shown incomplete. On top of the page you can see the message, but not completelsy visible (looks the same on Edge and IE). ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/19413090/8b968b94-9324-11e6-8ec3-234279484e83.png) On Firefox it looks perfect ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/19413096/b2b62658-9324-11e6-94d6-b1dd5c5df0c3.png)

bug.title: Minor issue in title tag
bug.body: Hi, It seems that for example german umlaut "ü" out of "Menü" is not properly encoded in the HTML title of the basic ui. If the files and text are properly encoded you don't need special HTML encoding.

bug.title: Basic UI: Player widget doesn't update automatically
bug.body: Hi In the new ESH builds automatic update of Sonos-Controller (Play, Pause) doesn't work anymore: Player Sonos_Controller "Controller" (Sonos) {channel="sonos:PLAY1:living:control"} sitemap demo label="Main Menu" { Frame label="Sonos" { Default item=Sonos_Controller } } ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20517474/19263217/8bdd9188-8f9b-11e6-8245-6af5059dc88b.png) To update the status a page reload is needed. Most probably it belongs to this issue: [https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/640](url) BR Michael

bug.title: Safari, iOS (iPad): PaperUI corrupted by hide icon
bug.body: I'm running the latest snapshot version from openhab2. This is what the PaperUI looks like on my iPad Air: ![img_3039](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22266373/19224322/e8eb273c-8e83-11e6-8a06-91dd936d6d4d.PNG) On my PC (e.g. Firefox) everything looks normal.

bug.title: Basic UI does not update icons of read only switches
bug.body: I've done some more testing with the functionality provided by #2030 and it seems that icons of read only switches in the Basic UI are not properly updated. I typically use these for representing the state of motion/smoke/CO sensors. You can easily reproduce this in the demo by replacing the `Group demo` in `demo.sitemap` with ``` Text label="Group Demo" icon="firstfloor" { Switch item=Lights mappings=[OFF="All Off"] Group item=Heating Group item=Windows Text item=Temperature Switch item=Light_C_Corridor_Ceiling Text item=Light_C_Corridor_Ceiling } ``` and replacing the definition of `Light_C_Corridor_Ceiling` in `demo.items` with: ``` Switch Light_C_Corridor_Ceiling "Ceiling [%s]" <switch> (gC, Lights) ``` When you then switch `Light_C_Corridor_Ceiling` or `Lights mappings`, the icon of `Switch item=Light_C_Corridor_Ceiling` is properly updated. However the icon of `Text item=Light_C_Corridor_Ceiling` is not. Only after reloading the page it will again represent the right state. Another way to reproduce it is to open `Group Demo > Open windows`. And issue the following commands in the console: ``` smarthome:update Window_GF_Frontdoor OPEN smarthome:update Window_GF_Kitchen OPEN smarthome:update Window_GF_Living OPEN smarthome:update Window_GF_Toilet OPEN smarthome:update Window_FF_Bath OPEN smarthome:update Window_FF_Bed OPEN smarthome:update Window_FF_Office_Window OPEN smarthome:update Window_FF_Office_Door OPEN smarthome:update Garage_Door OPEN ``` Now all window icons should be open. But they only are after reloading the page. The same way windows should be closed after issuing: ``` smarthome:update Window_GF_Frontdoor CLOSED smarthome:update Window_GF_Kitchen CLOSED smarthome:update Window_GF_Living CLOSED smarthome:update Window_GF_Toilet CLOSED smarthome:update Window_FF_Bath CLOSED smarthome:update Window_FF_Bed CLOSED smarthome:update Window_FF_Office_Window CLOSED smarthome:update Window_FF_Office_Door CLOSED smarthome:update Garage_Door CLOSED ```

bug.title: group function is not correctly (at all...) persisted in the mapdb
bug.body: After setting up and restarting ESH the groups created via the new group item function of Paper UI the values like sum, avg and so on get lost.

bug.title: Basic UI does not update visible items
bug.body: In classic UI it is possible to configure items with a visibility and change the visible items by changing a switch: Switch item=interval label="Interval" mappings=[0="Day", 1="Week"] Text item=DayItem visibility=[interval ==0] Text item=WeekItem visibility=[interval ==1] Basic UI correctly shows the visible items when navigating to the frame. But when the switch is changed it won't update the visible items like Classic UI does. After a manual reload the visible items are shown correctly.

bug.title: Duplicate channels on Thing
bug.body: A thing's channels are stored as a List<Channel> , see https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/e0985e90d389350580e59bfbcd7e0adaaccf7519/bundles/core/org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/core/thing/internal/ThingImpl.java#L49 Because this is a list, its possible for a Thing to have duplicate channels with the same ID. This also means that calling "getChannel(String id)" will only return the first instance of the duplicate channel. My assumption would be that a thing can only have a single instance of a channel.

bug.title: ThingManager should adapt state updates to linked item type
bug.body: I have a hue light defined like this in hue.things: ``` Bridge hue:bridge:xxx "Philips Hue Bridge" [ ipAddress="192.168.1.3", userName="xxx" ] { 0210 1 "Hue White and Color - Living Room Ceiling" @ "Living Room" [ lightId="1" ] ``` I want to have an on/off switch on my sitemap, so I defined an item for it as ``` Switch living_light_ceiling_switch "Living Room Ceiling Switch" <light> (gLights) { channel="hue:0210:xxx:1:color" } ``` I read in the documentation that I need to use the :color channel instead of :switch to make it work. So now I have a sitemap definition as ``` Switch living_light_ceiling_switch "Living Room Ceiling Switch" <light> (gLights) { channel="hue:0210:xxx:1:color" } ``` It works nicely as far as turning the light on and off from the UI but if I try to turn the light on/off from the real Hue app the state doesn't get updated in the classic UI or HABdroid. I see in the basic UI that it gets updated with its HSB value (68,88,0) instead of an ON/OFF state. This is problematic because in openHAB 1.x I had quite a few rules depending on the ON/OFF state of the item, for example if conditions like (living_light_command is another switch item): ``` if (living_light_ceiling_switch.state != living_light_command.state) { ... } ``` and now those are not working at all. Can this be fixed in the binding? Either create/enable the :switch channel for the thing, or make the :color channel converted to ON/OFF states when the items is a simple switch. Issue #866 might be related, but I thought I better open a new issue for this, as that one is not really about this switch state problem. I understand that rewriting my rules to somehow check for the brightness value might work, but it's far from ideal and probably I'm not the only one who will be hit by this during transition to openHAB2. Oh, and I'm using beta4.

bug.title: Unset a setting value in the paper ui
bug.body: I just noticed that when using the configuration forms in Configurations -> Services -> .... that I can set a string value for a configuration option, but I can not set it empty or blank. Since configuration options can be optional, it would be nice to be able to unset or at least send a blank entry for values.

bug.title: RuleTriggerManager.removeRule doesn't work for some rule types
bug.body: It's implemented like this: ``` java public void removeRule(TriggerTypes type, Rule rule) { switch (type) { case STARTUP: systemStartupTriggeredRules.remove(rule); break; case SHUTDOWN: systemShutdownTriggeredRules.remove(rule); break; case UPDATE: updateEventTriggeredRules.remove(rule); break; case CHANGE: changedEventTriggeredRules.remove(rule); break; case COMMAND: commandEventTriggeredRules.remove(rule); break; case TRIGGER: triggerEventTriggeredRules.remove(rule); break; case TIMER: timerEventTriggeredRules.remove(rule); removeTimerRule(rule); break; } } ``` It doesn't work for `UPDATE`, `CHANGE`, `COMMAND` and `TRIGGER`, as the fields are `Map<String, Set<Rule>>` and are called with `.remove(Rule)`.

bug.title: Greyed out validation markers in Designer
bug.body: Items are not resolved in the Designer, i.e. when trying to use content completion e.g. in sitemaps, no proposals show up.

bug.title: Hue: handling of "Umlaut" not correct
bug.body: I connected a Hue bridge to an ESH system. Instead of "Küche" (the german word for Kitchen) I see `K��che`. So I assume the reading is not done using the correct charset.

bug.title: INCREASE/DECREASE not working for LIFX
bug.body: @kgoderis While preparing a demo, it appeared to me that my LIFX Color 1000 did not react on any INCREASE/DECREASE commands to the color channel. I didn't yet debug myself, but is this a known issue?

bug.title: Basic UI: Colorpicker button short press not working
bug.body: @resetnow I just noticed that when using a Colorpicker in the Basic UI, no command is sent if I press up/down buttons short. I would expect them to send ON/OFF. A long press works (which sends INCREASE/DECREASE). Could you have a look, please?

bug.title: Paper UI: state for r/o items with options broken
bug.body: HEAD: 9a7ea3237656cd4380c7ac99a8284a8c30a53e4d I have a thing that is using a channel of this type ``` xml <channel-type id="opt"> <item-type>String</item-type> <label>Options</label> <state readOnly="true"> <options> <option value="A">alpha</option> <option value="B">bravo</option> <option value="C">charlie</option> </options> </state> </channel-type> ``` I added a thing and have an item (automatically created) connected to the channel. Previously the Paper UI shows me - "alpha" if the item state is A - "beta" if the item state is B - "charlie" if the item state is C Now I see nothing value in the Paper UI. ``` text osgi> smarthome items list test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt (Type=StringItem, State=NULL, Label=Options, Category=null) ``` ``` text osgi> smarthome update test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt A Update has been sent successfully. osgi> 16:50:57.363 INFO smarthome.event.ItemStateEvent[:43] - test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt updated to A 16:50:57.364 DEBUG o.e.s.c.t.i.ThingManager[:455] - Delegating update 'A' for item 'test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt' to handler for channel 'test:test-thing:d53e92d5:opt' 16:50:57.368 INFO s.event.ItemStateChangedEvent[:43] - test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt changed from NULL to A ``` ``` text osgi> smarthome items list test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt test_test_thing_d53e92d5_opt (Type=StringItem, State=A, Label=Options, Category=null) ``` The Paper UI still shows only the "Options" line, but without a value.

bug.title: Paper UI renders switches with state options
bug.body: I have a Switch item ("Switch Plug" in demo.items), which is linked to a switch channel of a Thing. This is what the Paper UI renders: ![bildschirmfoto 2016-09-09 um 11 36 00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/18382521/99ee1dd4-7681-11e6-90f7-3b708fa5d33b.png) It used to be a toggle in the past.

bug.title: [paperui] Thing status not updated on page
bug.body: I'm on build 469. If status of a thing changes, the updated status is not showing in paper ui (in fact, the status disappears completely). I'm seeing this on multiple browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari) and on multiple platforms (Linux, Windows, Mac). Before: ![before-stopping-astro](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19286354/18314448/1db7793c-74e1-11e6-9b27-9eb8ad95e018.jpg) After stopping astro binding: ![after-stopping-astro](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19286354/18314457/2294173a-74e1-11e6-98e0-8d7f810dc2f8.jpg) After refreshing page: ![after-page-refresh](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19286354/18314469/2a7d5d08-74e1-11e6-846c-0956d3172fdf.jpg) On the thing detail page, I'm seeing this: ![detail-page](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19286354/18315685/d4e99122-74e5-11e6-89b4-8d0298e528a6.jpg)

bug.title: Rule addition event's structure is wrong
bug.body: I am listening to rule addition event on endpoint "smarthome/rules/*/added". The structure of received rule is not correct. In the JSON below is an Action with some configurations, these configurations are nested inside properties which is not correct. ``` { "triggers":[ ], "conditions":[ ], "actions":[ { "id":"action_1", "label":"Script action", "description":"allows the execution of a user-defined script", "configuration":{ "properties":{ "type":"application/javascript", "script":"alert(1)" } }, "type":"ScriptAction" } ], "configuration":{ "properties":{ } }, "configDescriptions":[ ], "uid":"rule_36", "name":"Test rule 1", "tags":[ ], "visibility":"VISIBLE" } ```

bug.title: Sliders for color items do not work as expected
bug.body: I am controlling a hue bulb through the sliders of the Paper UI: ![screen shot 2016-09-07 at 11 23 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/18306760/982e00da-74ed-11e6-8a14-75c443255927.png) I noticed, that the Paper UI does not send correct commands, if I drag a slider to a new location - the new position on the "button up" event is not used, only the "automatic" commands that are sent while operating the sliders are sent. Furthermore, it is not really possible to "reach the ends", i.e. 0 and 100 for brightness and saturation; if the mouse is not exactly over the knob anymore, no command is sent.

bug.title: bug Rule : Script interpreter couldn't be obtain
bug.body: I have the same problem posted on https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/1393. and discussed on https://community.openhab.org/t/intermittant-rule-issue/11663/8 it seem that rules, when are updated ( or refreshed by the system ), the "old" version stay on memory and generate the error :Script interpreter couldn't be obtain my test.items ``` Number Scena "Scena" <scena> String VoiceCommand ``` my test.rules ``` rule testVoice when Item VoiceCommand received command then var String command = VoiceCommand.state.toString.toLowerCase if (command.contains("luce relax") { Scena.sendCommand(1) } if (command.contains("luce lettura") { Scena.sendCommand(2) } if (command.contains("accendi luce") { Scena.sendCommand(0) } if (command.contains("spegni luce") { Scena.sendCommand(4) } end ``` With openhab android is necessary just speak to generate the error

bug.title: Prevent hidden files from being parsed
bug.body: When using Mac OS X to edit Openhab files through an SMB share, files with a leading ._ are created by Mac OS X to store file information about the actual file in. **Example:** Create/edit a file called "test.item" using OS X finder application and Mac OS X also creates a file called "._test.item". Although these ._ files do not contain any valid information for Openhab, they are being parsed causing problems in mainly the Openhab rule engine. This leads to errors in the Openhab log like: 2016-09-02 09:54:45.764 [ERROR] [.script.engine.ScriptExecutionThread] - Rule 'Pantry light motion': Script interpreter couldn't be obtain 2016-09-01 15:47:55.026 [WARN ] [pse.smarthome.core.items.GenericItem] - failed notifying listener '[org.eclipse.smarthome.model.rule.runtime.internal.engine.RuleEngineImpl@1ec05f5, Home_State, null]' about state update of item java.lang.NullPointerException: {} Perhaps preventing the ._ files to be parsed would help in preventing issues caused by these files?

bug.title: Warning during startup of rules
bug.body: In the ESH demo setup, I find the following in the logs: ``` 17:02:52.965 DEBUG o.e.s.m.r.r.i.e.RuleEngineImpl[:282] - Executing startup rule 'Initialize demo items' 17:03:07.808 WARN o.e.s.m.r.j.RulesJvmModelInferrer[:201] - Duplicate field: 'DemoDimmer'. Ignoring 'org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.items.DimmerItem'. ``` Analyzing it, I noticed that this is not a problem of Xtext+co, but that the cause is the fact that there are two DemoDimmer items available in the ItemRegistry, which is clearly a bug.

bug.title: io.rest sometimes throws a NCDFE
bug.body: io.rest declares its dependency to io.transport.mdns as optional. If the dependency is not resolved, this can result in NCDFEs: ``` 16:21:39.652 [ERROR] [org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest ] - FrameworkEvent ERROR - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.rest java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/smarthome/io/transport/mdns/MDNSService at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)[:1.8.0_40] at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:2701)[:1.8.0_40] at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods(Class.java:1975)[:1.8.0_40] at org.apache.felix.scr.impl.helper.BindMethod.getServiceObjectAssignableMethod(BindMethod.java:454) ```

bug.title: Paper UI: rollershutter widget
bug.body: The control buttons of the rollershutter are not centered anymore. Tested commit id: f77110576a1b91d7241039e7270c787d557420bb Browser: Firefox 48.0 ![rollershutter-big](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/204670/18044021/c92fd312-6dcb-11e6-840f-cd10cb60ee5f.png) ![rollershutter-small](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/204670/18044020/c92f9190-6dcb-11e6-86ea-7bb000f07898.png)

bug.title: NPE in HttpUtil when accessing a https url
bug.body: There are reports about NPEs in HttpUtil, since it had been changed to use the Jetty client library, see https://community.openhab.org/t/getting-a-npe-from-a-https-request/13610

bug.title: Paper UI: Thing config page does not load completely
bug.body: For things with a higher number of configuration parameters (tested with around 50), the configuration editing page has serious problems. (For a thing with about 15 config parameters, there was no problem.) When opening it first, only an empty page header is shown: ![2016-08-24 paper ui config view bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19324427/17935513/e5bda350-6a1b-11e6-8d93-7ca67e5f0a62.png) When refreshing the page once, it loads completely with some delay, but it does not show any values. Further refreshing does not help.

bug.title: Paper UI: Disable Dimmer item when read-only
bug.body: Items with type Dimmer that are also configured as read-only should not be editable in the Control view. Maybe there should not even be a slider. See #1587

bug.title: 404 when accessing Configuration->System
bug.body: Using the latest OH2 build, the Paper UI shows an "ERROR 404 - Not found" when accessing the System configuration and it seems that it stops rendering the page (at least it leaves an empty box with no configuration parameters at the end). Looking at the javascript console, I see ``` catcher.js:197 GET http://localhost:8080/rest/config-descriptions/system:persistence 404 (Not Found) ``` This probably occurs when no configuration has been set yet. I think the Paper UI should silently ignore such a situation and still make it possible to submit a configuration for it. P.S.: I see another 404 for http://localhost:8080/ui/fonts/Roboto-LightItalic.woff. This is probably unrelated, but should be fixed as well.

bug.title: Not possible to create items through Paper UI anymore
bug.body: Trying to create a new item through the Paper UI (e.g. when creating a link in advanced mode), I get a 400 Bad request now and find this in my log: ``` 12:18:56.119 [WARN ] [thome.io.rest.core.item.ItemResource] - Received HTTP PUT request at 'items/XXX' with an invalid item type 'DateTimeItem'. ``` I assume that we missed a place where "Item" needs to be removed.

bug.title: Paper UI - Items are overlapping
bug.body: In Paper UI, the Number item representation in an item list is overlapping with the next list entry (see Screenshot). ![2016-08-22 paper ui overlap bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19324427/17851294/80be8bb0-6861-11e6-9d21-8c7b01fae62e.png) This occurs in the daily version of 2016-08-17, but not in the on of 2016-06-16.

bug.title: FirmwareUpdateServiceOSGiTest still broken
bug.body: It seems #2004 does not solve all problem. Log attached: [log.txt](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/files/428346/log.txt)

bug.title: Paper UI calls thing-types twice on a single page load
bug.body: Monitoring paper ui, i've noticed that paper ui makes two rest calls to thing-types.

bug.title: Paper UI: Item creation broken
bug.body: With the recent master I am not able to add a new item (http://127.0.0.1:8080/ui/index.html#/configuration/item/create) anymore. The "+" is grey, not white (`name` given and `type` chosen) commit id: c196f1fd13c92aba1626ab13c8991520f956f765

bug.title: Paper UI: Rule Action
bug.body: I tried to use a "Post command to Item" action. The field to insert the command that should be post is missing.

bug.title: Do not render disabled selection boxes
bug.body: The Paper UI currently renders selection boxes that are disabled, if an item is read-only and provides options in its state description: This does not make much sense - instead, the Paper UI should simply render the current state as text.

bug.title: WeMo discovery crashes if there are no paired devices

bug.title: Sonos binding: cannot play a Spotify album as Sonos favorite
bug.body: Using the "favorite" channel, I can play a Spotify track set as a Sonos favorite but I cannot play a Spotify album set as a Sonos favorite. This could be due to the fact that few services like Spotify require that the content of the favorite to be put in the queue.

bug.title: Sonos binding: playing a track should first switch to the queue
bug.body: When requesting to play a track number from the queue, the binding should first switch to the queue if the queue is not being the current source.

bug.title: NPE in mDNS Service
bug.body: During the installation of some extensions (which might have triggered some bundle restarts), I just observed this exception in the log: ``` Exception in thread "pool-42-thread-1" java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.io.transport.mdns.internal.MDNSServiceImpl$1.run(MDNSServiceImpl.java:51) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) ```

bug.title: Paper UI: configuration parameters missing
bug.body: Using offline snapshot 426, editing thing configuration, some of the parameters are missing. I first thought it was all parameters I have set in my thing files but there is no absolute logic in fact.

bug.title: XmlDocumentBundleTracker exception at startup

bug.title: InstantiationException StringType at startup
bug.body: With snapshot 426, at each startup, now I got these 2 warnings: ``` 20:30:45.941 [WARN ] [home.core.internal.items.ItemUpdater] - InstantiationException on org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.types.StringType 20:30:46.325 [WARN ] [home.core.internal.items.ItemUpdater] - InstantiationException on org.eclipse.smarthome.core.library.types.StringType ``` Is it normal ?

bug.title: [LIFX] IllegalMonitorStateException may occur when unlocking after sending broadcast packet
bug.body: Often during initialization of the LifxLightHandler, the following exception is thrown in my setup: ``` java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock$Sync.tryRelease(ReentrantLock.java:151)[:1.8.0_101] at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.release(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:1261)[:1.8.0_101] at java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock.unlock(ReentrantLock.java:457)[:1.8.0_101] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.internal.LifxNetworkThrottler.unlock(LifxNetworkThrottler.java:89)[193:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201607221840] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.handler.LifxLightHandler.broadcastPacket(LifxLightHandler.java:599)[193:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201607221840] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.handler.LifxLightHandler.initialize(LifxLightHandler.java:223)[193:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx:0.9.0.201607221840] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$8$1.call(ThingManager.java:739)[102:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201607221840] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$8$1.call(ThingManager.java:1)[102:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201607221840] at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller$CallableWrapper.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:177)[96:org.eclipse.smarthome.core:0.9.0.201607221840] at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)[:1.8.0_101] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)[:1.8.0_101] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)[:1.8.0_101] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.8.0_101] ``` The `LifxNetworkThrottler.unlock()` method always tries to release all locks. Even those of other threads. The exception seems to occur when a bulb is added that was not yet available before the `LifxLightHandler.broadcastPacket(..)` method called `LifxNetworkThrottler.lock()` . As a result of this, the whole LIFX binding becomes unusable. The thread in which the exception occurs does not unlock all its locked ReentrantLocks . Due to my setup this concurrency issue is often reproducible: - 34 LIFX bulbs - fast development PC (Skylake i7-6700K)

bug.title: Breaking API Change: BridgeBuilder
bug.body: @b2b0b73bd319ea5ae5877c6fffaa075225b7ca23 breaks the API of BridgeBuilder. Before this commit the following code compiles without any problems: ``` java Bridge monitor=BridgeBuilder.create(new ThingTypeUID("a:b"),"myid") .withProperties(new HashMap<String,String>()) .build(); ``` After this commit it failes with "incompatible types: Thing cannot be converted to Bridge".

bug.title: Sonos binding: invalid subscription ID
bug.body: It is not the case with beta 3 but in recent snapshots, we can find in the logs error messages of this kind: ``` `19:15:25.671 [ERROR] [g.jupnp.protocol.sync.ReceivingEvent] - Invalid subscription ID, no active subscription: (IncomingEventRequestMessage) NOTIFY /upnpcallback/dev/RINCON_000E58D01E9001400/svc/upnp-org/DeviceProperties/event/cb SEQUENCE: 0 19:15:25.808 [ERROR] [g.jupnp.protocol.sync.ReceivingEvent] - Invalid subscription ID, no active subscription: (IncomingEventRequestMessage) NOTIFY /upnpcallback/dev/RINCON_000E58D01E9001400_MR/svc/upnp-org/RenderingControl/event/cb SEQUENCE: 0 19:15:25.884 [ERROR] [g.jupnp.protocol.sync.ReceivingEvent] - Invalid subscription ID, no active subscription: (IncomingEventRequestMessage) NOTIFY /upnpcallback/dev/RINCON_000E58D01E9001400/svc/upnp-org/GroupManagement/event/cb SEQUENCE: 0 ``` Subscriptions with the Sonos is not valid and as a result channels are not refreshed.
