bug.title: Sonos binding: problem with mute channel
bug.body: Assuming your Sonos sound is not mutted, you use the switch associated to the "mute" channel in UI to mute it. That works but immediately after the switch state is restored to OFF state. Important, I am using a switch with autoupdate=false. Tested with beta 3. Just in case it could help: if I correctly remember, there is something weird with mute in the Sonos firmware: you have to ignore case because sometimes you get "mute" rather than "Mute" or the reverse.

bug.title: Config pages do not consider password fields correctly
bug.body: When a config parameter is marked with "password", its content should be masked by the UI. But currently, I see the clear text instead:

bug.title: BaseBridgeHandler.editThing() returns a ThingBuilder instead of a BridgeBuilder
bug.body: Calling editThing() on a BaseBridgeHandler and updating the bridge returns a ThingImpl instead of a BridgeImpl. Edit operation should not convert a Bridge into a regular Thing. This is similar to the issue resolved in #1467

bug.title: Paper UI should support state options in control UI
bug.body: I just came across [this channel](https://github.com/pail23/openhab2-addons/blob/de6de5f12f1fa1a3f8c5f9c42bf6adee798e560a/addons/binding/org.openhab.binding.onkyo/ESH-INF/thing/thing-types.xml#L82) and noticed that the Paper UI only renders me a string input field instead of a selection box: I would expect to be able to directly choose one of the provided options instead.

bug.title: Hue binding: initialization incomplete
bug.body: Hue binding initialization is sometimes incomplete. This can be seen because when it occurs, light properties are not set. I am investigating. It could be or not a consequence of my change done in file HueBridgeHandler by PR #1870.

bug.title: Sonos Alarm Channel not working
bug.body: Hi Tried to use this channel for a Sonos Play1: Alarm is running (Set to ON if the alarm was triggered) The status never changes to ON. All other channels are working except this. A known issue? Thanks Michael

bug.title: hue binding does not support switchable sockets anymore
bug.body: Since the switch to generic types, the hue binding does not support switchable sockets thus as [this one](http://www.philips.de/c-p/6916531PH/livingwhites-adapter) anymore. See https://community.openhab.org/t/hue-power-socket-dimmer-not-longer-supported-as-thing/12453.

bug.title: ThingHandler.channelLinked() not called for all channels after handler initialization
bug.body: The [documentation](https://www.eclipse.org/smarthome/documentation/development/bindings/thing-handler.html#channel-links) reads: > The channelLinked method is called, even if the link existed before the handler was initialized. It will be called only after the initialized method has been executed successfully According to https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/issues/1125, this does not seem to be the case anymore. Related to this, the JavaDoc of 'ThingHandler.channelLinked()' is not very helpful and it should imho contain the same information as the documentation.

bug.title: Hue binding: things remaining in INITIALIZING state
bug.body: When starting OH, I noticed that my hue bridge thing is ONLINE (as expected) but my hue light things remain in INITIALIZING state. HueLightHandler:initialize looks really weird to me. If run when the bridge is in state INITIALIZING, it will apparently set the thing state to INITIALIZING ! At my knowledge, a binding should only set state to ONLINE or OFFLINE. And there is probably rare cases while state is not set at all in this method. And finally just a remark, this binding does not implement bridgeStatusChanged.

bug.title: Float issue in rule
bug.body: I've tried to narrow this one down to the simplest example. This code will generate the below error. This issue occurred in 1.8 as well (was hoping 2.0 would address). var float a = 10.0 var float b a = a - 2.0 b = a \* 2.0 2016-07-14 17:14:00.031 [ERROR] [ntime.internal.engine.ExecuteRuleJob] - Error during the execution of rule Float Test: An error occured during the script execution: Could not invoke method: org.eclipse.xtext.xbase.lib.FloatExtensions.operator_multiply(float,double) on instance: null

bug.title: NPE in ThingManager on shutdown
bug.body: [Here](https://community.openhab.org/t/testing-z-wave-binding-on-openhab-2/7522/1383) an NPE has been reported on shutdown: ``` 2016-07-10 10:43:14.786 [ERROR] [ome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager] - Exception occured during notification of thing 'zwave:device:364dd67a:node2' about bridge disposal at 'null': null java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$11.run(ThingManager.java:835)[102:org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing:0.9.0.201607061527] at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)[:1.7.0_80] at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)[:1.7.0_80] at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(Unknown Source)[:1.7.0_80] at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(Unknown Source)[:1.7.0_80] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)[:1.7.0_80] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)[:1.7.0_80] at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)[:1.7.0_80] ``` There clearly should be a null check and a safer handling within the ThingManager.

bug.title: Binding initialization stalls during startup (intermittently)
bug.body: There have been numerous reports of bindings "stalling" (for lack of a better word) at startup. I have experienced the problem with the zwave and systeminfo bindings. Others have reported similar behavior with knx, rfxcom, meteostick, and max. I first noticed this behavior with the 6/19 build, and it continues through the most current build (#399). At the time I was installing builds on almost a daily basis, and I do not recall seeing this behavior in the 6/17 and prior builds (I think I skipped installing the 6/18 build, so I don't know about that one). I started this forum thread, which has now become quite long. https://community.openhab.org/t/binding-not-starting-consistently-since-6-19-build/11741 There are other forum threads describing similar behavior. Here. https://community.openhab.org/t/z-wave-binding-things-initializing-after-restart/12173 And here. https://community.openhab.org/t/testing-z-wave-binding-on-openhab-2/7522/1372 This originally was thought to be related to the circular reference issue. However, the problem continues even after the circular reference fix. There may be some relationship to the XML file loading issue, but perhaps not. https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/1796 Here's the summary of what I'm seeing: Start openhab. Things start out pretty normal. ``` 2016-06-20 10:38:47.723 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ThingAddedEvent ] - Thing 'zwave:device:1556e3ab04f:node3' has been added. 2016-06-20 10:38:47.800 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ThingAddedEvent ] - Thing 'zwave:device:1556e3ab04f:node6' has been added. 2016-06-20 10:38:47.807 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ThingAddedEvent ] - Thing 'zwave:serial_zstick:1556e3ab04f' has been added. 2016-06-20 10:38:47.870 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ItemAddedEvent ] - Item 'zwave_device_1556e3ab04f_node3_scene_number' has been added. 2016-06-20 10:38:47.872 [INFO ] [home.event.ItemChannelLinkAddedEvent] - Link 'zwave_device_1556e3ab04f_node3_scene_number-zwave:device:1556e3ab04f:node3:scene_number' has been added. 2016-06-20 10:38:47.875 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.ItemAddedEvent ] - ServiceEvent REGISTERED - {org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.status.ConfigStatusProvider}={service.id=277, service.bundleid=188, service.scope=singleton} - org.openhab.binding.zwave 2016-06-20 10:38:51.147 [DEBUG] [org.openhab.binding.zwave ] - ServiceEvent REGISTERED - {org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.binding.ThingHandler}={thing.type=zwave:leviton_vrp03_00_000, thing.id=zwave:device:1556e3ab04f:node6, service.id=278, service.bundleid=188, service.scope=singleton} - org.openhab.binding.zwave 2016-06-20 10:38:51.153 [DEBUG] [org.openhab.binding.zwave ] - ServiceEvent REGISTERED - {org.eclipse.smarthome.config.core.status.ConfigStatusProvider}={service.id=279, service.bundleid=188, service.scope=singleton} - org.openhab.binding.zwave 2016-06-20 10:38:51.158 [INFO ] [me.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent] - 'zwave:device:1556e3ab04f:node6' changed from UNINITIALIZED to INITIALIZING 2016-06-20 10:38:51.195 [DEBUG] [org.openhab.binding.zwave ] - ServiceEvent REGISTERED - {org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.binding.ThingHandler}={thing.type=zwave:serial_zstick, thing.id=zwave:serial_zstick:1556e3ab04f, service.id=280, service.bundleid=188, service.scope=singleton} - org.openhab.binding.zwave 2016-06-20 10:38:51.213 [DEBUG] [org.openhab.binding.zwave ] - BundleEvent STARTED - org.openhab.binding.zwave 2016-06-20 10:38:51.215 [INFO ] [me.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent] - 'zwave:serial_zstick:1556e3ab04f' changed from UNINITIALIZED to INITIALIZING ``` But at this point there's nothing. Initialization of the zwave stick and nodes never starts. When things start normally I would see messages like this. ``` 2016-06-20 09:35:30.622 [DEBUG] [ding.zwave.handler.ZWaveThingHandler] - Initializing ZWave thing handler. 2016-06-20 09:35:30.631 [INFO ] [me.event.ThingStatusInfoChangedEvent] - 'zwave:device:1556de5cdb3:node3' changed from INITIALIZING to OFFLINE 2016-06-20 09:35:30.633 [DEBUG] [ding.zwave.handler.ZWaveThingHandler] - NODE 3: Controller initialised. ``` The "Initializing ZWave thing handler" message is the first thing called in the ThingHandler's initialize() method, so I'm assuming that the initialize() method is never being called. ``` @Override public void initialize() { logger.debug("Initializing ZWave thing handler."); ``` @cdjackson, please feel free to add to this if you have any additional information.

bug.title: Discovery result toast links to wrong url
bug.body: When a discovery result is created in the background, the toast links to "inbox/setup" and hence ends up on the page that lists the bindings, while it should instead link to "inbox/search" in order to show the current inbox entries.

bug.title: Circular dependency in services
bug.body: Unfortunately, #1810 has now introduced a circular dependency of services: ScriptRuntime->ScriptServiceUtil->ScriptEngine->ScriptRuntime This results in these warnings: ``` 12:35:41.101 [WARN ] [lipse.smarthome.model.script.runtime] - FrameworkEvent WARNING - org.eclipse.smarthome.model.script.runtime org.osgi.framework.ServiceException: Recursive ServiceFactory call in bug.title: Cannot create rules using Paper UI / configuration broken
bug.body: My intention was to test #1683 but it seems it is not possible for me to use the trigger to create rules using the Paper UI. I added two triggers (two item state change triggers on the first try, two item state update triggers on the second try) to the rule and tried to save the rule. I see an error on the console log. I have used the Firefox to create that rules. ``` git rev-parse HEAD 8aea602d7adee12e5008ef065d27adad8337d8eb ``` ``` text 22:01:32.790 INFO smarthome.event.RuleAddedEvent[:43] - Rule 'rule_1' has been added. 22:01:32.790 DEBUG o.e.s.a.c.internal.RuleEngine[:219] - bug.title: RawType base64-encoded value is written to log file every time state changes
bug.body: Hi, whenever an item changes, the ItemStateChangedEvent is logged (on info level), containing the old and the new state of an item: `itemName + " changed from " + oldItemState.toString() + " to " + itemState.toString();` If a RawType item has changed, the toString method of the RawType outputs its Base64-encoded value: `PortableBase64.getEncoder().encode(bytes);` This is not really nice as I don't need the binary file in my log file and this can increase the size of the log file quite fast.

bug.title: [HUE] Switch-off not working for Osram bulbs on older software version
bug.body: Osram bulbs (here PAR16 50 TW) don' switch off completely when using a toggle in classic/basic UI and the bulbs are on an older software version. However the predefined toggle in PaperUI works fine (regardless the software version). **Item definition** Switch Light_Kueche_Innen1_Toggle "Kueche Innen 1 Toggle" (gLight_Kueche) {channel="hue:0220:00178810d0dc:22:brightness"} **Not working: V1.03.07** - PAR16 50 TW **Working: V1.04.12** - PAR16 50 TW - Classic A60 RGBW - Classic B40 TW - LIGHTIFY

bug.title: ClosedSelectorException in LIFX discovery
bug.body: I very often see this in my logs: ``` 2016-07-01 12:16:58.597 [ERROR] [o.e.s.b.l.i.LifxLightDiscovery:402 ] - An exception orccurred while communicating with the bulb : 'null'java.nio.channels.ClosedSelectorException: null at sun.nio.ch.SelectorImpl.selectedKeys(SelectorImpl.java:74) at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx.internal.LifxLightDiscovery$1.run(LifxLightDiscovery.java:303) at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$201(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180) at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:293) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) ``` From the code, it is not clear to me how the selector can be closed at that point, so I don't really know how to fix it. @kgoderis Do you have any bright idea?

bug.title: ColorTemperature not working on LIFX Color 1000
bug.body: I did a demo with a LIFX Color 1000 yesterday and noticed that the color temperature channel wasn't working at all - when moving the slider in the Paper UI, it was going to a cold white, flickering a bit, but I was not able to change the temperature as expected. @kgoderis Does it work for you?

bug.title: JS error when manually creating a thing without configuration
bug.body: When creating a Thing through the Paper UI, where the thing type does not have any config description, the UI crashes with a JS error when trying to set default config values.

hue_15_color changed from 34,99,9 to 34,99,5 2016-06-24 02:00:14.953 [INFO ] [marthome.event.ItemStateChangedEvent] - hue_18_color changed from 34,99,9 to 34,99,5 2016-06-24 02:00:15.042 [INFO ] [marthome.event.ItemStateChangedEvent] - hue_20_color changed from 331,21,9 to 331,21,5 ``` The setup involved item type `Color` hue bulbs being affected via a rule to control their brightness via KNX `Dimmer` item when it receives a command. hue.items: ``` Group gHue "Hue Group" Color hue_8_color "Hue Lamp 3.1" (gHue) {channel="hue:LCT001:0017882a573e:8:color"} ``` knx.items: ``` Dimmer knx_boardroom_dimmer "Boardroom Dimmer [%s]" <light> { knx="0/0/4+<0/0/20, 0/0/5, 0/0/6+0/0/7" } ``` knx.rules: ``` // Connects KNX boardroom dim % to dim gCloud rule "KNXLightDimmer" when Item knx_boardroom_dimmer received command then var PercentType percent if(knx_boardroom_dimmer.state instanceof PercentType) { percent = knx_boardroom_dimmer.state as PercentType sendCommand(gHue, percent) } end ``` bug.sitemap: sitemap bug label="Bug Sitemap" { Slider item=knx_boardroom_dimmer label="KNX Dimmmer" //Slider item=gHue //Server Error 500 prevents Classic UI rendering, works fine on Basic UI } The rule still appears to work fine dimming the hue bulbs with the knx dimmer state value. This was handled via the Classic UI which provides INCREASE/DECREASE buttons for the Dimmer. I'm unable to verify Slider element on the gHue group directly in Classic UI due to [the bug](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/1739). In the Basic UI, a Slider element on gHue group works fine without error, I can also verify this is the case with the Slider element for the KNX Dimmer item. It seems specific to something Classic UI is doing?

bug.title: System Channels in Channel Groups
bug.body: When using [System-Channels](http://www.eclipse.org/smarthome/documentation/development/bindings/thing-definition.html#channels) within channel groups, for only one Thing it is not possible to bind any things for the whole binding. The PaperUI shows any thing of this binding as "Unknown Decvice" and reports "409 Conflict" when trying to add the device as thing. Within the logfile of OpenHab you can find the following messages: ``` 2016-06-20 09:16:46.146 [ERROR] [s.c.thing.binding.ThingFactory:112 ] - Thing factory (class MyThingHandlerFactory) returned null on create thing when it reports to support the thing type (binding:myThing). 2016-06-20 09:16:46.146 [WARN ] [s.c.d.internal.PersistentInbox:152 ] - Cannot create thing. No binding found that supports creating a thing of type binding:myThing. ```

bug.title: Loop(?) in PaperUI "Control" page
bug.body: I have used the PaperUI to addseveral things to my OpenHAB 2 configuration (Homematic, Astro, Yamaha Receiver). At some time the "Control" page stopped working correctly. In Chrome I could see that the refresh function was activated permanently before it "crashed" with a Chrome error. On Firefox I got this error message after some seconds: ![paperuicontrol](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/16178074/38dae810-363f-11e6-98ba-c54127332958.PNG) Perhabs the rendering of the page took too long and the refresh was triggered before it was rendered completely.

bug.title: Bridge configuration does not show all options in PaperUI
bug.body: The bridge configuration for Homematic contains configuration options for "gatewayAddress" and "callbackHost". Both entries are not visible in the PaperUI configuration: ![homematicbridge](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/616792/16178002/329f6644-363d-11e6-9851-78852fa6c348.png) This problem seems to be caused by the configuration in `ESH-INF/config/thing/bridge.xml`. Both settings contain a subtag named "context". If I remove the subtag both settings appear in PaperUI. BTW: same happens withe Hue bridge configuration. Setting "ipAddress" is also not visible. This problem seems to be quite new. With openHAB 2.0 Beta 3 everything is OK. But not in the latest nightly builds.

bug.title: Missing channels stop a binding from starting
bug.body: If thing XML files for a binding contain a channel ID that doesn't exist, then there is no useful error and the binding will not start. The error that's logged is provided below, and it's extremely difficult to work out where the error lies in a large binding like ZWave. It would be more useful to provide an error that allowed this to be debugged, such as logging the name of the missing channel. ``` 2016-06-18 22:36:27.305 [ERROR] [c.x.o.XmlDocumentBundleTracker:216 ] - Could not send adding finished event for the module 'org.openhab.binding.zwave'!java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: UID must have at least 2 segments. at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.UID.<init>(UID.java:65) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.UID.<init>(UID.java:43) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.type.ChannelTypeUID.<init>(ChannelTypeUID.java:35) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.xml.internal.ThingTypeXmlResult.toChannelDefinitions(ThingTypeXmlResult.java:98) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.xml.internal.ThingTypeXmlResult.toThingType(ThingTypeXmlResult.java:148) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.xml.internal.ThingTypeXmlProvider.addingFinished(ThingTypeXmlProvider.java:145) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker.addingFinished(XmlDocumentBundleTracker.java:214) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker.access$6(XmlDocumentBundleTracker.java:209) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.XmlDocumentBundleTracker$1.processBundle(XmlDocumentBundleTracker.java:140) at org.eclipse.smarthome.config.xml.osgi.AbstractAsyncBundleProcessor$1.run(AbstractAsyncBundleProcessor.java:246) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745) ```

bug.title: Integer config parameter is stored as decimal
bug.body: If a service is configured through the Paper UI (and therefore through the REST API), numbers are sent in JSON always as double, i.e. an integer 1 becomes 1.0. The REST API then stores this value as a BigDecimal with 1 decimal digit, so that it is not regarded as an integer anymore. A concrete problem with this behavior is described here: https://community.openhab.org/t/change-homekit-setting-in-paperui/11407

bug.title: [Sonos] Music not resuming after notification
bug.body: When music is playing and a notification is sent, the music does not continue after the notification has finished. Logfile: http://pastebin.com/jkckE9cU (It looks like some XML parsing issue)

bug.title: Automation: multiple triggers
bug.body: I don't know if my understanding of the rule engine is correct. If I add two trigger to a rule, I assume it is executed - if the first trigger matches - if the second trigger matches Is this correct? I add two item state changed event trigger to a rule, one for ITEM_SWITCH_0 and one for ITEM_SWITCH_1. The rule is only triggered for one of both. @danchom, @marinmitev: Is this a bug or is my understanding wrong?

bug.title: Sonos Things are shown ONLINE although not on the network
bug.body: It seems that the Sonos thing handler sets the status to ONLINE on initialization, even if the device is not reachable (or not even on the network). I would expect it to be OFFLINE instead.

bug.title: Itemnames are not resolved in rules and scripts
bug.body: Items are not correctly resolved in the Designer when editing rules and scripts and hence they show many errors, although the items are declared.

bug.title: It seems items added programmatically to GroupItem are not persisted in mapdb
bug.body: I am using GroupItem.addMember() method to programmatically add item to the group switch. This works fine and I am able to operate group switch from Basic-UI. I also see group members using REST API. But when I restart ESH, I do not see these members at all. REST API also returns empty json array for GroupItem members. It seems group item members are not persisted in mapdb.

bug.title: Switch control of color channel bug
bug.body: I have a Switch item linked to the color channel of a LIFX bulb. It works correctly, but seconds after switching the bulb on the binding sends an HSB value and thus the Switch item is set to UNDEF and the sitemap toggle shows OFF.

bug.title: Rule trigger / action / condition all mixed up
bug.body: If I use the Paper UI to create a trigger, condition and action all module types are shown. ![rule-action](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/204670/15703901/23ead8e4-27e8-11e6-9af5-d5c484b320c7.png) ![rule-condition](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/204670/15703908/26135d80-27e8-11e6-8f1b-347a86f9858a.png) ![rule-trigger](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/204670/15703909/29034370-27e8-11e6-9a9f-acafbef442e8.png)

bug.title: RuleRegistry contains two entries after creating a rule based on template
bug.body: The "create rule by template" feature is broken - the rule registry contains two entries with the same ruleid afterwards which causes all kinds of problems. This bug has been introduced by https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/1500 - @danchom could you please have a look?

bug.title: ChannelItemProvider depends on bundle start order
bug.body: #1288 introduced the ChannelItemProvider If I understand the mechanism correctly, the "virtual" items are now created (createItemForLink) if a Thing or a ItemChannelLink has been added. It seems to me that (at least) on startup it is possible that "createItemForLink" is called before all the bundle XMLs are completely parsed (see: https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/1519#issuecomment-221020452). I can reproduce the error here in a Karaf container where the most ESH bundles are using the same start-level (I am using the our karaf and karaf-tp features). I can workaround that startup behavior if I increase the start-level of the core.thing bundle.

bug.title: When enabling an advanced channel, the Paper UI hides all advanced channels
bug.body: As the title say: When I enable/link an advanced channel, the Paper UI suddenly only shows non-advanced channels, but the button still says "show less". All channels should be kept on the page.

bug.title: Rule failure
bug.body: Anytime a rule is to be run in OH2, I'm getting a NPE exception. I even cleared out my rules folder and just put in one super simple rule that merely logs. bug.title: Installation of smart Home Designer fails
bug.body: I tried to install the SmartHome Designer following the instructions of the Getting started Guide: https://www.eclipse.org/smarthome/documentation/development/ide.html Running the Setup Task as requested leads to the ExceptionTrace located below. I asume some of the required generation steps are not executed, since the result is that some projects w.g. model.persisntence, model.rule and model.thing can not be built due to missing classes or packages an unresolved references. I tried the installation on two windows machines, with JDK 1.7 and JDL 1.8. Maven 3.3 is installed. 55331 [main] ERROR mf.mwe2.launch.runtime.Mwe2Launcher - Problems running workflow all: ``` java.lang.IllegalStateException: Duplicate adapter at bug.title: Automation: When the processing of automation resource bundle throws exception the processing queue stops working
Sorting of extensions should be case insensitive
bug.body: Sorting of extensions is currently case sensitive, i.e. it first lists all extensions which are capitalized and then all others, see ![screen shot 2016-05-10 at 09 46 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/15139144/9708062c-1694-11e6-80f7-18e18d1c34c4.png) This should be changesd so that they are really alphabetically sorted.

bug.title: "Integers" sent in configuration now include scale
bug.body: If I send a configuration value of -2, it is now received as a BigDecimal of -2.0, which is not equal to -2. This seems to have changed recently (in the last week or two) - prior to this it was received without the scale setting and the change broke a load of comparisons in ZWave. Given that comparisons of BigDecimal checks the scale, it's annoying that integer config types are not marshalled without the scale. Maybe this is unavoidable, in which case feel free to close, but I thought I'd raise it in case others also experience problems with this change.

bug.title: MapDB database corruption
bug.body: Database corruption occurs if power of device running ESH is lost during writes. Eclipse Community Forums - MapDB corruption: [https://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php?t=msg&th=1075047&goto=1724448&#msg_1724448](url)

bug.body: A unit test fails because of an NPE, see https://hudson.eclipse.org/smarthome/job/SmartHomeDistribution-Nightly/1003/testReport/junit/org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.module.timer.internal/RuntimeRuleTest/assert_that_timerTrigger_works/: ``` 16:09:49.016 [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-2] ERROR org.quartz.core.JobRunShell - Job DEFAULT.TimerTrigger52848043-4d61-40f7-96ca-ed4eac51aa00 threw an unhandled Exception: java.lang.NullPointerException: null at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.core.internal.RuleEngineCallbackImpl.triggered(RuleEngineCallbackImpl.java:44) ~[na:na] at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.module.timer.handler.CallbackJob.execute(CallbackJob.java:53) ~[na:na] at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:202) ~[quartz-2.2.1.jar:na] at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:573) [quartz-2.2.1.jar:na] 16:09:49.019 [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-2] ERROR org.quartz.core.ErrorLogger - Job (DEFAULT.TimerTrigger52848043-4d61-40f7-96ca-ed4eac51aa00 threw an exception. org.quartz.SchedulerException: Job threw an unhandled exception. at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:213) ~[quartz-2.2.1.jar:na] at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:573) [quartz-2.2.1.jar:na] Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: null at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.core.internal.RuleEngineCallbackImpl.triggered(RuleEngineCallbackImpl.java:44) ~[na:na] at org.eclipse.smarthome.automation.module.timer.handler.CallbackJob.execute(CallbackJob.java:53) ~[na:na] at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:202) ~[quartz-2.2.1.jar:na] ... 1 common frames omitted ```

bug.title: Designer 0.8.0 won't start - stack trace
bug.body: version: Current nightly snapshot OS/Arch: Linux/64 - likely broken elsewhere too possible cause: xtext 2.9.2 changes current log attached. [1462021857850.txt](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/files/243614/1462021857850.txt)

bug.title: PaperUI incorrectly handling config type
bug.body: In ZWave I have a config description that looks like this -: ``` <parameter name="heal_time" type="integer" groupName="heal"> <label>Heal Time</label> <description></description> <default>2</default> <options> <option value="-1">Disabled</option> <option value="1">1 AM</option> <option value="2">2 AM</option> <option value="3">3 AM</option> ``` Updating the thing with this configuration throws a validation error that the type is integer and the data isn't (or something similar). This works in HABmin.

bug.title: Error/Timeout saving thing results in unusable thing
bug.body: This is linked to https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/issues/858 It seems that when saving the controller (bridge) in ZWave, if a frame is being sent (which can result in a 5 second timeout), then the updating of the thing times out (which is also 5 seconds), and this seems to leave the thing in an unusable state requiring it to be deleted. When updating the thing, the following error occurs -: ``` 2016-04-30 13:14:31.849 [DEBUG] [b.z.i.protocol.ZWaveController:527 ] - Message queued. Queue length = 5. Queue={} 2016-04-30 13:14:31.849 [DEBUG] [WaveController$ZWaveSendThread:1142 ] - Took message from queue for sending. Queue length = 4 2016-04-30 13:14:31.850 [DEBUG] [o.b.z.i.protocol.SerialMessage:255 ] - Assembled message buffer = 01 09 00 13 0E 02 63 04 25 0C A7 2016-04-30 13:14:31.850 [DEBUG] [b.z.handler.ZWaveSerialHandler:305 ] - NODE 14: Sending REQUEST Message = 01 09 00 13 0E 02 63 04 25 0C A7 2016-04-30 13:14:31.851 [DEBUG] [rialHandler$ZWaveReceiveThread:296 ] - Stopped ZWave thread: Receive 2016-04-30 13:14:34.919 [INFO ] [b.z.handler.ZWaveSerialHandler:130 ] - Stopped ZWave serial handler 2016-04-30 13:14:34.919 [DEBUG] [.o.b.z.d.ZWaveDiscoveryService:58 ] - Deactivating ZWave discovery service for zwave:serial_zstick:d01c0920 2016-04-30 13:14:34.922 [DEBUG] [b.z.handler.ZWaveSerialHandler:67 ] - Initializing ZWave serial controller. 2016-04-30 13:14:36.447 [DEBUG] [s.core.common.SafeMethodCaller:184 ] - Timeout of 5000ms exceeded, thread ESH-safeCall-4 (54) in state RUNNABLE is at org.openhab.binding.zwave.handler.ZWaveSerialHandler.initialize(ZWaveSerialHandler.java:69). 2016-04-30 13:14:36.449 [ERROR] [.c.thing.internal.ThingManager:525 ] - Exception occured while calling thing updated at ThingHandler 'org.openhab.binding.zwave.handler.ZWaveSerialHandler@4529295b: nulljava.util.concurrent.TimeoutException: null at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:205) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller.callAsynchronous(SafeMethodCaller.java:179) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:72) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:56) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.thingUpdated(ThingManager.java:515) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingRegistryImpl.notifyTrackers(ThingRegistryImpl.java:218) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingRegistryImpl.notifyListenersAboutUpdatedElement(ThingRegistryImpl.java:141) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingRegistryImpl.notifyListenersAboutUpdatedElement(ThingRegistryImpl.java:1) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractRegistry.updated(AbstractRegistry.java:102) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractProvider.notifyListeners(AbstractProvider.java:57) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.registry.AbstractProvider.notifyListenersAboutUpdatedElement(AbstractProvider.java:82) 2016-04-30 13:14:36.449 [DEBUG] [.c.c.r.AbstractManagedProvider:135 ] - Updated element zwave:serial_zstick:d01c0920 in ManagedThingProvider. 2016-04-30 13:14:36.450 [INFO ] [rthome.event.ThingUpdatedEvent:43 ] - Thing 'zwave:serial_zstick:d01c0920' has been updated. ``` When the thing then `initialize()`s, the following code throws an NPE -: ``` portId = (String) getConfig().get(CONFIGURATION_PORT); ``` presumable because the get returns null? If OH is stopped and restarted, then the thing is never initialised -: ``` 2016-04-30 13:19:20.563 [ERROR] [.c.thing.internal.ThingManager:598 ] - Exception occured while calling thing handler factory 'org.openhab.binding.zwave.internal.ZWaveHandlerFactory@57dc4cb0': java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingImpl cannot be cast to org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.Bridgejava.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingImpl cannot be cast to org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.Bridge at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:206) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller.callAsynchronous(SafeMethodCaller.java:179) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:72) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:56) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.registerHandler(ThingManager.java:582) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager.addThingHandlerFactory(ThingManager.java:902) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497) Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingImpl cannot be cast to org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.Bridge at org.openhab.binding.zwave.internal.ZWaveHandlerFactory.createHandler(ZWaveHandlerFactory.java:50) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.binding.BaseThingHandlerFactory.registerHandler(BaseThingHandlerFactory.java:113) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$6.call(ThingManager.java:586) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.thing.internal.ThingManager$6.call(ThingManager.java:1) at org.eclipse.smarthome.core.common.SafeMethodCaller$CallableWrapper.call(SafeMethodCaller.java:170) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617) ... 1 common frames omitted ``` In the zwave handler, this is here -: ``` java // Handle controllers here if (thingTypeUID.equals(CONTROLLER_SERIAL)) { return new ZWaveSerialHandler((Bridge) thing); } ``` If I look at 'thing' it is type `ThingImpl` and i think it should be `BridgeImpl`? At this point, the only way out seems to be to delete the thing and start again... The ZWave binding probably should exit quicker to avoid the timeout in the first place (I'll look at that), but if the timeout does occur, I think the system shouldn't die.

bug.title: ConfigDispatcher overwrites any properties set in ConfigAdmin for a service.pid
bug.body: If a cfg file is processed by ConfigDispatcher, where at least one property is specified, any other property that might already be set in the config admin for this service.pid is lost.

bug.title: Rules are not working as expected
bug.body: Sorry about that very unspecific title of this issue. I will change it as soon as we / I have a better one. # Short description: - rules are not executed anymore after restart - after disable and enable the rule is executed - the now executed rule executed the action if the condition does not met # Long description: I have created to rules. Rule 1: - if item 'zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary' state is set to ON (using trigger and condition) - set 'sonos_zoneplayer_RINCON_000E588375A001400_control' to PLAY Rule 2: - if item 'zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary' state is set to OFF (using trigger and condition) - set 'sonos_zoneplayer_RINCON_000E588375A001400_control' to PAUSE After the rules have been created, all has been working. I restarted the system (at least once). Now I realized that the rules are not working anymore. I filtered the log a little bit, because it contains a lot of messages ``` text 2016-04-28 08:25:30,465 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1505 | ItemCommandEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Item 'zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary' received command ON 2016-04-28 08:25:30,481 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1507 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary updated to ON 2016-04-28 08:25:30,587 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1509 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary updated to ON 2016-04-28 08:25:30,943 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1507 | ItemStateChangedEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary changed from OFF to ON 2016-04-28 08:25:37,907 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1507 | ItemCommandEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Item 'zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary' received command OFF 2016-04-28 08:25:37,920 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary updated to OFF 2016-04-28 08:25:37,976 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1510 | ItemStateChangedEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary changed from ON to OFF 2016-04-28 08:25:38,054 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1510 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary updated to OFF ``` There are no rules executed. After that I disabled and enabled the first rule. ``` text 2016-04-28 08:26:10,758 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: DISABLED 2016-04-28 08:26:11,085 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleUpdatedEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Rule 'rule_1' has been updated. 2016-04-28 08:26:11,089 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: DISABLED 2016-04-28 08:26:11,095 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleUpdatedEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Rule 'rule_1' has been updated. 2016-04-28 08:26:11,099 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: DISABLED 2016-04-28 08:26:12,285 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED 2016-04-28 08:26:12,413 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: IDLE 2016-04-28 08:26:12,611 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleUpdatedEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Rule 'rule_1' has been updated. 2016-04-28 08:26:12,686 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED 2016-04-28 08:26:12,730 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: IDLE 2016-04-28 08:26:12,743 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | RuleUpdatedEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Rule 'rule_1' has been updated. 2016-04-28 08:26:12,772 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1505 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED 2016-04-28 08:26:12,799 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1505 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: IDLE ``` Now (OFF => ON), the first rule is triggered, and the action is executed. ``` text 2016-04-28 08:26:21,636 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1510 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node6_sensor_binary updated to ON 2016-04-28 08:26:25,563 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1510 | ItemCommandEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Item 'zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary' received command ON 2016-04-28 08:26:25,607 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1508 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: RUNNING 2016-04-28 08:26:25,616 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1510 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary updated to ON 2016-04-28 08:26:25,677 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1510 | ItemCommandEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Item 'sonos_zoneplayer_RINCON_000E588375A001400_control' received command PLAY 2016-04-28 08:26:25,677 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1506 | ItemStateChangedEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary changed from OFF to ON 2016-04-28 08:26:25,690 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1509 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: IDLE 2016-04-28 08:26:25,698 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1510 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: RUNNING 2016-04-28 08:26:25,700 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1505 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | zwave_device_852ab7b3_node27_switch_binary updated to ON 2016-04-28 08:26:25,700 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1509 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | sonos_zoneplayer_RINCON_000E588375A001400_control updated to PLAY 2016-04-28 08:26:25,739 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1505 | ItemCommandEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | Item 'sonos_zoneplayer_RINCON_000E588375A001400_control' received command PLAY 2016-04-28 08:26:25,743 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1505 | RuleStatusInfoEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | rule_1 updated: IDLE 2016-04-28 08:26:25,945 | INFO | SH-safeCall-1508 | ItemStateEvent | 181 - org.eclipse.smarthome.io.monitor - 0.8.0.201604271228 | sonos_zoneplayer_RINCON_000E588375A001400_control updated to PLAY ``` If I switch the trigger to OFF, I would assume, that rule 1 is triggered, but the condition will break the execution. bug.title: 2 rules with cron triggers and 2 seconds in between. Only second rule fires twice.
bug.body: Hello everybody, I'm using openHAB2 and while testing the new rule engine via REST API I have tracked down an issue described in the title. When I delete rule_42, rule_41 fires reliable. Here are the two rules, which I have created via PaperUI and are the only two rules in my openHAB: Rule1: > { > "enabled": true, > "status": { > "status": "IDLE", > "statusDetail": "NONE" > }, > "triggers": [ > { > "id": "trigger_1", > "label": "Timer Trigger", > "description": "This triggers a rule based on a cron expression", > "configuration": { > "cronExpression": "1 37 09 \* \* ?" > }, > "type": "TimerTrigger" > } > ], > "conditions": [], > "actions": [ > { > "id": "action_2", > "label": "Post command to an item", > "description": "posts commands on items", > "configuration": { > "itemName": "enO_shd_FF_E1_31_07_SEND_UP", > "command": "ON" > }, > "type": "ItemPostCommandAction" > } > ], > "configuration": {}, > "configDescriptions": [], > "uid": "rule_41", > "name": "Hoch drücken", > "tags": [] > } Rule2: > { > "enabled": true, > "status": { > "status": "IDLE", > "statusDetail": "NONE" > }, > "triggers": [ > { > "id": "trigger_1", > "label": "Timer Trigger", > "description": "This triggers a rule based on a cron expression", > "configuration": { > "cronExpression": "3 37 09 \* \* ?" > }, > "type": "TimerTrigger" > } > ], > "conditions": [], > "actions": [ > { > "id": "action_2", > "label": "Post command to an item", > "description": "posts commands on items", > "configuration": { > "itemName": "enO_shd_FF_E1_31_07_SEND_UP", > "command": "OFF" > }, > "type": "ItemPostCommandAction" > } > ], > "configuration": {}, > "configDescriptions": [], > "uid": "rule_42", > "name": "Hoch loslassen", > "tags": [] > } And the log which shows, that only rule_41 fires twice and I have absolutely no idea why. > 2016-04-26 09:36:22.316 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleUpdatedEvent ] - Rule 'rule_41' has been updated. > 2016-04-26 09:36:22.330 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent ] - rule_41 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED > 2016-04-26 09:36:22.337 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent ] - rule_41 updated: IDLE > 2016-04-26 09:36:22.343 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleUpdatedEvent ] - Rule 'rule_41' has been updated. > 2016-04-26 09:36:22.349 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent ] - rule_41 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED > 2016-04-26 09:36:22.352 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent ] - rule_41 updated: IDLE > 2016-04-26 09:36:27.419 [DEBUG] [ing.aleoncean.internal.worker.Worker] - Received new ESP3 packet: RadioPacket4BS{RadioPacket{ESP3Packet{packetType=0x01, dataLen=10, optionalDataLen=7, data=[-91, 51, 91, -126, 15, 1, -123, 100, -15, 48], optionalData=[1, -1, -1, -1, -1, 45, 0]}, choice=0xA5, senderId=01:85:64:F1, destinationId=FF:FF:FF:FF, status=0x30, subTelNum=0x01, dBm=0x2D, securityLevel=0x00}} > 2016-04-26 09:36:30.111 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleUpdatedEvent ] - Rule 'rule_42' has been updated. > 2016-04-26 09:36:30.117 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent ] - rule_42 updated: NOT_INITIALIZED > 2016-04-26 09:36:30.125 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent ] - rule_42 updated: IDLE > 2016-04-26 09:36:30.132 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleUpdatedEvent ] - Rule 'rule_42' has been updated. > 2016-04-26 09:36:30.135 [INFO ] [smarthome.event.RuleStatusInfoEvent ] - bug.title: POST request for thing addition gives 500 if same UID exists already
bug.body: If a thing is already added and if we try to add the same thing again by sending the POST request to `/things`, it gives a 500 error. If we try again then the response is 200 and the thing is added. What is happening here is, if we try to add the same thing again the old thing is removed first (according to the method `addThingSafely` in `ThingSetupManager` class) but before it adds the new thing, it is sending back 500 error somehow. When we retry the request, it creates the thing because the old thing has been removed in the previous step. I am trying to figure out what is wrong there. Anyone has a clue?

bug.title: Rule module configuration page broken
bug.body: When adding a new rule module to a rule, the windows seems to display configuration properties from not only the chosen module type, but from others as well, see this example for a Script Action: ![bildschirmfoto 2016-04-08 um 14 28 59](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/14383594/75f93468-fd96-11e5-99cb-d8dec5718a72.png) There should clearly not be multiple groups "Others" and the first group shows the parameters of a post command action, not the script action.

bug.title: Edit fields should not use monospace font
bug.body: If you edit some value (e.g. the label of a Thing), the behavior of the input field has changed to show a frame and use monospace font. I assume this is due to https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/1330, but this should only be the case for script input fields, not for any other.

bug.title: Editing thing label clears various configuration properties
bug.body: I see that the issue #1313 is closed, but I still see similar issue when editing thing label. I edited the thing label. The PaperUI says "Thing Updated", but it clears all my configuration properties. I have one string type, one integer type and one options (dropdown) properties.

bug.title: Service configuration does not show integer values
bug.body: The "normal" view of a configuration misses integer values, while the expert view shows them. See the "port" parameter on these screenshots: ![bildschirmfoto 2016-04-04 um 16 56 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/14252152/55a67f1c-fa86-11e5-8128-2decce752b83.png) ![bildschirmfoto 2016-04-04 um 16 57 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3244965/14252165/6276c468-fa86-11e5-9896-473038a9a195.png)

bug.title: "Configure" button on Binding info does not work anymore
bug.body: When clicking on "Configure" (e.g. on the Sonos binding) in Configuration->Bindings in the Paper UI, nothing happens and the Javascript console shows this error: ``` js angular.min.js:102 Error: Failed to execute 'setAttribute' on 'Element': '"' is not a valid attribute name. at Error (native) at r.attr (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:167:20) at Object.T.(anonymous function) [as attr] (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:168:349) at Object.Yb.$set (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:72:325) at http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:64:151 at r (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:7:408) at R (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:64:64) at fa (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:61:468) at S (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:51:465) at S (http://localhost:8080/ui/js/angular.min.js:52:95) ```

bug.title: Lifx bindings stuck INITIALIZING forever
bug.body: For some reason some of the LIFX bulbs are getting stuck in the `INITIALIZING` state forever. It seems to happen more often when they already exist rather than just adding them. ``` lifx:colorlight:D073D5003FBE (Type=Thing, Status=INITIALIZING, Label=Original 1000, Bridge=null) lifx:colorlight:D073D5004280 (Type=Thing, Status=ONLINE, Label=Original 1000, Bridge=null) lifx:colorlight:D073D50066D2 (Type=Thing, Status=INITIALIZING, Label=Original 1000, Bridge=null) lifx:colorlight:D073D5006772 (Type=Thing, Status=INITIALIZING, Label=Original 1000, Bridge=null) lifx:colorlight:D073D5023BD6 (Type=Thing, Status=ONLINE, Label=Original 1000, Bridge=null) lifx:colorlight:D073D5115204 (Type=Thing, Status=INITIALIZING, Label=Color 1000, Bridge=null) lifx:colorlight:D073D51157DF (Type=Thing, Status=INITIALIZING, Label=Color 1000, Bridge=null) ``` Following @kaikreuzer 's [advice](https://community.openhab.org/t/lifx-bindings-stuck-initializing-forever/8547) I ran `log:set DEBUG org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.lifx` in the console and [grabbed my logs](https://gist.github.com/hadees/9ad23dc86ebe522194c9) of the incident. I'm not sure the items will help or not. ``` Living (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=null, Category=null) lifx_colorlight_D073D5003FBE (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Original 1000, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) lifx_colorlight_D073D5004280 (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Original 1000, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) lifx_colorlight_D073D50066D2 (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Original 1000, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) lifx_colorlight_D073D5006772 (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Original 1000, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) lifx_colorlight_D073D5023BD6 (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Original 1000, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) lifx_colorlight_D073D5115204 (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Color 1000, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) lifx_colorlight_D073D51157DF (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Color 1000, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) ntp_ntp_local (Type=GroupItem, Members=0, State=NULL, Label=Local Time, Category=null, Tags=[thing]) ```

bug.title: Missing link to Thing in pop-up
bug.body: When manually creating a Thing, it shows in the lower right: when approving a discovery result it instead shows The manual case therefore seems to be buggy as the same link to "Show Thing" should be shown.

bug.title: Automatic page change on discovery results
bug.body: In many situations when new discovery results are received, the Paper UI automatically redirects to http://localhost:8080/ui/index.html#/inbox/setup/bindings, which is pretty annoying. I cannot exactly name the situation, but it happens quite often, so I hope it is easy to reproduce.

bug.title: Title of discovery results missing on refresh
bug.body: When doing F5, I get: instead of

bug.title: "Show ignored" button not working on Inbox
bug.body: The Inbox has a "show ignored" button - but nothing happens when pressing it. Instead, ignored discovery results are always displayed in the list.

bug.title: Hue: Initial state fetch
bug.body: This is a Bug in the Hue binding: The initial state of a Lamp is not fetched after adding it. Reproduce: 1. Remove Hue Bulb Things. 2. Bulbs are re-discovered, appear in inbox 4. Call /rest/inbox/(hue-bulb-thinguid)/approve 5. Call /rest/items/(hue-bulb-itemname) Then the state is NULL, after pollinterval (default 10s) there should be a non-NULL state, but thats not the case. I guess, that there is no handler queued after ItemAddedEvent.

bug.title: Things are being initialised before XML files are loaded
bug.body: The log below shows that things can be initialised before the XML files are loaded. This causes problems in ZWave at least as once the protocol side of the binding starts up, it reads through the things to look for the thing type definition that's related to the Z-Wave device (using properties that is stored in the XML). I think there needs to be some way to either ensure the XML is loaded before initialising the bindings things, or there needs to be a callback after the XML is loaded? Or maybe there's another way to know, or force the XML to be loaded from within the binding? ``` 2016-03-06 19:24:03.348 [DEBUG] [.b.z.handler.ZWaveThingHandler:136 ] - NODE 14: Initialising channel zwave:everspring_st814_00_000:1530ee834f6:node14:sensor_relhumidity2 2016-03-06 19:24:03.349 [DEBUG] [o.b.z.h.ZWaveControllerHandler:70 ] - Initializing ZWave Controller. 2016-03-06 19:24:03.353 [DEBUG] [c.x.o.XmlDocumentBundleTracker:118 ] - Reading the XML document '/ESH-INF/thing/aeon_dsd37_0_0.xml' in module 'org.openhab.binding.zwave'... 2016-03-06 19:24:03.350 [DEBUG] [.b.z.handler.ZWaveThingHandler:276 ] - NODE 14: Controller initialised. bug.title: Paper UI: bad message displayed when unlinking a channel that was linked in the item file
bug.body: When you have a link between an item and a channel hardcoded in an items file, if you try to unlink it in Paper UI, it fails but Paper UI displays at bottom right of the browser a message telling you that the channel was unlinked.

bug.title: Paper UI does not display channels that are not define in the thing type
bug.body: When displaying the channels of a Thing, the Paper UI does not show any channel that is not part of the thing type and also no channels that don't have a channel type reference. See https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/pull/660/files#r54804936

bug.title: REST API PUT will not accept a ":" in a tag name
bug.body: Using the REST API doc examples, a 404 is returned when trying to PUT a new tag with a colon (:) in the name. Removing the colon from the name PUTs successfully. The use-case is for homekit tags for use with homekit or hueeumulation. Examples that fail: `curl -X PUT --header "Content-Type: application/json" --header "Accept: application/json" "http://localhost:8080/rest/items/zwave_ge_zw3101_00_000_152ea7c1953_node6_switch_dimmer/tags/homekit:Dimmer"` encoding the colon does not seem to help. The following example also fails. `curl -X PUT --header "Content-Type: application/json" --header "Accept: application/json" "http://localhost:8080/rest/items/zwave_ge_zw3101_00_000_152ea7c1953_node6_switch_dimmer/tags/homekit%3ADimmer"`

bug.title: REST error reporting following exceptions
bug.body: With the latest OH2 (from this afternoon, so I think it probably includes the latest ESH changes) I get exceptions when requesting GET rest/things -: ``` json { "error": { "http-code": 500, "exception": { "class": "java.lang.NullPointerException" } } } ``` While this reporting might be great for a UI in that we can report something more useful than just error code 500 (although in reality, not much more useful) there's no way that I've found to work out the root of the problem? Are these errors reported somewhere or are they swallowed up and all we get is this error on the REST interface - it's just not very useful for debugging. I have a feeling there's something wrong with thing labels since I'm trying to implement the new label support in HABmin and I may have saved a null label or something.

bug.title: paperUI parameter configuration dropdowns missing label
bug.body: In paperUI the labels for the parameters with dropdowns are missing. ![screenie](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5871213/13174090/b4ea8fc0-d701-11e5-9554-8aac1014232e.png)

bug.title: Things with parameter groups are in longer showing in paperUI
bug.body: With recent build, things with parameter groups are no longer possible to edit the configuration parameters. In the browser console the following error is displayed. possibly related to PR https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/964 note: for the same item, parameter edit it was working without problems, in earlier builds. In habmin the item edit remains working fine (incl showing the parameter right grouping). ``` angular.min.js:102 TypeError: Cannot read property 'name' of undefined at Object.getRenderingModel (services.min.js:893) at controllers.min.js:1964 at getOne (services.min.js:645) at n.$scope.getThingType (controllers.min.js:1960) at controllers.min.js:1976 at getOne (services.min.js:645) at n.$scope.getThing (controllers.min.js:1972) at new <anonymous> (controllers.min.js:1994) at Object.e [as invoke] (angular.min.js:36) at w.instance (angular.min.js:75) ```

bug.title: Service configuration does not consider default values
bug.body: The Configuration->Services menu in the Paper UI does not consider the default values for parameters when pre-filling the UI. This leaves mandatory fields empty and the user has to set values manually, even if a default is defined for them. See e.g. the configuration for the Basic UI.

bug.title: Missing response for newly created rules without UIDs
bug.body: When someone creates a rule without providing the UID using the RuleRegistry or REST, he will not receive the auto-genereted UID

bug.title: Wrong approach for handling the bundles providing automation resources - host and fragments
bug.body: We use "bundle.getEntry" to check if a bundle is a provider of automation resources. This method searches only the contents of this bundle for the entry. Then we check if this bundle is a fragment, and if it is, we do not process it. So, if the host does not contain automation resources then it will not be processed; the fragment will not be processed either - as a result these resources will never be loaded. Also if the host is processed before all it's fragments have been installed, some fragment bundles that are providers will not be processed.

bug.title: Introduce a mechanism to easily register action method signatures
bug.body: The Designer of openHAB 1 had most bundles containing actions included and thus way able to resolve these actions in the rule&script editors (for auto-completion, syntax checks etc.). It also included the possibility to add further bundles in an `addons` folder by the user, although this mechanism never worked well. The ESH Designer only contains a few "core ESH" actions. As it is not feasible to automatically bundle action-addons with it, there should be a way to easily add such method signatures (the code itself is not required for the editors).

bug.title: paperUI does not render option values for integer
bug.body: PaperUI does not render the option value dropdown in case of type=integer. e.g. below will not show any option values, instead only allows to select a numeric value. ``` <parameter name="config_1_1" type="integer" groupName="configuration" min="0" max="65535"> <label>1: Ignore start level</label> <description><![CDATA[ Ignore start level when transmitting a dim command to the dimmer !]]></description> <default>1</default> <options> <option value="0">Ignore</option> <option value="1">Don't ignore</option> </options> </parameter> ```

bug.title: [yahooweather] YahooWeatherDiscoveryService.getWoeidData() URL discontinued
bug.body: One can no longer query Yahoo! YQL with a lat,long to return a WOEID. References: - [Yahoo! Developer forum post](https://developer.yahoo.com/forums/#/discussion/7838/tahoo-geo-placefinder-does-not-work%3D%3D%3D) - [openHAB forum post regarding 1.x weather binding](https://community.openhab.org/t/yahoo-weather-service-issue-weather-binding-1-7-1/6528) - https://github.com/openhab/openhab/pull/3888

bug.title: event condition never satisfied
bug.body: I started using an ItemStateEvent Condition, but it is never satisfied. After some debugging I have a look at the "isSatisfied" method of the EventConditionHandler. The code looks like: ``` java Event event = inputs.get("event") != null ? (Event) inputs.get("event") : null; if (event != null) { return isConfiguredAndMatches(TOPIC, event.getTopic()) && isConfiguredAndMatches(SOURCE, event.getSource()) && isConfiguredAndMatches(PAYLOAD, event.getPayload()) && isConfiguredAndMatches(EVENTTYPE, event.getType()); } return false; ``` If I looked at the content of inputs my event is not named "event", but "trigger_1.event". If I changed the strings, the condition is working. I assume the naming "event" is correct and the function that fills the map have to change the "trigger_X.event" naming to "event". But I do not know any of the automation code... Which code has to be fixed?

bug.title: Rule trigger / action / condition edit: empty fields
bug.body: If I press the edit button of a trigger, action or condition the already filled fields are empty.

bug.title: automation: test failed
bug.body: Building Eclipse SmartHome using maven failed for me (at least once). It could be related to #820 and https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=479215 But perhaps it is also an error in the automation implementation. bug.title: Formatting from items file should have precedence over channel type definition
bug.body: If a formatting pattern is defined in an item file, this should be used. At the moment, this seems to be overridden by the channel type, see https://github.com/openhab/openhab2-addons/issues/629#issuecomment-172208034

bug.title: Circular reference detected
bug.body: I don't know if it is important or not, but when I start openHAB2 beta 1, the first message I get in the logs is: 13:06:14.339 [ERROR] [org.eclipse.smarthome.core.transform] - [org.eclipse.smarthome.action.transformation.action(73)] Circular reference detected, getService returning null

bug.title: NTP binding: hostname parameter not saved
bug.body: Using PaperUI (openHAB2 beta 1), I installed the NTP binding. A ntp:ntp:local thing was created. Then I edited its parameters to switch from default server 0.pool.ntp.org to 0.fr.pool.ntp.org. If I open again the parameters, the value is 0.fr.pool.ntp.org as expected. Now if I stop OH2 (logout command in the console) and start again OH2, when I edit my NTP thing parameters, my hostname is now 0.pool.ntp.org rather than 0.fr.pool.ntp.org

bug.title: PersistenceManager might throw NPE on setModelRepository
bug.body: I just had this in my log: ``` 23:24:52.023 [ERROR] [.eclipse.smarthome.model.persistence] - [org.eclipse.smarthome.core.persistence.manager(180)] The setModelRepository method has thrown an exception java.lang.NullPointerException at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.persistence.internal.PersistenceManager.getAllItems(PersistenceManager.java:313) at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.persistence.internal.PersistenceManager.startEventHandling(PersistenceManager.java:181) at org.eclipse.smarthome.model.persistence.internal.PersistenceManager.setModelRepository(PersistenceManager.java:117) ``` Clearly, the class should not expect the itemRegistry to be set already when the ModelRepository is set. It should only start processing when the component is activated.

bug.title: Basic-UI:Selection item
bug.body: After closing the selection box the mapped text, which belongs to the selected item is not displayed.

bug.title: "LINK" button must be disabled if no item is selected
bug.body: When linking a channel to an item, it is currently possible to click the "LINK" button without having selected an item first, see https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/issues/855. This must be fixed.

bug.title: Could not send Wemo device discovery java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address
bug.body: Hello all, I reported this issue on the OH2 board (https://github.com/openhab/openhab-distro/issues/61) and they asked me to report it over here. Fresh install of OH2-Distro which was released yesterday and this comes up on every boot. I don't use WEMO so it's not a huge issue for me, just an annoyance in the logs. Current System: ``` [_openhab@ha ~]$ cat /etc/redhat-release CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511 (Core) [_openhab@ha ~]$ java -version java version "1.8.0_65" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_65-b17) Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.65-b01, mixed mode) ``` Logs: ``` 13:08:19.149 [ERROR] [.wemo.discovery.WemoDiscoveryService] - Could not send Wemo device discovery java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address at java.net.PlainDatagramSocketImpl.bind0(Native Method)[:1.8.0_65] at java.net.AbstractPlainDatagramSocketImpl.bind(AbstractPlainDatagramSocketImpl.java:94)[:1.8.0_65] at java.net.DatagramSocket.bind(DatagramSocket.java:392)[:1.8.0_65] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo.discovery.WemoDiscoveryService.sendWemoDiscoveryMessage(WemoDiscoveryService.java:152)[145:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo:0.8.0.201601082233] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo.discovery.WemoDiscoveryService.discoverWemo(WemoDiscoveryService.java:120)[145:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo:0.8.0.201601082233] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo.discovery.WemoDiscoveryService.access$0(WemoDiscoveryService.java:118)[145:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo:0.8.0.201601082233] at org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo.discovery.WemoDiscoveryService$1.run(WemoDiscoveryService.java:79)[145:org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.wemo:0.8.0.201601082233] at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)[:1.8.0_65] at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.runAndReset(FutureTask.java:308)[:1.8.0_65] at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.access$301(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:180)[:1.8.0_65] at java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor.java:294)[:1.8.0_65] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)[:1.8.0_65] at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)[:1.8.0_65] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)[:1.8.0_65] ``` Thanks, Ryan

bug.title: Creation of a rule from template fails
bug.body: I am sending a POST request to `/rest/rules` with the following content: ``` { "templateUID": "SampleRuleTemplate", "configuration": { "condition_operator": ">", "condition_constraint": "6" } } ``` I expected a rule to be created based on the referenced template, but if I request the created rule, I get ``` { "enabled": true, "status": { "status": "IDLE", "statusDetail": "NONE" }, "triggers": [], "conditions": [], "actions": [], "configuration": { "condition_operator": ">", "condition_constraint": "6" }, "configDescriptions": [], "templateUID": "SampleRuleTemplate", "uid": "rule_6" } ``` So the reference to the template is not correctly replaced by the rule that is defined by it.

bug.title: Basic UI: scenes cannot be selected multiple times
bug.body: I have quite a few scenes with commands in the resulting drop down list like "close all rollershutters" and "open all rollershutters". In basicui (as well as in greent if I remember correctly) I cannot select the same dropdown item successively. The second selection just has no effect. In the classicui as well as in the iOS-app, the same selection can be done multiple times and the effect is just executed. Workaround is to select some other item in the list first and then select the former one again. However, this is often not what I want as the other item might trigger unwanted actions. Would have to create empty dummy entries that do nothing.

bug.title: BaseThingHandler.editThing() does not preserver State
bug.body: When calling this method somewhere in the Handler, then a new Thing is created, and assigned to handler.thing, but in the process the State of the original Thing is not preserved or copied over (but is set to the default UNINITIALIZED). Moreover, the Thing assigned to handler.thing is not the same object instance as the one that is tracked by the ThingManager. That means that for example in the osgi console, the Thing can be "ONLINE", but the Thing referenced by the handler will be UNINITIALIZED (See also https://www.eclipse.org/forums/index.php/t/1072808/)

bug.title: 500 Request failed while updating a rule
bug.body: Server responds with a 500 Request failed error when we try to update a rule by adding a new trigger of type 'GenericEventTrigger' or 'TimerTrigger' (trigger configuration not specified). The new triggers is however added to the server.

bug.title: 500 Request failed while adding a new rule
bug.body: The server responds with a 500 request failed when we try to add a new rule with a trigger of type 'GenericEventTrigger' (trigger configuration not specified). The error goes away if the type of trigger is changed to something like 'trigger' etc.

bug.title: 409 Conflict while adding a new rule
bug.body: The server responds with a 409 conflict error when we try to add a new rule with a trigger of type 'TimerTrigger'. The error goes away if the type of trigger is changed to something like 'trigger' etc.

bug.title: Hue binding: Workaround for Osram Lightify PAR16 is applied to all lights
bug.body: Recently, a workaround for Osram Lightify PAR16 has been added (#518). However, because [this check in HueLightHandler](https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/blob/master/extensions/binding/org.eclipse.smarthome.binding.hue/src/main/java/org/eclipse/smarthome/binding/hue/handler/HueLightHandler.java#L91) always evaluates to true, this workaround is applied to all lights. The tests do no catch this issue because in the tests the initialize() method is only called for the Osram Lightify PAR16.

-Djetty.home.bundle=org.openhab.io.jetty -Dorg.osgi.service.http.port=8080 -Dorg.osgi.service.http.port.secure=8443 -Dfelix.fileinstall.dir=addons -Djava.library.path=lib -Dequinox.ds.block_timeout=240000 -Dequinox.scr.waitTimeOnBlock=60000 -Dfelix.fileinstall.active.level=4 -Djava.awt.headless=true -jar runtime/server/plugins/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.3.0.v20140415-2008.jar -console On 2015-04-19 16:52:26 -0400, Richard Lavoie wrote: > Github original report at https://github.com/openhab/openhab2/issues/192 On 2015-04-20 04:22:11 -0400, Dennis Nobel wrote: > If there is such leak, it must be inside the used library (see https://github.com/besherman/lifx-sdk-java/releases/tag/1.0). Unfortunately the library is not maintained any more, because there is new version (2.0). But it seems that this version has problem with the new firmware: "The lifx firmware update 2.0 seems to break a few things, we are waiting for the LIFX team to update LIFXKit. In the meantime please try the old 1.0.1 release if you are having problems.". > > Also because of the performance issue I recommend to reimplement the binding maybe using the new library or implementing the full protocol manually. But I do not have time for that at the moment. If someone else wants to fix it, please feel free to create a PR. On 2015-04-20 12:41:26 -0400, Richard Lavoie wrote: > The problem is in the LFXSocketUDP object that opens a socket on line 61, but only closes it when there is an exception but not at the end of the method. I even believe the variable declaration should be outside of the loop. As I don't know much about the protocol either, I'll file a bug on their github with our findings. On 2015-04-20 12:44:16 -0400, Richard Lavoie wrote: > Another possibility would be to create a fork in openhab's github and work on fixes in this version. On 2015-04-20 12:44:45 -0400, Richard Lavoie wrote: > I meant to say smarthome's github, not openhab On 2015-04-20 12:54:32 -0400, Dennis Nobel wrote: > The version 1.0 of the used library is just a fork of the official LIFX Android library with minor adaptions to make it work in pure Java. So the bug should be fixed there, but LIFX stopped all their activities at github (https://github.com/LIFX/lifx-sdk-android/commits/master). > > But the CQ for the library was made based on my fork (https://github.com/dnobel/lifx-sdk-java). My fork again is a fork of of https://github.com/besherman/lifx-sdk-java. So the easiest way to fix this problem would be to create a PR against my fork, rebuild the library, replace it in the binding and create a PR against ESH. We can request another CQ for the updated library based on my fork. > > But on the long-term the binding should definitely make use of another library. On 2015-04-20 12:56:17 -0400, Dennis Nobel wrote: > (In reply to Richard Lavoie from comment # 5) > > > I meant to say smarthome's github, not openhab > > Unfortunately smarthome does not have an own github account. As it is an eclipse project, it is managed under the eclipse account and only eclipse projects can have their own repository their. On 2015-04-20 13:12:45 -0400, Richard Lavoie wrote: > I created an issue explaining the issue at the master lifx project : https://github.com/LIFX/lifx-sdk-android/issues/26 > > I indeed found that it was a forked as the jar name was lifx-sdk-java and not lifx-sdk-android. We could probably work on your fork to fix this issue, but I don't own any lifx gadget to test the fix. On 2015-04-27 09:15:01 -0400, Dennis Nobel wrote: > I assume LIFX will not comment on the PR. I can test the fix in the near future with my LIFX bulbs. On 2015-04-28 05:52:01 -0400, karel goderis wrote: > FYI, I see a lot of these in my logs: > > 2015-04-28 11:49:48 [INFO ] [n.i.t.l.LFXLANTransportManager:99 ] - Connection State did change called. > 2015-04-28 11:49:48 [INFO ] [n.i.t.l.LFXLANTransportManager:104 ] - LFXGatewayDescriptor - Host: 192.168.0.181, Port: 56700, Path: LFXSiteID: 4C4946585632/<LFXBinaryTargetID D073D501EB9F>, Protocol: LX_PROTOCOL_DEVICE_SERVICE_UDP : CONNECTED > 2015-04-28 11:49:48 [INFO ] [n.i.t.l.LFXLANTransportManager:104 ] - LFXGatewayDescriptor - Host: 192.168.0.180, Port: 56700, Path: LFXSiteID: 4C4946585632/<LFXBinaryTargetID D073D501C593>, Protocol: LX_PROTOCOL_DEVICE_SERVICE_UDP : CONNECTED > 2015-04-28 11:49:48 [WARN ] [lifx.java.android.util.LFXLog :45 ] - Idle timeout occured on UDP Connection lifx.java.android.network_context.internal.transport_manager.gateway_connection.LFXUDPGatewayConnection@49e8a025, disconnecting > 2015-04-28 11:49:48 [INFO ] [n.i.t.l.LFXLANTransportManager:99 ] - Connection State did change called. > 2015-04-28 11:49:48 [INFO ] [n.i.t.l.LFXLANTransportManager:104 ] - LFXGatewayDescriptor - Host: 192.168.0.181, Port: 56700, Path: LFXSiteID: 4C4946585632/<LFXBinaryTargetID D073D501EB9F>, Protocol: LX_PROTOCOL_DEVICE_SERVICE_UDP : CONNECTED > 2015-04-28 11:49:48 [INFO ] [n.i.t.l.LFXLANTransportManager:104 ] - LFXGatewayDescriptor - Host: 192.168.0.180, Port: 56700, Path: LFXSiteID: 4C4946585632/<LFXBinaryTargetID D073D501C593>, Protocol: LX_PROTOCOL_DEVICE_SERVICE_UDP : CONNECTED

bug.title: Wemo: motion sensor cannot be discovered
bug.body: migrated from Bugzilla [#482210](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=482210) status UNCONFIRMED severity _minor_ in component _Binding_ for _---_ Reported in version _0.8.0_ on platform _PC_ Assigned to: Project Inbox On 2015-11-14 21:29:03 -0500, Nick Ma wrote: > The WeMo Motion sensor is not discoverable because the code is looking for a device name with "Motion" while the motion sensor device returns "Sensor" in the UPnP response. > > Fix: > - Added a if statement to Look for "Sensor" type > - Added a thing type called "sensor" to map to the new device name > > https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/516#discussion_r44864408

bug.title: Classic UI: Fixes dimmer/rolershutter infinite request bug
bug.body: migrated from Bugzilla [#460320](https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=460320) status ASSIGNED severity _enhancement_ in component _UI_ for _---_ Reported in version _unspecified_ on platform _All_ Assigned to: Sebastian Janzen On 2015-02-19 05:04:34 -0500, Sebastian Janzen wrote: > On long presses, the dimmer widget does XHRs forever, because the touchend-Handler wasn't attached correctly. > > This is based on a openhab 1 upstream change of pull request 2127 (https://github.com/openhab/openhab/pull/2127). On 2015-02-20 09:33:00 -0500, Dennis Nobel wrote: > I guess this bug is related to Classic UI? So I´ll change the title. On 2015-02-22 15:46:36 -0500, Sebastian Janzen wrote: > You're right, Dennis, thanks. > > I created a PR: https://github.com/eclipse/smarthome/pull/207 > > Should I mark this as Resolved? On 2015-02-23 02:16:12 -0500, Dennis Nobel wrote: > Thanks. It will be marked as resolved, when the PR is merged.
